text: Went to Joe's after drinking some beer at nearby Cigar City Brewery. I ordered two slices and a drink for $7 including tax. Great pizza, friendly service, and fun enjoyed by all
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: This is not New York pizza it's thin crust andhorrible the service was horrendous and that's all
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
Freddie 'The Pizza Freak' reporting in on a fantastic pizza and sandwich shoppe. Joe's Pizza is one of my favorite pizza joints, even though I have not written a review earlier, trust me when I say "this places rocks!"
You can get up to 28 inches of pizza goodness here!
True New York style, the blend of cheese and sauce become one so well...you could almost drink it!
I highly recommend you check this place out for great pizza or one of the steak sandwiches served up on an Amoroso's bakery roll...delicious. 
I have eaten pizza in just about every place I can (believe me) and Joe's is a regular stop.
Get in here!!
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Good place to grab a late night bite. I had the pepperoni and sausage pizza. It was pretty delish. I'm glad our drunken nights brought us here, a place Iv driven by almost every day!
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: 2 slices and a drink for 7 bucks even, is pretty good especially for such big slices. Will come back and try their spicy chicken baskets.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
Best Philly in town and great old school handmade pizza, by the slice too.
Simple charm and great prices.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Horrible. I ordered from here and it was the worst. The food is really old. I looked at it and knew not to eat it because i knew it would make me sick. Stay away!!!
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: The restaurant is well lit, has many tables to accommodate a large lunch crowd, and the selection of TVs to watch sports or news is second to none. I have been there 3 times in the past two months and have had a great burger basket w fresh fresh hot french fries.  The burger was great tasting and I am impressed, and a cheesesteak sandwich.  The owners and staff at Joe's were busy and diligent in making the pizzas and wings and were very talkative amongst themselves, but when it came time to serve the food, you the customer were made to feel like a guest in their house.  They were very cordial and suggestive on items to try and they made you feel at home.  On a different visit, I came back for the renowned philly cheese steak, at the prompting of the owner,  which was excellent, I might add, but I wish it was a little bigger like a foot long.  I will definitely be a regular but its a bit far from my place in St. Pete. will try their Pizza / Wings next visit since the sign outside says Joe's Pizza... you think?
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: I haven't been to every pizza place in the Tampa area, but I've been to a lot.  So far this is easily the best NY style pizza I've had. The toppings are excellent and everything I've ordered has consistently been cooked perfectly. They also make a mean Sicilian, which I love, but isn't always available. Don't let the location or its history as a former Taco Bell dissuade you; it's a real hidden gem.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
This pizza is greasy, cheesy, and saucy... And it's perfect that way! This is a must go to pizza spot in Tampa, one of the top five for sure. The wait time has always been reasonable, and if you arrive early they always have a game on. 

I highly recommend the cheese pizza!
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Do not let the location turn you off. This is great NY style pizza at a reasonable price.  We had the 18 inch pizza with drinks and could not have been happier.   Beer is available.  Give it a try.  You will not be disappointed.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
Totally hit the spot on a late night pizza run after the FAMU Classic football game. We got the two slice special with a drink and added hot wings. Delicious NY-style pizza with the perfect amount of cheese and sauce. The wings were hot and crunchy, the way I like em'. 

We got our food to go because it was late and the strip club is next door.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
I was just here this past Saturday and I had to come back today , yea it was that good !

It's official they have the best Sicilian in the Tampa Bay Area. In fact they rival some of the best back home so that gives them a lot of merit in my book.  Excellent crust probably the best dough I've encountered here, even better than Eddie n SAMs who are very good as well and use NY water. 
These guys know what pizza is about. 
My fellow yelpers , trust me it's good. 

This pizza stands up tall on its own purist merit.  If you haven't been here and you are a pizza fanatic like myself , drop what your doin and get your ass down here.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
I  was in the mood for pizza  as I have said, it's a daily craving.  They actually had Sicilian slices a available!! And they actually looked very good as well?? This is not going to end well....  Well for the first time in quite a while this adventure has a happy ending.    Ordered 3 slices and they gave me an extra slice on the house! I asked for just warm and that's how I received it! Wow what a concept , listening to what the customer asks for.  
Sorry for the dramatics . It's just hard for me to find good Sicilian pizza in the Tampa Bay Area so I get all excited. 

Pizza was very good , thick crust good crunch not overly doughy. 
Sauce was actually balanced well not overly sweet nor acidic.   An abundance of well distributed creamy mozza not overly oily either.  
My only small critique would be I would like more garlic in the sauce.  
I'd put them in my pending top 5  best Sicilian , pending on account I will revisit it and see if they are consistent with quality and taste. Yes I take pizza that seriously! 
Staff was very friendly , I look forward to coming back soon!   I'm curious to see well the Zeppole's are.  

Heads up :  They r just south of the mons Venus on the west side of Dale Mabry.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Giving it 4 stars because of the late night crew. I appreciate their no BS down to earth attitude. If you are new or a tourist to the area they will give you the low down about what's on and poppin. The pizza is ok. You won't notice too much of the taste when your drunk. When you not drunk the spot is cool for a quick snack.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
This place is expertly placed next to Mons Venus. There's no alcohol served at Mons Venus just boobies, but Joe's Pizza does serve beer, a most important libation.

And they serve a pretty mean slice of pizza. 

The cashier/server was pretty funny and insanely patient with us at 1a on a Friday night.

The actual facilities are okay, kind of gross.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
I typically go through the drive-thru and just order a couple slices of pizza
but they have so much more than just pizza. They have pastas, sandwiches, burgers,chicken wings , really good hand cut potato chips, and many more items. Give them a try.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: This pizza restaurant makes some of the best New York style pizzas in Tampa. They also make a sandwiches and a few other dishes. My boyfriend and I get a pizza from Joes whenever we crave pizza :)
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
Joe's Pizza provides late night food when you need it most.  Located on N Dale Mabry, they cater to the crowd partaking in the strip clubs, but with drive though pizza it definitely beats the usual fast food late night options.

Joe's pizza is NY style, so expect a slice you can pick up and fold, with a nice crunch to the crust.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Solid pizza. I stopped in around lunch time for a quick slice of pepperoni pizza and got just that. The service was quick and the pizza was pretty good. Thin style with just the right amount of cheese and sauce. The crust was crispy and the pepperoni was tasty. I'll definitely be back.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: So I've tried ALOT of pizza around the Tampa area, I love pizza, who doesn't?! If I must add I am from Long Island so I know what good pizza tastes like... anyways I have been hearing people brag about joes pizza for a while so one day I finally went through the drive through and ordered a large pizza and I FELL IN LOVE it's my new favorite place in Tampa for pizza!!! It's so so good irresistible good, mmmm. So I went again a week later and added a order of garlic knots to try and it was delicious (not that I expected any less) and the marinara sauce served with it just as good. Try this place out! Highly highly recommend.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text:
Been here lotsa times and always had the round Neopolitan type pie. It is a first rate NY pie. The square Sicilian pie however is a horrible doughy nothing. Way too high , barely any sauce and the thinnest layer of cheese. This was not good. Stick to the Neo slices and forget the Sicilian, and yes, I'm a NY native and also a pizza snob.
The four stars are not for the Sicilian. The best Sicilian I've ever had was a small little place in Commack, NY (on Long Island) called Pizza D'Amour and Caserta's on Federal Hill in Providence Rhode Island.
Locally Jet's Deep Dish come closest.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Great pizza overall one of the top pizza places here in Tampa FL. . Really enjoy there food. Would come here again. Their pizza is supper huge!
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Visited here on a late Friday night for some late night pizza. The pizza is simple delicious, I had a cheese slice and dressed it with parmesan cheese and  red pepper...simply delish! The crust is garlic flavored and flavorful. I highly recommend visiting here for late night snacking as they are open late.
name: Joe's Pizza
categories: Restaurants, Pizza

text: Ate Here Today the appetizers are good. Had the  fried Calamari was very good! I had the pasta an didnt really like it.But ate it it was really  too much garlic.I"ll come here for the  appetizers!
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Just visited today for the first time for a birthday celebration. Wanted to try it out. For the most part it was good. My party had for appetizers the onion straws- really onion rings, very good but expected thinner cut due to name; the seafood queso-very good; the gumbo was reported as good ( I didn't eat any);  the fried soft shell crab plate- very good, nice size but way too many fries, should have been served on toast as most places do to for oil draining which flavors the toast; an oyster poboy and a shrimp poboy were over loaded with fresh fried seafood but on a thick ciabatta type bread-not the traditional French bread-the waitress stated they ran out-this should have been mentioned when ordering so if patron only wanted French bread there is a choice; the Westbank seafood plate was good-nice size for price with sides and seasoned well; and a Mardi salad-very fresh with a good vinaigrette. For the birthday person I requested the bread pudding-pretty presentation but improvement on the recipe needed- too dry, either microwaved too much or not enough moisture in the recipe- glad it was comp'd-would not have been happy to have paid for it. 
Overall the atmosphere was nice, pretty renovation of the place that used to be a Copeland's, all of the condiments were served in little cups, which was ok but a squeeze bottle of Blue Plate mayo was on the table, very out of place, but at least it was Blue Plate (the only mayo of Louisiana!). Finally, prices were reasonable, although the 20% auto gratuity was a bit much for a party of 5. I don't believe in auto gratuity, I know everyone doesn't tip like they should, I always do and usually give more depending on service received with a smile, but when auto, I never give more. Just my policy, I have family whom work in the service industry whom depend on their tips so I understand a lot of people don't even tip. 
I will return again to try other dishes on the menu I saw, in the future. 
I hope the owners read the reviews, a good owner takes in the comments of their patrons for improvement or not.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I was hoping that the restaurant that replaced Copeland's in this space would be a regular in my rotation of Westbank restaurants. I left extremely disappointed after being overcharged for jambalaya that resembled Zatarain's boxed mix and a gumbo that was underwhelming in flavor. Maybe I went too early, maybe I went on a bad day, but I will not be back until the menu prices drop.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Waiting staffs r great but raw oysters r dirty n torn. We order the seafood stuff mushrooms n it is dry n salty. The 2 lbs lobster was actually 1 1/4 pound.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: My siblings and I came in last night for dinner for the first time. The server was great she was very friendly and brought the refills for our drinks when she saw needed and checked if we needed anything often without being annoying. We had chargrilled oysters and Rockefeller for appetizer. Entree: 2 lobster pasta, crawfish etouffee, 8oz filet mignon, chicken Caesar salad,  crab cakes, and Mac and cheese. The sad part is no one liked their food. Lobster pasta tasted like they just dumped a can of tomato paste in the pasta and mixed it into the linguine and the lobster was over cooked which caused it to be chewy. Crawfish etouffee was too salty. Filet mignon tasted like a over cooked sirloin it came with potatoes and vegetables that look like the whole plate been sitting under the light for a long time. As for the chicken caesar salad the chicken was so dry and it had way too much dressing on the plate and it was too creamy. Crab cakes barely had any crab in it and it was just full of stuffing. We ordered Mac and cheese for my niece and it looked like it was made from a Kraft box and dried. My niece usually eats her Mac and cheese and this time she ate a little bit and didn't want it. We spent over $200 and left this restaurant having to go eat at another restaurant right after. For the first time ever that my family had to do that. Very disappointing.  I forgot that we had calamari too...flavorless and oily
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Came out tonight for dinner. Split a salad which was tasty but could've had a little more substance. I didn't really see the "crab" that was supposed to be in it. I got the redfish pontchatrain which the veggies and potatoes were really good. Fish was decent. Not sure it's worth $32. My dad had a filet. It tasted good and seasoned to me but the meat was kind of tough for a filet and it was overlooked. The waitress said they would take care of it. We didn't really even complain about it- just gave our honest opinion on the dish. But the check came and it wasn't taken care of. I guess that's where my low rating comes from. Don't say you'll comp something and then not comp it. I thought maybe she just didn't put my to go order on the bill to make up for the steak "comp" but it turned out that she just forgot to put my to go order in all together. So then I had to re order my to go dish for my mom after we had finished dinner and waited another 20 minutes after our meal for it. And then she kindly brought me the check for the to go plate. Little confusing but whatever. Maybe I'll come back to give it another chance.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Went here to eat with a few friends last week. The food overall was decent. 

The newly renovated building looks nice from the outside, but I feel like the prices do not match with their strange ambiance inside. For example, one side of the restaurant has nice looking tables. The other side of the restaurant uses these cheap, brown laminate tables. It's so weird! Maybe they can decor with some cloth tablecloths or something because honestly, it just feels so strange. Reminds me of eating at a cafeteria. 

The appetizers we ordered were seafood gumbo, chargrilled oysters,and their version of the bang bang shrimp. It was just average. Nothing too unique or special about it. The cheese used on the oysters tasted a little strange. Nothing a little salt could not fix. The shrimp was way too sweet for me. So beware, if you don't want diabetes! :P

The fried seafood platter was very good. It came with a softshell crab, oysters, shrimp and catfish with fries and hushpuppies.It was deifnitely big enough to split with 2-3 people. 

One of the other guests at the table ordered  a roast beef po-boy, but for some reason it was not on po boy bread. It seemed more like a fancy sandwich. The bf ordered the grilled Mahi-Mahi which was pretty good. Tasted very fresh. 

Overall worth a try, but skip if you are going on a fancy date unless you are going to be seated on the fancy side of the restaurant. :P Also, if you are eating in a group make sure to bring cash. They only accept two credit cards per table. Also, they charge 20% gratuity to groups of 5 or more.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Flavorless and overpriced.  2 out of 3 meals were awful.  For Louisiana seafood it had none of the Louisiana flavors I'm use too, and tasted like it was steamed and previously frozen.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Came out tonight for dinner. Split a salad which was tasty but could've had a little more substance. I didn't really see the "crab" that was supposed to be in it. I got the redfish pontchatrain which the veggies and potatoes were really good. Fish was decent. Not sure it's worth $32. My dad had a filet. It tasted good and seasoned to me but the meat was kind of tough for a filet and it was overcooked. The waitress said they would take care of it. We didn't really even complain about it- just gave our honest opinion on the dish. But the check came and it wasn't taken care of. I guess that's where my low rating comes from. Don't say you'll comp something and then not comp it. I thought maybe she just didn't put my to go order on the bill to make up for the steak "comp" but it turned out that she just forgot to put my to go order in all together. So then I had to re order my to go dish for my mom after we had finished dinner and waited another 20 minutes after our meal for it. And then she kindly brought me the check for the to go plate. Little confusing but whatever. Maybe I'll come back to give it another chance. 

Update: came back using a groupon today but for take out. Wait staff was VERY nice. I could def see a change. Manager was super accommodating and really nice both over the phone and in person. All of the waiters were so friendly with my daughter while we waited in the front to order. Even the bartender was sweet and friendly (older guy- wish I would've caught his name). Crab and corn soup was fabulous and one of the best I've tasted, stuffed mushroom appetizer was overcooked and honestly tasted like nothing. Redfish dish was excellent just like last time and it looks like they lowered the price, bravo.  I could see myself coming back and hanging in the bar :)
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
LaFitte's is a new venture of A J Tusa, owner of New Orleans  Creole Cookery.

Large parking lot just off LAPLCO Blvd & Manhattan.

Nice decor, clean dining area, diverse menu.

We ordered stuffed lobster, mahi-mahi, & stuffed catfish platter.

Lively locals crowd, noisy, cold beer, can't hear music for din.  

"New" waitstaff is being trained.  Expect a little confusion.

Our foods were all disappointing; but folks at nearby tables had much better looking fried seafoods of several kinds.

My advice is to stick with salads, remoulade, & fried  shrimp, catfish, oysters, & softshells.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I visited this restaurant with my family during lunch time. We were seated immediately. It did, however, take a while for the waitress to come to the table. We ate gumbo, 1/2 oyster po-boy with potato salad, jambalaya with fried catfish   & the fried shrimp plate from the kid menu.Overall the food was good...gumbo wasn't bad, potato salad was tasty,oysters were tiny, but tasty, fried shrimp were a decent size and nicely portioned for a kids plate...jambalaya and fried catfish were pretty good as well. We will definitely go back.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: This is actually my very first time making a review for any business. Because this has been the WORST place I have ever been, I thought I warn others. Everything is pre-made and they messed up our entire order. The worst part about it, is that we get our check and they had items on our receipt that we did not purchase.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Really if I order a three course meal
Soup App and Entree
I don't want it out at the same time.. just because I ordered it at the time it's still a 3 course meal.. don't tell me differently.. I know what I ordered 
The food itself was ok.. you could seasoned it a bit more
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: This restaurant just opened up next to Best Western. Used to be a Copeland's. The menu has a seafood theme to it. For my appetizer I tried the spinach and artichoke dip. It was pretty good. For my entrée I had the half shrimp and half catfish. That was also pretty good too. The prices start at about $15 for entrée meals and the appetizers are about $8. Overall I had a good experience and a good meal. I will definitely be going back.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Food was underwhelming with the exception of the fries which were amazing. The service was not good, while our server provided everything we needed it took extremely lengthy periods of time to get it, so much so we went to the bar repeatedly to order alcohol because we were tired of waiting. The inside looked like that of an unfinished restaurant with bare walls and little decorative art. None of the employees were wearing matching attire which looked quite unprofessional for what is supposed to be an "upscale" place. We gave it a try but have no intention of going back. I don't see the place lasting long.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Went there for quick lunch.  We had $30 Groupon coupon.  We told waitress when we were seated that we had a coupon .  She said no problem.  She told us to download the app and we can get a free appetizer.  We downloaded the app and ordered the free onion rings.  Thank God for the remoulade sauce.  They were free so we didn't complain.  (At least we thought they were)  We both ordered the stuffed catfish.  The food was very bland but we were thinking we had a $30 Groupon coupon and free appetizer so we would get out of there fairly cheap. When it was time to pay, the manager said they could only honor 1 coupon, despite what we were told. We told her use the groupon. She came back and said the system wouldn't take the Groupon code. She honored the free app coupon. We would not have gone if we didn't have the Groupon, as they are overpriced. I can honestly say it is not worth the money the food is all bland with no seasoning. Salt didn't even help it.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I am never patronizing this business again! My husband and I ordered oysters (Oyster Rockefeller/Raw) Wednesday night. I complained my Oyster Rockefeller tasted burned but received no reimbursement for my order. Thursday morning my husband and I had a severe case of food poisoning at which time I emailed the director of Lafittes Landing  (advising her of a possible bad batch of oysters served to us the previous evening)due to our food poisoning. I received a response of "thanks,I will investigate". I was never offered any compensation,apologized to or offered a complimentary meal/reimbursement for our previous meal. This is not the proper way to run a business.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Great food and service! Outstanding seafood platter! Grilled oyster the best. Red fish was cooked perfect!
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Well, a previous visitor got it right.   The waitress was nice.  However, the food is less desirable.  Presentation okay, but the food was room temperature, po-boy bread hard as a hoagie! The prices are crazy expensive for what they have to offer.  Don't believe I will return nor will I believe I will suggest.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Took my beautiful wife out for Sunday dinner today Dec 11,2016. Well we ordered the fried pickles which were quite good.  We ordered the Pecan  crusted red fish and the catfish Decatur.   The Pecan crusted catfish was very bland and really Not tasty.  The waiter had the manager come to the table but he only said we will look into doing a better job.  The catfish Decatur was ok but not what we expected.   We will bot be going back and do not recommend to others.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: The wait staff didn't come to the table to greet us, the manager did about 20 minutes into us sitting down. Server was polite and manager was as well. We ordered red wine and got brought white, which we took anyway because it was good. The charbroiled oysters were great. We were greeted by the owner, sweet man. Very nice. Ordered shrimp and grits. Not the best we've ever tasted (huge portion for $18), but the shrimp were good. Now taking 25 mins to get our check to go, again the manager had to tell the waiter we were ready to go. The manager helped us out and was great giving us a discount.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I visited the second night they had been open serving and I had the Gumbo as a starter which was a very good and meaty gumbo. My entree was the port loin porterhouse and I have to say it was the tenderest piece of pork I have had the pleasure of eating in a very long time. The service was good considering they were just in their second night. I would take anyone there to eat because it's that good.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
I'm home visiting and my fiancé and we're craving some good food from home..

I guess I should have thought twice!

We ordered chargrilled oysters and 2 ( po-boy & soup combos)

40 minutes later all we had was the oysters and not even an apology for the wait!

Miraculously when we asked to the cancel the order because  we'd watched two other tables come in after us eat and leave, our food was ready.

Low and behold, one order came with the wrong soup and we had to take it to go.

The table next to us was confused as well and started to question why no one was told there would be a wait!

$50 / 1 hour and the restaurant wasn't busy! 

Needless to say we will not be recommending this plane and will not return upon our next visit.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Decided to give new restaurant a chance since am a west banker. Ordered pasta with shrimp. Was very tasty. Ordered luncheon special and portion was plentiful. Good hot French bread to go with meal but the waitress seemed a little shy. Maybe some training??  She should smile too. Enjoy the job. When my friend and I asked for butter, we only received one pat (packaged) per person per request. Wait time for food was acceptable and quality of food was good. The lunch menu is fairly priced but the dinner/supper menu is a bit over priced. The restaurant is decorated nicely but is obvious it is new. 

Hoping they weather the economy since not too many nice restaurants succeed on the West Bank.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I came here with a couple of locals and it was a first for all of us. We sat oin the bar and the service was very good. We found the food to be prepared well and generously portioned. The desserts were fantastic as well.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: We went  Saturday  February 11. My husband ordered  blackened lobster with pasta. The lobster  was not  blackened. It was tough . I ordered the filet mignon. The meat was very fatty. I don't think it was really a filet. We had heard that they got a new chef and the food was much better.  Well it is not. Very  over priced and I don't think the meat is of high quality. I think it is very over priced low quality food. I could have gone to Outback and got a better quality steak and come home with change in my pocket.  I would not recommend this place. Very very disappointed.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Decided to give the new restaurant a try. First thing I can say is that the staff was attentive and helpful. 

Started off with the cocktails and the Martinis were very good and the Beer was very cold. We had the calamari and the spinach dip. Both were very good. 

Dinner came quickly there after and the portions were large and delicious. Make sure to leave some room dessert. 

We had the bananas foster cheesecake and the white chocolate bread pudding. Huge slices and tasty. 

The over all experience was good but what really stood out was Sydney. She was excellent. Very knowledgeable of the menu, prompt with a great attitude. 

We will be back and will be asking for Sydney again.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
When I saw a new "fancy" restaurant was opening in my hood, I was pretty excited. Super bonus: they have shrimp and grits on the menu! I am giving the place a 3.5 stars just because they have only been open about a month and they are still working out some issues.

We were here for lunch and there was a good crowd, but it wasn't packed. They have a pretty diverse menu with things like fried catfish, shrimp and grits, pasta and even lobster. I decided to be less predictable this time and I get the corn and crab bisque and the fried catfish Lafitte lunch special which came with sausage jambalaya.

The waitress brought out my entree before my corn and crab bisque. I had intended the bisque to be my appetizer, but I guess I should have mentioned that, The catfish was interesting. It was topped with red sauce (which the waitress mentioned ahead of time) and it was fried nicely. The jambalaya was okay, but didn't really dazzle me.

The corn and crab bisque was just okay, as well. It didn't taste the way other bisque I have had in the past tasted. I don't know how to explain it, but I was expecting more. My dad got the shrimp and pasta and wasn't that into it either. He was so not into it that he let me take his leftovers home so I could eat it later. When I tried it, all it was was flavorless pasta and overcooked shrimp- disappointing.

Our waitress was beyond sweet and made sure that we were happy with everything. Like I said, this spot has only been open a month so I expect them to work out the issues and do okay. One suggestion: you offer an entree of shrimp and grits for $19; I would love if you would offer an app size for maybe half that price.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I'm not going to lie. Maybe not a 5 star place, but I feel like people give 5 stars out here willy nilly for places that really don't deserve it (I'm looking at you West Bank steakhouse that is in a random looking building). This place is on point. For lunch anyway, I haven't checked out the dinner vibe. However, the bar area has a laid back atmosphere with a great music selection. The chargrilled oysters were phenomenal! All of the staff was friendly and made sure we were enjoying our time including the oyster shucker. The owner came and stopped by to check in on us. Drinks are a little pricey, but good nonetheless. This will be our date day place for sure when we can sneak away for lunch.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: I honestly would never thought that a place located in this area would serve good food. The fried cat fish taste just like the fish you would eat at a cookout. It is fried to your liking. The Jambalaya is cooked how the vendors at the French Quarter Fest and the Jazz Fest cooked theirs. It is so delicious to say your mom or uncle did not cook it. There is always a table available so you hardly have to wait. The to go orders are always hot and ready like Little Caesars. The managers are always on the floor greeting each customers. There is a special each day. The hours isn't early bird friendly, but it'll do if you ever want to meet a few friends and family there. Stop by and ask for Sydney, she is a great waitress.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: The spinach artichoke was to salty., shrimp pasta was over cooked , good oysters , bad Bloody Mary- bacon at bottom .. Slow service .. But waiter was nice ... Won't be back though ...
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Since I'm a Westbanker, I tried this place out.  It's the old Copeland's building on Lapalco.  The waitress we had was very nice and attentive.  There were employees watching over the tables almost too much....The food was way overpriced!  My husband and I have no problem paying for quality meals, but $18 for a hamburger steak that lacked seasoning?  $21 for Coconut shrimp that looked and tasted frozen.  We will not return.  It was so bad, I didn't even take any pictures.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text:
Friendly staff and delicious food! I am not going to lie- I did not have high expectations for a restaurant in a Best Western but I was pleasantly  surprised. The service was fantastic! So friendly.

We had Sunday brunch specials- alligator hash, shrimp Creole and biscuits, and eggs lafitte (French toast, poached egg, crawfish ettouffe with bacon). The alligator hash was freaking delicious!
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: The food is kinda flavorless and small portioned, unless you order a bucket of seafood. Even then it's not that great of a portion. We actual got served undercooked fish the last time we went, which coincidentally was the last time we will ever go back. Our server was AWESOME though, but the manager definitely wasn't. She tried to blame him for our food being bad.

text: Besides tasteless. Had the seafood salad which was over priced.  But how you mess up a salad.  So they so called had this dressing already on there. Well I had to ask for some Ranch dressing. And that was tasteless. I will not be returning. If you can give a lame salad no telling how the other food will taste.

text: Good food and great service. I have no idea what these bad reviews are about. Give it a try...support westbank restaurants!

text: 1st. time here for lunch, . The hostess & waitress was very good, I was seated in the area I asked for, waitress was on point. I got excited to see chicken & waffles on the menu so I ordered it. It came with 1 large waffle & 6 small chicken strips looked good, it went down hill from their, the chicken strips was a half chicken breast cut into small strips noooooo.. seasoning not even salt, the waffle outside was nice and brown & hot the inside was ice cold it is served with a to-go pack of syrup (McDonalds type) the cost is $10.00. sent it back & ordered something else. I have been waiting 15 minutes and the manger have not come to speak to me. I opted to order  the stuffed catfish... O my it's frozen fish or Swai not LA/ MS or no other fresh catfish it's awful. I'm out of here & will never return. I arrived @ 1:00 and the place have 3 other guest. Let that be a Red flag. Don't open a new restaurant and think the community will accept poor quality food.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: Went to have a nice dinner tables were crowded server mixed up sweet tea with unsweet my 32dollar redfish had sauce on potatoes not my fish was looking forward to a good place to eat on the westbank  guess I have to cross the river for a 150dollar meal
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House

text: I had the seafood salad, dressing was just ok and it was a bit bland.   My husband had the eggs lafitte from the brunch menu,  again it was just ok.   We ordered the mac- n-cheese which was boxed so $6 is too high.   Timothy was our waiter.   He kept forgetting creamer for coffee then took forever just for a 2nd cup.   He then automatically put on 20% gratuity.  The service wasn't good.   We used to work in restaurants so to have gratuity at 20% for a party of 3 adults and 2 toddlers was unnecessary.   It's very unlikely that we'll return.
name: Lafitte's Landing Seafood House
categories: Restaurants, Soup, Seafood, Burgers

text: First time diner and I will definitely be back.  The food was awesome.  Best fried cheese and wings I've had in a while.  Shelby was our server.  She did a great job.  I'm looking forward to coming back next week.  I can't believe on Thursday tall PBR drafts are 2.50.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Food was ok. We were there to watch playoff hockey. Waitress was horribly inattentive. Never did bring water even though I asked for it three times. She hardly stayed at the table long enough for us to even ask for appetizer and had to flag her down multiple times for everything else that evening.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Arrived to restaurant and were informed we could sit at bar to avoid waiting for service.  We located seating at the high top bar which we were told would be adequately serviced. Our waiter approached asking if we wanted drinks and ordered water. After waiting nearly 20 minutes our waiter returned requesting our order, as she sat down menus.. We politely informed her that we did not receive menus and would need time to order. She indicated she would return in a moment to place our order. After another 10 minutes she returns and took our order. My salad was right however we were not provided utensils, which I had to go fetch myself. My husband also inquired if a specific game could be showed on the tv. Our waitress stated she would check and returns to tell my husband he would need to ask all 8 folks sitting at the bar if it would be okay to change one of the tvs that's showing the same things as 2 other tvs. The final thing that has disappointed me and caused me to waste my time to make this complaint is that 2 men who arrived nearly 5 minutes after us placing our order were provided their food (nachos) before us who also had ordered one nacho. 

Contacted management with no response! Nice atmosphere, HORRIBLE service!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Better than Hooters for both food and scenery.  The servers here are certainly friendlier.

The food is okay, basically pub food.  The menu is small, but who comes to a restaurant like this looking for an expansive menu?

We've been in a couple of times for lunch.  They usually are seating immediately.

The biggest downside is the parking lot.  Some of those potholes could swallow a car.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Probably the worst service ever... Was here on a Sunday evening with a group of 4 to get drinks and a couple apps.  My friend was served the wrong beer twice.  My drink took so long that the ice was melted by the time I got it.  I asked for a straw for my water and my server said "there's no water in there." No lie. Manager tried to fix the situation and she was polite and slightly more helpful.  The food we did receive was tasty, if cold. At least it was an entertaining night!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: My burger was extremely greasy and my fries were very cold. The waitress was also not helpful to me and my fiancés friends. She seemed preoccupied talking to other waitresses and the hostess.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
It's basically a Hooters on steroids. 

PROS:
-It was bikini night, and twin Peaks actually hires attractive, young girls, that guys enjoy having in our presence.
-No motorcycle gangs- we're in NE Indy, not Amarillo:) 
-Beer was f'n cold, great selection (Bells Oberon on tap), and the prices are reasonable.
-Above average bar food. 
-Large outside patio

CONS:
-Nothing special, as they didn't reinvent the wheel, as far as these types of restaurants are concerned.
-I'm sure some women's lib group classifies this establishment as sexist.
-I'm sure the LGBT mafia will demand that Twin Peaks hires a multitude of transgender species to flaunt their stuff...you know, because 3% of the population should dictate what the rest of the nation wants.
-I'm sure yelp HQ still hates me.

A decent place. I'd definitely return to watch the games, as there are tons of TV's, and the service was spot on as well.

3.5 stars
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

The Pecks Smapler is a nice choice with boneless wing, mozzarella bites and fried pickles are a good starter or meal depending one your appetite. 

The spicy Thai wings are a good side item to go with the sampler

text: Good beer selection, good food, nice servers, poor execution. Last two visits, two order problems. First, completely wrong order brought to table. They brought our actual order soon after, and gave us the wrong order at no charge. Wasn't bad. Second time, 50 min wait for food. Lost order. Food comped. Not a good trend for what should be SOP. At least they make good on their errors
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I had my fantasy football draft here.  The staff took great care of us.  Jessica was our server.  She absolutely rocked.  Paul Gellar was the manager on duty.  He was extremely nice and polite.  Paul even helped set up the room for my fantasy football draft.    The food was top notch.  Most of the guys in my league have never been to Twin Peaks.  They told me that they will become regulars because of the food and service.  I'm looking forward to visiting Twin Peaks again soon.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
This is another one of those breastaurants with girls in minimal clothing who go through "auditions" for their jobs rather than interviews. It makes for a good place to get some beers and watch football with the guys, and at least this place is a little more unique than some of the other ones around.

I made it here on a Friday night to meet with a group of 10 friends. They had a large table reserved for us, and we were seated quickly. The place is really cool inside, with a lodge vibe that looks like something you would see up in the mountains. It was large, and it wasn't very full the one time I was here. There are more than enough TVs to see whatever sporting event you want to watch without having to turn your head very far.

Their menu consists of appetizers, burgers, sandwiches, and a surprising selection of dinner entrees. We ended up with a few appetizers that were pretty good, and a whole bunch of wings. I went with their "smoked and grilled" bone-in wings, which were phenomenal. I got them with sauce, but I would probably just get them plain with a sauce on the side since they were that good. They were some of the best wings I've had in the city. That being said, they were also pricier than most, but at least you get what you pay for.

I was surprised to see a decent selection of good local beers on tap. They also had a couple beers under the Twin Peaks brand, and quite a few of the largely distributed craft beer brands. And of course, you can always get an ice cold glass of light domestic stuff as well. 

Service, especially considering we had such a large group, was fantastic the entire time we were eating and drinking. Drinks never went empty before getting a refill and our food came out much quicker than expected. Unfortunately, for some reason that we never figured out, our server went MIA as we were wrapping up and we had to wait around a while before we could actually ask for checks. At least we were done, so the empty glasses and plates in front of us didn't need refilled, but it was still frustrating to be stuck there as we were ready to leave. If it wasn't for that snafu, the service would have gotten 5/5.

I don't have as much of a bias against large chain restaurants as the rest of Yelp tends to have, and I was very happy with what we ended up with out of this place. The food was great, our service was almost great, it is a neat place and there are lots of TVs, the beer list was probably the one shortfall and even it wasn't that bad. I would definitely go back if I was looking for a sports bar in the area.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Where do I start. Their food has always been fantastic, BUT if you are looking for great service to go along with it, DO NOT GO THERE! My three friends went here for dinner. (2 females and 2 males.) Compared to tables that had all males at them, our service was not appreciated and neglected. These girls need to get their heads back on their shoulders. If you want a good tip and no complaints, then do your job to your highest ability. The manager apologized for the service but didn't do anything to comp for the meal that was half-assed. My fiancé had one drink the entire meal which was served at the bar during our long wait for our table. There was no refills given during our meal. The waitress didn't check on us after we received our food. Two of the plates were delivered 10 minutes after the other 2 plates had been delivered to the table. My fiancé ordered one beer and the waitress never brought it. When we asked her if the beer was almost ready because we were now wanting to leave since we had finished eating our meals, she apologized and had to re-order it because she forgot to place the order. I have never received such horrible service. We won't be back. Texas get your shit under control in Indiana, because you are falling apart!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
First time here. Food is OK. Chicken fingers are the typical "frozen out of a bag" kind. To be expected at a sports bar. Beers are wonderfully cold, with a solid selection. That gets a star. Lots of big screens for any sporting event you can request. Another star. Servers have a sexy "Paul Bunyans secret mistress" thing going. On task as well. They never let the beer go empty. +2 stars. 

Now, for the manager to address. On this cold night, a group of a$$-hats stood in the patio door, smoking and drafting the place out. People need to smoke outside. Most people don't enjoy a cold 20 knot cross wind filled with second hand smoke.   I have walked out of places that don't control their second hand smoke. Get a grip on that before you lose customers. Oh, and -2 stars.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Our server was about as bad as it gets, bartenders even worse. Its new so they have to ween out there staff but I was pretty disappointed, 1 highlight was the pretzel w cheese, but its pretty hard to screw that up.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: First time at the Peaks.  Was asked if it was my first time and I said yes.  To no further response.   First impression, when one thinks about a breastaurant, they think about bubbly personalities, big beautiful smiles, wings and beer.  Even if not any in depth conversation is had, it's not hard to approach a table with a smile.   When Tabatha first approached she has no smile and felt like she had better places to be.   No smile, no interest in the table (a tip for any waiter or waitress and isn't rocket science that's how one makes it in the industry working off of tips) which could have been fairly easy for her as it was just me a harmless 34 year old whom had been cutting down trees for several hours earlier to help a friend who can't do it on their own and as it was 95 out all I wanted was a cold beer and sandwich and the peaks was less than 5 blocks from the house I was at.  I had my girlfriend's nephew with me and had him helping me work outside.  He's  a harmless 18 year old who was more interested in the soccer game on the tele than the women working.   I ordered a BLT and he ordered a Philly.  Both were fresh, fairly fast and quite good.  I asked for pepper and it took a couple minutes, but it finally came.  Seems odd not to have pepper around within reach.  This could have been a great place to visit, but doubt I'll go back.   First impressions are everything.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
The first time I visited I thought maybe it was me so I figured I would give them another try. Nope  not me. 

The fried pickles and french fries were good. Probably because they have seasoning. 

I heard the fish n chips was good but I normally don't get that at a sports bar. I really had my mind set on wings. I guess the only seasoning on the wings is the sauce. 

I tried twice... ‍
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Good food had the chicken shrimp combo was real good fries way to salty. . . Wife had fish tacos she says it was really good. .   Overly friendly staff but to be expected out of a hooter . . . . Tilted kilt kinda establishment.  . . . Music selection was kinda something out of a late night club seen

text: This place makes the girls at Hooters look covered up.  the burger I had was good but its seriously demeaning to have a gimmick where your  and want tservers have their breasts almost popping out of their tops just to get people to go here. Don't waste your money unless you're sexist

categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Just had lunch with the family here.  Yeah the girls are scantily clad.  So what?  They're little girls.  The food was average at best.  Our Pulled Pork Sliders were tasteless and borderline cold. The kids Mac n' Cheese was pretty spicy- not a good idea for kids. This place is a glorified Appleby's, though not as good.  If the place actually had smoking hot WOMEN, good food, and good beer, then that might be great.  It doesn't.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Went to Twin Peaks for my Dad's birthday with some family over the weekend.  I got there early with my wife and we ordered a few beers to get started.  They are known for their server's questionable attire(kinds like Hooters) and their 29 degree draught beer.  They actually have a digital reading on the wall of the beer temperature.  They serve it in a frosted 22oz mug.  

The beer was definitely cold that's for sure!  Once everyone else arrived, we started with some appetizers.  We ordered chips and queso with venison chili, two orders of stacked nachos with chicken, and two orders of fried pickles.  The kitchen was definitely moving slow, and it seemed like the front of the house was understaffed.  Both probably were.  The food arrived and was all pretty decent.  I ended up eating a whole order of nachos to myself and decided to be fat and order mozzarella bites for dinner.  Everyone else got actual entrees.  

Everyone seemed to enjoy the rest of their food.  I noticed on the way out there were a LOT of open tables all over the place but they were on a 45 minute wait.  There's no excuse for being understaffed on a Saturday in Castleton.  Not to mention there was a fight about to start which required a 5 dollar cover, I mean come on.  Twin Peaks seems like a good place to grab a few brews and snacks during a game as long as you're willing to wait for service.  Our server did do a good job with the hand she was dealt though.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: We seem to do a wing night here about once a month to two months since TP opened.  We have always had friendly and competent service.  I will say we always go during the week and fairly early, before the parking lot fills up.  I would say the food is adequate and probably on par with Tilted Kilt and better than Hooters which I would put in the same genre.  My favorite dinner there is the cajun fish tacos.  Last time I went there I tried the Catfish/Chicken/Shrimp basket and it was good but I ended up regretting not getting the tacos.  Other good dishes include the meat loaf, burger, and the Belt sandwich.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I came here for dinner with an associate last week before a movie. It wasn't busy which was surprising to me. I was seated right away. It's a Cabin like Bar set up. Everything is wood but moreso like a cabin scenery with 2 huge bars stocked with alcohol. One thing I've noticed is that they hire pretty women, hence the name Twin Peaks...you'll catch that on the way home. My waitress was Elizabeth...all the way from AZ...very pretty lady with tattoos and piercings. Anyway, I sat by the fireplace because I was cold (you would think "why on a summer day?")...I'm always cold. Anyway, it's typical bar food like fried pickles, wings, a few salads, burgers (a lot of their burgers are filled with bacon...so unless you don't mind having very high cholesterol...go for it...I couldn't do it and I love bacon). Anyway I got the Steak salad (med. rare...just the way I like it) with a cilantro lime vinaigrette dressing. For the most part it was really good, I just wish it had a little sweetness to it, just to counter all of the savory flavors of the steak. My associate ordered the meatloaf with broccoli and mashed potatoes. The meatloaf looks like a steak. It's baked and grilled, however it is shaped like a steak. He said it was good. I didn't want to eat too much it was getting late. I contemplated on a dessert which was a bread pudding and some sort of brownie with 2 scoops of vanilla ice cream and a whole bunch of fixings...it sounded really good, I just think I was in the mood for something that heavy right before a movie. Overall it was a pretty good experience. Next time I go, I have to try their wings...from what I hear, everyone says they are really good. I can only do it on weekends...no fried food during the week :( I'll write a better review once I've had a second try and i'll be able to tell you how I really feel. P.S. my waitress was great...I hope I get her again.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
My friend has been telling me about this place for awhile now. I finally got the chance to go and was so glad I did! 

The food was fantastic and so was the service. I asked my server, Eboni, surprise me with her recommended dish, she hit it out of the park with the Southwest Style Chicken. It had amazing flavor and my friend had the Philly Cheesesteak, which was also delicious. 

The atmosphere was neat and there are more than enough screens to keep you up on games. Def try it out. Eboni was our server, and did a great job! Thank you all for a great experience!!! I'll def be back!!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
We went here for the cheesiness factor, and because we heard this was the "foody" version of all the "breastaurants," and because it was conveniently located. Cheesy: Check! For foodies: Absolutely not. I wasn't expecting some extensive menu, but likewise wasn't expecting such a limited selection of food items. I settled on the pulled pork sliders, which were "okay," although a bit bland. The atmosphere was as expected: pretty tacky, with lots of blue-collar type men sitting around the bar probably operating under the delusion that the scantily clad women working there were even remotely interested in them. 

A two star experience, but I'm giving it 3 anyway because I'm feeling generous and because it's relatively new.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Stopped by for lunch with a buddy.  Decent food, friendly staff and huge beer selection.  Jennifer was our server and she was awesome!  The place was packed for a Friday lunch.  We both ordered burgers and were satisfied with them.  The fries were heavily seasoned... maybe a bit too much but I ate them.  I will be back.  There were several items on the menu that looked great!  Oh! The interior of the place is really cool.  I don't think they changed much from the previous place.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: The restaurant was clean and food was pretty delicious  but the service struggled quite a bit. We waited about 15-20 minutes from our initial greeting before placing our order which included an appetizer. Our drinks were delivered to another table. The mozzarella bites were good! My blt and tomato soup were delicious.  My husband said his burger was ok.  We asked for a to-go box and server cleared away a plate with 3 chicken tenders on it that we had intended to box. However, our server was friendly. We chalked the disappointing service up to being a new restaurant -- they are probably still working out the kinks and getting everyone trained. We will probably go back another time.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Pros: Decor, Alcohol variety, Simple menu selections, TV placement for sports viewing, friendliness of the staff and of course the "scenic views."

Cons: Restrictions on glass size for beer selections with higher ABV% (If you're not driving, then your glass size shouldn't matter), the drive in and out of the parking lot is riddled with potholes, menu items are overpriced for food has is only average in quality. 

The other guests in my party felt that their food was about average, but overpriced for what amounts to being nothing more than your typical bar food. I ordered the Ghost Pepper wings after being informed by the waitress that they were "really hot," but they were nothing of the sort. The wings were small, dry,  overcooked and the heat level of the sauce was very disappointing. Their Ghost Pepper wings had about the same heat level as what you might expect from the "hot" selection on a menu at BW3. 

Overall, the environment was aesthetically pleasing and the staff were very courteous, but the food was nothing to rave about. I have to agree with the guests in my party: The food quality is what you might expect to find in any pub, only more expensive. I may return for a beer and a basket of their fire fries, but certainly not for a meal.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Had the fish tacos average at best
Just so so
Girlie bar girls but with bad waitress skills
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Kelcie is a horrible bartender.  We waited to order food for over 10 minutes.  Food was good , not worth the bad service though.  Beer sucks at 27.8 degrees, too icy.  Took over fifteen minutes to pay the bill and it wasn't even busy.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
As a kid we would occasionally eat at places like Rainforest Cafe & Planet Hollywood. It was all about the atmosphere. It seems like Twin Peaks serves the market with a similar approach. The food is fine. Drinks are fine. The service completely varies with each visit -- it seems best when sitting at the bar, less than mediocre at a table. However, it is probably one of the best places in the area to watch multiple games at once. So I guess at this age I'm willing to trade a great dining experience for something more mediocre if it means abundant viewing options on a Sunday during football season. 

Side note: Can anyone explain to me why every stall in the women's restroom has a 3 inch gap on both sides of the door? All these years...and it hasn't stopped being weird.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
My husband, myself and our friends have always wanted to try Twin Peaks and drove 45 minutes to do so and it was a complete let down. Our friends arrived before us and were already seated. When we walked in, there were 5 girls standing in the front and not one of them greeted us or asked if they could help us. None of the 5 girls said one word to us. There were no other guests either. So we just decided to find our friends on our own. 

Once we were all seated, it took 15 minutes for our waitress to even ask us what we wanted to drink. Mind you, this place was not busy at all. We orderd the 4 shot deal, and the shots tasted watered down. The fried pickles were great. The rest of the food was below average in all of our opinions. And then, our waitress messed up our tickets. 

The biggest let down was the customer service and with everything combined, it was a bad experience and the ONLY reason it's getting two stars is because of the fried pickles. We will not be back.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: There was a horrible 45 minute wait on our food to be done. So we didn't get to eat, paid for our drinks and had a couple shots. Left with a $15 bill and disappointment.

text: The food was awful. I had chili and a burger. The service was nothing special. I felt like we paid $40 for a crappy lunch because of some boobies.
name: Twin Peaks

text: Party of 8 sat for 15 minutes after ordering drinks before leaving. Didn't want to wait for dinner. Worst service ever.
name: Twin Peaks

text: Here is the breakdown on my rating. 4 stars for the food, great flavors and fresh home style cooking. I have only had one misstep when I tried to customize a salad and so maybe I was being too difficult. I give 4 stars to the staff, for the most part they are friendly and provide great service. 1 star to the management, they make odd choices like charging guest who are in the restaurant a cover charge because of some stupid MMA fight. 1 star for the customers, actually most people who go here are nice, upstanding, professionals. The small minority that do not know how to dress and act in public ruin the atmosphere. Averages out to 3 stars.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Food is good. Service is piss poor. There are a lot of TVs, but it takes an act of congress to get it on the game you want to see and there is no guarantee that it will stay on your game until the end. Tonight, the IU basketball game was switched with 2:30 to go (tied) for a MMA bout. Meanwhile, there was the same NBA game on 2 TVs next to each other at the bar.  Whoever is running this needs a course in common sense. I don't think I'll be back. There are too many other options.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Food is great ... But the service sucks. The girls that work there have horrible attitudes Ive been there about 4 times and each time same horrible attitudes. Its safe to say I will not be going here again
name: Twin Peaks
