text:
Recently went to this location and I have mixed reviews. Food and booze came out quick and was good. It's the service is where my issue is. 
Server took my order, but very quickly gave me the bill. Felt like they were trying to rush me out. Look I get it, spent years in restaurant business. But don't throw me the bill unless I ask for it, makes people feel like they are not allowed to order more. Especially when they don't even acknowledge that you are there after. Gave the server $20 on a &45 dollar bill. You would think they would try and get more out of me at that point!! But no, did not speak to me once after I paid. 
I understand that this place has a theme, and that's mainly what people go for. But that only gets you so far. I have gone through the reviews of this location and others. And I have not seen management even try and apologize once at this location, once!!Where as at the other one I looked at. First review I read management had responded. 
Enjoyed the food and booze and willing to give it another shot. But if service does not prove to be nothing more then girls showing off the boobs and ass, and relying on just that to make money, I will not come back nor recommend this specific location to anyone.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: First off overall a good place to come. As we arrived, no one greeted us and took a minute too long to seat us when there was no wait and plenty of room. The service was average (girl forgot what sample of beer was what) my steak was ordered medium rare and came out medium. Didn't ruin the meal as it was still good. The mashed potatoes are amazing as well as the mac and cheese, highly recommended. My boyfriend got the "Hangover Burger" it was very good! The fries are also great and have a nice seasoning. Great place to watch sports and has a very unique environment. I think their downfall is a bunch of young inexperienced girls trying to run the place. Very good price though!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Took me ten minutes to order a beer from the waitresses fixated on their phones.  Beer was good service wasn't what I was expecting
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
I had high hopes for this place. We heard they have great food. My husband and I went in during slower hours on a Friday. LOTS of empty tables so we thought it shouldn't be too long of a wait with our waitress. She took a while to get our drinks.  We ordered our food. He got the pot roast, I got the steak salad and added shrimp. Their menu is very small, not much to choose from. Like I said, it was not busy. It took almost an hour to get our food and it was cooked fine but it was so salty I couldn't eat it. Even my husband, who pours salt on everything, said it was so salty he didn't have to put salt on there. Which is ok for him but for normal people it was too much. 
On a side note, I personally have no problem with how the staff is dressed, or I wouldn't have went in, but is it mandatory to hire only anorexic looking females? These girls really do not look healthy. Out of the 10+ servers only 2 seemed to weigh over 110 lbs. The girls were extremely pleasant and nice though but the service was not that great either.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Service was not very good. Asked for water did not receive it. Ask for mayonnaise extra and did not receive it. The music was so loud that the waitress did not hear our order. She kept asking over and over what we had selected. there was no choice between regular fries and fire fries. No ketchup was offered at the table. The menu selections are very limited. But they do have a large beer and liquor selection. observing the other waiters and waitresses, they did not seem to be in a hurry to do anything one way or the other. The hamburger that I had, was just like any other hamburger at any other restaurant. Nothing exceptional.it seems to be a very disorganized restaurant and management staff. In fact, I saw no management in the restaurant at all. More training is needed definitely. it is nice though to have a very large flatscreen TVs to watch all the available games and sports on.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
This was our 3rd time eating here. We have had a bad experience each time. This time the waitress was absolutely clueless and rude. It was Saturday and it should have been a kids eat free day. We explained that to the waitress and she looked at us like we were idiots. She then came back and the kids drinks were still on the bill. We asked for those to be taken off and she huffed and puffed and gave more attitude. My wife got the Hangover burger and it was as thin as a Mcdonalds cheeseburger and the egg was completely cooked not sunnyside up. I got the chicken strip basket and my 2 boys hot the kids chicken strips. The strips are somewhat slimy. The aren't very crispy at all. I will say the fries are very good and the beer is cold! 
I won't be coming back for a meal but I might come back to sit at the bar and watch a game. Hopefully the service will get better over time.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Excellent menu items and great selection of beers. Good place for sporting events via tv with plenty of seating and good service. Try the chili loaded it's excellent.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Decided to check out Twin Peaks after finding my favorite Indian Restaurant closed at 3:00. (I know, I should know this) My date and I decided to go for the sampler appetizer, the BLT and the Philly steak n cheese. The appetizer was really good consisting of pickle chips, boneless buffalo wings, and mozzarella cubes. The pickle chips were pretty tasty. The buffalo wings were the norm and the mozzarella cubes were okay. Nothing to write home about. My BLT was nicely prepared but I didn't care for the spicy bacon (may have been pepper bacon) and the lack of mayo. The sourdough  bread it was served on was really good. My date didn't care for the Philly steak n cheese. He said the bread wasn't very good. He said Penn Station is better. The fire fried that come with the sandwiches are thicker cute and pretty good.

I will give them another shot to try the pot roast but if it isn't good I probably won't go here again. 

One nice perk is the decor. It's the old Loon Lake Lodge so the rustic feel is still there and the fireplace is a nice touch.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I've been to this location several times. Every time I go the service is fast & friendly. The beer is always ice cold and the food always comes out hot. The girls are friendly, which is nice. The girls also don't just pay attention to the man you're with, so that's a plus.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
I'll be honest, it's alright but not great. Typical bar restaurant akin to an R-rated Applebee's. We're glad we tried it, but I doubt we'll be making a return visit.

Whiskey selection was surprisingly large, but as a beer guy, I was left kinda disappointed. Fat Tire is as exotic as it gets.

Got the pablano chicken and the lady got the fish tacos. We both decided they were "meh". If I'm going to go ogle women and drink cheap beer, I'll stick to Hooters Wings.

Sweet bear statue though.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I tried Twin Peaks for 1st time today and likely my last. It wasn't busy at 4:00 and I was greeted, seated and waited on very quickly. Since I was working I had iced tea so can't comment on beer selection. I have no complaints with service or server. Elizabeth was friendly and efficient. Very limited menu though. A handful of appetizers, about half dozen burgers a couple of chicken sandwiches and fish tacos. Also a few "dinner" type offerings. I'm not necessarily a healthy type eater but if you are you'll go hungry here. I ordered the chicken ranch. It was very sloppy so watch out shirt front and way over seasoned. It had so much pepper on it I'm afraid I'm going to regret it tomorrow morning. Same way with the fire fries, way too much salty cajun seasoning on frozen steak cut fries. All in all they're just meh. 4 stars though for waitress objectifying, I feel like I have to leave a bigger tip...is there a term for this? I'll have to call A Way With Words.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Nothing special about this place. Mediocre food with decent service. Waitresses know nothing about the food on the menu, so don't bother asking. This is definitely only here to entertain lonely men. If you want good food, there are plenty of better options nearby.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: First time trying the Twin Peaks breastaurant. Wife and I found the place after lunch time, after most of the Bros had checked out, so the place was pretty laid back. Toni was polite, and took care of us like a good host should, and looked great to boot. Beers were ice cold (great for this obnoxiously hot and humid summer!) and the selection covered a lot of beer types. Wings were pretty good, better than B-Dubs for sure. French fries on the side were kinda bland; they should just invest in a fry slicer and make them fresh, it isn't hard to do. Plenty of TVs everywhere to catch just about every sport you could want to watch. Would go back next time we're in Indy.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I'm have a Twin Peaks. It's my cuz per   Bachelor party.   The  Waitress at twin peaks (Tyler Walker) is the best and she is a very good waitress. Plus Tyler works hard at all  her tables. Just want the thanks Twin  peaks and Tyler Walker for a very good time.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Twin peaks has been open for a couple of months and I had heard good things about the food and the scenery and decided to check it out. I was told by some of my friends that it was substantially better than Hooters in both regards as well. 

We were seated faster than I expected and initially thought it was strange that we were sitting at a very long table along with others. The table was separated by a piece of wood with an ax in it. It actually worked pretty well. 

Our waitress, Alyssa, was very friendly and brought us our beer pretty quick. It was the coldest beer I have ever had and it was served in a FROZEN glass not just frosted. The surface of the beer froze in about a minute. The beer was certainly a great experience.

Alyssa and the other waitresses were wearing tight tan shorts with red "shirtinis" (a word I just made up to mean a bikini top that has just a little more fabric to make it look like a shirt). They were for and friendly. 

The food was a mixed bag. I had the cheese bites as an appetizer. They were fantastic. My only complaint was that there weren't enough of them. My meal was  was the bbq bacon burger and fries. The fries were pretty good. They are a steak fry with a season salt. I would have liked more seasoning but my fiancé wanted less. The burger is the problem. It had great presentation and the bacon was done well but when I started getting into the burger, it fell flat on flavor. There was very little sauce and the meat didn't have a full grilled taste. I would expect a burger and fries that cost $9 would be grilled and it was obvious that It came off of a flat grill. 

The menu was also very small. I will go back but not so much for the burgers.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Seriously the shitest Indiana service. I only come because it closes late and its food is good. But their waitresses are trash
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Food was pretty good, I had the chipotle chicken and it had a nice kick. Chips and queso were good, we wanted the pulled pork nachos, but they were sold out. Not much of a wine selection, but the beer was apparently very cold. Our server was really bad. She was very friendly, but did not seem to grasp our order. She forgot a lot and did not even ask for any food order until we had been there 30 minutes. She may have been new to serving.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Attentive service and woodsy decor sets this restaurant apart from the competition. Booths with TV's make watching the game an intimate experience. Menu is limited but the cuisine is stellar. The only thing preventing this place from 5 stars is the lack of a vegetarian entrée.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
This place is called "Twin Peaks" which, like "Hooters", is a not so subtle way of reminding you why you really came here. You didn't come here for gourmet food. You didn't come here to discuss Plato and Dostoevsky with PhD students who are working as waitresses to help pay tuition. You came here for the twin peaks.

Having said that, the food is on par with other sports bars, which means it's mediocre. So why four stars instead of the 2-3 stars I consistently give to sports bars with mediocre food (which is all of them)? Because twin peaks.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Good was on par with your typical sports bar. Clearly the cleavage motif is where they concentrate most of their efforts. Great place for game day food.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
The wife and I stopped in here on a Saturday afternoon for an early dinner after catching a matinee up on 96th street. The parking lot was about half filled, but it looked like a lot less people inside as the restaurant is HUGE and very open. We were greeted by no less than 6 waitresses/hostesses standing around the hostess station. The person taking us to our table, who ended up being our waitress, decided to finish her conversation she was having with the other girls before seating us. It was kind of annoying, but she was very pleasant otherwise. 

The menu isn't extensive as others have previously mentioned. I decided on the "hangover burger" which is your basic hamburger with the addition of a fried egg on top. It was good but I have to say I prefer the Royal Red Robin over it. The fries served with it were pretty tasty with the seasoning they added to them. My Wife decided to just get the pulled pork nachos appetizer for her meal and we would share them. WOW there was a lot of food on that plate. They were very good, but I was too full to be of much help after my burger and we barely scratched the surface. At one point the waitress came by and said, "I was going to tell you how big they were after you ordered them."......haha ok why didn't you? We took them home and had them the next day. No big deal. 

My favorite part about Twin Peaks, besides the obvious, was how cold the beer was! They are very proud of how cold they keep the beer as there is an indicator on the wall keeping customers informed of just how cold it was. It fluctuated from 27 to 30 degrees while we were there. While there isn't an overabundance of choices, it was super refreshing. The top of the beer had small ice crystals forming it was so cold. DELICIOUS! Especially on a 90 degree day.

I don't think it would be a monthly trip, but we would definitely take friends back for the experience or just drop in for a drink. Like I said, the inside was huge with plenty of TVs everywhere you looked. It would be a great place to take a big group.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Do you want to read the good written material I have created today?

The Indy 500.  While thousands rushed to the track to drown themselves in alcohol in the blazing sun watching race cars zoom across the track going at speeds I've never traveled, I learned in the background.  I made a decision to go in search of a good spot to watch the race on television yesterday and that is a good thing today.  It sent me spiraling to Twin Peaks, a place I had listed on my calendar and scratched off the original day I chose to go.  Still my sub-conscious would not let me forget what I had tried to erase.  It pushed me in that direction and I arrived and met my destiny restoring the balance of today.  I walked in with a quarter.  I ordered a water and sat at the bar.  My bartender was a seasoned veteran.  She'd been there since it opened.  Her next career goal in life is to be a housewife.  I sat there for hours, just learning from the environment and her.  The pack sitting to my left get louder as their drinks keep getting refilled.  One of them speaks up and decides to order shots for the group.  I chime in, can I have one too?  No.  Then he changes his mind, calls it karma, and orders me up one.  Did we just become best friends?  No.  I soon learn what attracts me to the bartender, she reminds me of a person I knew in the past, Heather.  Coincidentally enough, a red head strolls into the bar to work next to my bartender and her name is Heather.  So I spend a few hours there just learning and being in the space.  I'm not a king.  I say at one point to the guy who bought the shots.  Kiss the ring bitch.  His response, drowning himself in booze.  When him and his pack are about to leave, he bows and kisses my hand.  

I return after a visit home for a nap and dinner.  My bartender and Heather are still there, grinding it through on a Sunday race day.  I order a glass a house red and the banana pudding.  Both were good then as of today.  It wasn't about me that good day, it was about her, the bartender, and Heather, and that's a good thing today.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
I'm a big sports bar guy and a sports bar food guy and don't expect a sports bar to be 5 star dining. Let me answer a question that people ask me when I said I ate there. "Is it okay to bring your wife and kids there to watch a game?" The servers do wear low cut shirts and shorts, but nothing that was any different than other themed sports bars. When I was there, there were groups of women together and also couples there. There were a few families with children there. 

The food is what made me give it a try....well that and the ridiculously cold beer. 

I am a big fan of nachos....good nachos. Twin peaks has good nachos, very good nachos. they are big enough for 2-3 people and be pretty full. We ate mostly appetizers while we were there. We had the sampler plate which has mozzarella bites, Fried Pickles and Boneless buffalo bites. They were really good. Even with them being fried they were not soggy from grease. Have boneless chicken instead of bone on wings in a sampler was a great surprise and was welcomed with an open mouth. I also had The cup of chili and it was very flavorful and I wish I would have got The bowl of chili instead. The food over all was above average for a sports bar. next time we might move to entrees next time.

For dessert we had the bread pudding and it was really good. I would definitely get it again. My wife are the ice cream and brownie dessert. She would get it again also. I also wanted the apple dessert they had on the menu, but the server says they don't carry it and wishes they would take it off them menu if they don't plan on carrying it.

It is my new favorite sports bar. Almost forgot they have a crazy amount of TVs and they are numbered so you can ask the server to change that tv to a game you would like to watch. They also have tvs over all the urinals in the men's room.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Dirty everywhere. They serve food ?? Really ?? Who gives. Food not Michelin Rated but who cares. Love tight shirts and tops.  Tattoos and bedazzled belts.  So hot. Stripper smell permeates.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
My last visit to Twin Peaks, and it will be my last. I was told by the 21 and a half year old bartender that it was against the law to order a beer and a Crown on the rocks. 
I am 56 years old and I know this is an absolute crock of poop!! Order them all the time. Including the last two times I have been to Twin Peaks!!!
Fast forward to two gentleman across the bar. One orders a shot and a beer, the other a special shot and beer. Too surprise I say, "thought that was against the law"?  "They don't have ice in them". Now she begins to tell me how long she's has be a so called bartender,  whatever. Oh the patronizing b$&ch!! 
The service sucks, to busy showing their asses, and giggling to help anyone. 
Now this is at the bar mind you, don't want to talk bad about the whole wait staff just Heather!!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I was looking forward to eating here, my last experience the food and service in Knoxville were great. No so here. The waitress took close to 10 minutes to show up for my drink order. I gave my dinner order at the same time my iced tea showed up quickly but it took awhile for salad. I found out why when the salad and my steak entree showed up together. I sent the steak back and ate the salad that was crisp, fresh and very good. The steak came back out like warm and done to less than medium rare. The vegetables were good but also less than luke warm. I would  not visit this location again.
name: Twin Peaks

text: Good food . Cold beer . Good conversation . Every time I go to the food taste great . I have not been dissatisfied at all

text: I stopped in for the first time tonight.  I had the Venison Chili.  It was very good!  Colleen was very friendly and attentive even though she was going on 9+ hours at work.  I'll definitely be coming back with friends!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: We've been wanting to try this franchise. Disappointed with the service. Our waitress had no personality and did not want to be there. There'd be long spans of time where she was MIA. I don't know if it was an off night but it seemed like none of the workers were happy to be there. We were there on a Saturday night around 8:30pm. Great beer selection. We tried the sampler and it was very good. Had the pot roast and It was ok. The potatoes were raw and the other veggies seemed to oily.  It's a nice place to watch a game with some appetizers. We were from out of town so I'm hoping the location in our area is better than this location.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I have to say we had a really good experience here.  Honestly, what attracted me to the place is the 29 degrees beer.  I wanted it, and I got it, and I loved it.  I had their brew, the Knotty Brunette.  It's a dark brown beer, but lighter than a lager.  I was surprised at how light tasting it is, and I really like it.  We had the sirloin steak with garlic mashed and broccoli and the bread pudding for dessert.  The steak was prepared properly and not tough, the mashed potatoes had just the right taste of garlic without over powering, and the broccoli was cooked without being wilted to death.  The bread pudding had the texture of almost a cake and had raisins and a nice bourbon sauce topped with ice cream.  Loved how many TV's were in every direction.  The inside space is huge, they have two bars, and the decor is really cute.  While it is true that this is the type of place whose staff are young ladies with low cut tops and high cut shorts, it's not too extreme, and the frosty beer is just worth it.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Very Cold Beer, Great Friendly Service, and good food.  They do not add salt to anything.  I usually sit at the bar and you have to ask for salt as it is not sit out (maybe they are trying to reduce people's salt usage) ... the big negative is they are always changing and removing items from the menu.  They used to have an amazing meatloaf .. no longer removed it from the menu.   Chicken tacos WERE amazing.. grilled chicken with various seasoning diced up and loaded into three tacos.. now you just get two and it is a fried chicken strip.. I would avoid... go with naked or smoked wings... or the Texas style Cheese Steak.. the regular cheese steak is good too
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Beautiful women, great service, great food. Had a wonderful experience. Would advice to call and ask if they are having a bikini night as it wouldn't be family friend to this point. They definitely push the sexual agenda to attract business. Too many positive though that out weigh the negative. Enjoy it!

text:
Amazing!!! 
This was my first time here. I felt very comfortable with the girls working there. They were very nice to each other and seemed to have great relationships. Lindsay was the bartender and she was great! Very sweet and very knowledgeable of everything they had to offer. The store was very clean and the staff knew exactly what was expected of them. text: I enjoy the atmosphere of this place. The bartender, Jessica, was amazing and very nice and seemed interested in conversation. The beer I ordered came out fast and was ice cold. The food was amazing too, no issues with it and was a speedy delivery to me.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Icy cold draft beer and nice service.  I felt a lil creepy at first here as we came on "Lingerie day", or what my people call "Friday ". After a while you settle in and it's just a good, massive sports bar that serves high-end bar food. 
The venison chili was surprisingly good. Nice layers of savory gravy and the perfect meat to beans ratio.  Go off the reservation and order the buck. 
My dining tastes tend to be a lil bipolar, so from there I ordered the meatless Imposter Burger. This was really strange for a veggie burger.  It was really juicy and meaty - almost too wet for me, but you gotta try this one for yourself.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Beer is not better at 27.5 degrees! The servers were clueless! Only 2 sizes for beer- 10oz and 22oz? Don't expect much from Twin Peaks, the 'Peaks' weren't that great.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Excellent service! Wait time for meal was not long. Continually checked on by server. Food was cooked perfectly! Very satisfied.
name: Twin Peaks

text: Parking lot was dead we came right after lunch. Seated right away but took awhile to see the waitress. Sweet Tea had a different taste than normal. Ordered fried pickles they were good. The fish and chips super greasy and the chicken fried chicken was also. Mac and cheese had no flavor. The only good was the waitress was nice.
name: Twin Peaks

text: Had a great time at this restaurant! Dana (Knoxville)was a wonderful server! Keep up the great job!! We loved getting to know you!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
My Wife and I stopped in for lunch before heading to a New Year's Eve Party.  The place was pretty dead for lunch, but it was probably going to be busy for the college football playoff games. 

The hostess wasn't that friendly and didn't seem to be happy that we were there.  Always a good start....

There are more BIG TV's than any place I've ever visited.  There are almost too many if that's possible.  It was a little annoying that even though all of the TV's were the same size and model they couldn't sync the color adjustments so it made for uncomfortable viewing.  At least the feed was all in sync timing wise.

Our server was very attentive and friendly  I ordered the fish tacos which were very good and my wife had the meatloaf which she also enjoyed.  I had a few draft beers which were quite cold.  I didn't really like the frosty mugs though.  They had too much frost and I ended up with a lot of ice in all three of the beers I ordered.

The other servers that walked by seemed to be going through the motions and were never smiling.  They really made it kind of an uncomfortable environment.  I think if they would smile a little it would go a long way to making the place more enjoyable.

Overall the place just seems too large and not the kind of place I would like to hang out and watch sports.  If you advertise cold beer why does it have to come in an icy cup.  It kind of ruins the beer when there is that much ice floating in it.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I usually sit at the bar , but today I sat in Alexis section . She is very sweet and never thought twice to accommodate us no matter what we asked ! I will definitely come back for her service and attentiveness
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: The pulled pork sliders are fabulous. We went on a busy Saturday night, and service in the bar was good.

text: If you like flannel, chopping wood, and wildlife... who am I kidding. My husband and myself go here at least once a month.

text: Awesome food...great atmosphere...ok location...but unfortunately  the service gets zero stars.  Horrible service! .Staff doesn't get it...too bad because this place could be awesome!   If you do go, get their bacon appetizer, it is amazing!

text: It's like Hooters on steroids. They have a good beer selection, decent food, and of course attractive waitresses. I like the giant log cabin feel of this restaurant and it's usually a good place to grab a beer after work if you are wanting to get served quickly.

text: My family and I went to Twin Peaks for the first time. Not only was the food delicious and exceeded our expectations, the atmosphere and drinks deserve  nothing but 5 stars. Our waitress Mckenzie was so pleasant and tentative, service was great! Manager Emilio checked on us to make sure we were having a great experience. text: Come to bar with the porch for all your game day needs. If somehow you don't have the best time, hit up Brian. He holds the whole place down. So, i guess you could say the terrific service is an extension of his great management. Come see for yourself.

text: I had a phenomenal experience at twin peaks this evening. Our server, shayla, was a lot of fun and my burger was delicious. I came in with 9 friends (who can get pretty rowdy) and shayla handled all of us exceptionally. I will definitely be returning!!

text: The food was actually pretty good here I couldn't believe it. A lot more flavorful than I thought it would be. But it did taste extremely processed. Our service was excellent and the scenery was great as well. But I don't want to come back... but I get why guys go there lol  not mad at yeah

text: Honestly I was against the advertisement before they opened, j thought it was going to be a strip club. I rarely enjoy the food at most restaurants but YUM, the fish tacos are much better than Bonefish and the salsa is warm and absolutely the best in town.   Upscale bar food! Our server Jenna & Christina cute cute cute and their outfits are no worse than you see in any summer day.  Service was excellent.  Not a big deal ladies. Food is awesome!

text: A great new place in indy with over 40 craft beers on tap.  They also provide a decent menu of typical pub style food with a twist.  The best part obviously is the scenery and friendly customer service. If you are a sports fan there are also plenty of TV's with every channel playing.  Try the "ghost heat" wings... They have a kick!!!

text: Just left my birthday dinner at Twin Peaks and it was awesome. Alyssa and Bre made us feel like we had been friends forever. Great service and really good food. I had the Philly cheesesteak and it was amazing. The twin peaks sundae was awesome too!  Thanks Bre and Alyssa!

text:

Paul the manager was great

text: One of the best sports bars we've been too and always go to one if they have one in the town we are in
name: Twin Peaks

text: Not impressed. To start, the group of hostesses at the front were far too busy socializing with each other to bother to acknowledge us. When we were on our way to be seated, we noticed that the restaurant smelled strongly of sewage throughout, luckily we were seated in the back where it wasn't AS FOUL, but still there nonetheless. Frankly, I lost most of my appetite already because of that stench. The hostess sat us down and seemingly forgot about us, as a server didn't come around to get our drink orders for another 20 minutes. They weren't even busy. The server was not friendly and wasn't familiar with the drink or food menus, she didn't want to answer questions that my father had about the menu. Our food came out quickly but was not good. In a party of 6, half of us did not get what we ordered, and the food we received was all either way overcooked, or undercooked. My husband felt that his chicken wings tasted off, and has been sick to his stomach for the last two hours. None of us had been here before tonight and it's really unlikely that we'll be back. Pretty dissatisfied with this place, which was surprising because of all the hype we've heard. I don't get what all the hype was about for unpleasant service, wrong orders, sewage smell, not to mention that everything was so sticky from our table to our silverware and glasses.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Having a great lunch a Twin Peaks today! 
Trying the new Green Chili Chicken soup and a Burger. Great atmosphere at the bar. Samantha and Jessica  take care of your every need. I have become a regular!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
We were in town for a baseball tournament.
Most of the team decended in for dinner so our teenage boys could appreciate a meal "with a view".
The servers were attentive and gave the boys some fun.
Food was good for the large chain they are.
Mostly fried foods, very few vegetable options.
Bison is on the menu which is at the very least, a healthier option.
Personally I left with a fun case of food related heartburn but our group had fun.
If you're in the area, with a group or looking for a dinner with "peaks", it's worth trying once.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
I normally like to go to this place, but yesterday was horrible. The waitress had zero personality to start with. There were four of us there to drink, eat and watch the football games. We spent quite a lot of money and were there for a couple hours when a manager told us that we were buying too many drinks and there was a family sitting next to us. We had a driver who had 0 beers or alcoholic drinks, and we were not being disrespectful or rude to anyone. I look over at the family and they weren't paying a bit of attention to us. It didn't look like they were bothered at all.

 Then we were accused of turning off tv's and the manager tried to stare us down. I'm sure he got his courage from the policeman who was working the door. Needless to say, we weren't intimidated. It was pretty busy there and I was assuming that the point was to let people watch some games, have a good time, and they make money in the process. I won't be going back there anytime soon.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
I enjoy this place because of the size and super cold beer, but the service is the worst. The food is hit or miss depending on the night, as well as the waitresses attitudes. 

If you are a sports fan that likes super cold beer, and don't really mind if the food is great, then this is the place for you.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: First time here and didnt know what to expect. Our server was Ty. She was awesome and made our stay exceptional. I will be back to this place when ever i get a chance.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
This place would be five stars if it was for the fruit flies at our booth. I am pretty sure a fruit fly problem comes from miss managed liquor bottles at the bar. At least, that is what I have learned from Bar Rescue.

Besides that....The food was awesome. I love wings, and their wings were top notch. I got my wings breaded like I would at Hooters, and their breading is nice and crisp. Their sauces are good although not as many to choose from as Buffalo Wing Wings. In always better than Wings, Etc. I liked their wings above all wings because of the breading. You can get them without breading too.

They have two beers that are made for them. One they claimed was like a Blue Moon, but Blue Moon is better. The other is a brown ale. Both were good. They advertise 29 degree cold beer. I had to be that temperature, because it was slightly slushy at the top. I would rather the beer just be in the high 30's. No need to have ice in me beer.

They have TVs at all the booths from what I could tell. It was really neat to watch a college football game at my table. The restaurant sound system was turned to play that game over the speaker system. On a side note, not all the tables were turned to the same channel. Not sure if you can get it changed for your table or not. 

The ambiance of the place looks like the inside of a log cabin. It has a Ron Swanson vibe from Parks and Recreation. Long tables have axes dividing them. Some chairs are made of of branches. Tables are made of slabs of wood. The walls are decorated with pin up girl calendars and beer related materials. The ladies looked very pretty in their outfits.

I would come here again. Hope they fixed their fruit fly problem. I informed corporate about it hoping it gets fixed.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: The beer was cold and good. I had the wings which tasted like grocery store ones. My husband and son had burgers which they said were good. My son said there was way too much mayo on his but other than that. The service I was really not impressed with. We sat with dirty dishes at our table the entire time. Twice she would come over and take maybe two glasses but not come back for rest. There was a shift change and the other waitress same thing. Both were sweet but could of cleared our table as we sat there finishing up our beers.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: I have frequented Twin Peaks for nearly four months, but tonight was the best by far. Symone took wonderful care of me, and although Mattice wasn't my server, she made sure to make her way over to thank me for being such a great customer. Ashley is a manager, but she genuinely spends time with every customer assuring every need is met. I wouldn't recommend any other place before this one!

text: Do yourself a favor and only come here for a cold beer & watch sports. The food is bland, cold and all around unappealing to the eyes. I do believe they have the coldest beer in town!!!

text: The service was horrible. When we got there there was only 3 tables that had customers. We had 3 waitresses just look at us. No "Hi, we will be right with you". We waited for 3 minutes just to be seated. The waitress spoke so quietly that we could not hear her. The waitress was so busy "flirting " with 1 customer she completely ignored her other 3 customers. The 2 other customers had to find another waitress to get a bill for the food. Our waitress was so engrossed with her male customer, that she even went as far as going out to the parking lot with him for a few minutes with him. We had to get her attention to get a bill. Then we had to go up to her again just so we could get a receipt. The food was good, service beyond lousy.
name: Twin Peaks

text: I came in here and wasn't feeling the greatest. I was just coming to get some food and Kaylee came up and was extremely nice. She had many customers and still was able to talk with everyone and get things done on time. She even came pass and said smile. Things always get better in seasons. Then to watch how she worked in her gifting was good. It actually boosted my mental because I felt overwhelmed but to see how gard she was working gave me drive. I needed this push today. Blessing

text: Best lunch experience ever. Toni was the best. I'll be back for lunch every time I'm in the area! This is my new favorite restaurant.

categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Bartender Symone was very inetentive. We were there fore 45 minutes and she only got us 1 single drink. She never acknowledged us one time after our initial order. Once we put our card down to pay, she grabbed it within 5 seconds of it hitting the table. We went to go find a table to sit at to order food with a better experience and made a comment to the hostess letting her know about our service where we were then confirmed by Symone who was crying and explained that she was busy and did the best that she could. Her bar had 5 groups of people at most at it and there were quite a few empty chairs. We asked for a manager who came out and accused us of not understanding and that they were doing no wrong. He was very rude and not customer friendly. The atmosphere they create here is one similar to high school. Where gossip is the number one priority. The managers act as if they are never in the wrong and that the customers bad experience was just a fluke. They do not take criticism very well and make the customers feel as if their opinion does not matter. Overall, i would not recommend this restraun to anyone who wants a friendly environment with an attentive staff.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Myself and 3 friends stopped in after spending the day looking at tux's for one of their weddings. Not many people and a good place for beer... usually... this experience was awful, took us about 15 minutes to get seated, 20 minutes to get our first round of beers, 40 minutes for the appetizers, another 30 minutes before the waitress even came by to ask us if we wanted a main course. We finally ordered, got the food, ate, and after the waitress came by and said she'd be right back we waited 25 minutes before asking the manager if we could finally get our tickets. By far the absolute worst experience at a restaurant we've had. Wouldn't recommend this location to a friend.

text:

text: First and foremost our food was great and Thanks to Madison service was as well, but i felt so sorry for her that the manager felt our party of almost 25 people didn't deserve 2 waiters. Now we have been to Twin Peaks probably a hundred times since its opened and even with a party of 10 we have had 2 waiters. I even pulled the manager Mike to the side to ask could he make an executive decision to give her some help to ensure twin peaks service stays up to standards since i suggested the place for the party dinner. He looked at me and said no, I was shocked and also embarrassed at the same time for Twin Peaks to employ someone like that and I've always spoke highly of Twin Peaks. So thank you Madison for all you did for us all, and im sorry you under appreciated.

text:
I always enjoy going to Twin Peaks, and this is a nice one. There were lots of televisions and my wife joined me this time (so I didn't feel bad). 

My spicy chicken was awesome, and I felt like it was kind of healthy. The scenic views were nice, but we were actually there to watch football. Our server was friendly and the food came fast. She made the dessert with . I'll go back.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
Twin Peaks in located in Castleton right by I-69 on 82nd Street. Parking is free with a large parking lot in front of the restaurant. 

Everything appeared handicapped accessible from the parking lot, entrance, restaurant, restrooms and the firepit on the patio.

We were seated immediately on the patio as requested at a tall-top table. The view was the parking lot but it was still nice to sit outdoors. We were just a few feet from the community fire pit where several folks were hanging out having a few beers.

Twin Peaks has daily drink specials from drafts to shots with $5 Happy Hour Bites and Drinks. They serve 29 degree beers if you enjoy ice cold beers. Many drink specials so check out the online menu. The restaurant is a great location for a meal, watch a game whether football, basketball or a fight but especially the upcoming Olympics. TV's are located everywhere and there is a pool table, a man cave and games.

The menu offers all your typical Pub food plus more. Several types of Pub Fries are available (recommend Hickory Smoke Pulled Pork or Brisket Chili), Wings, Fried Pickles plus more. A lunch menu is offered Monday -  Friday from 11:00 - 3:00pm. Burgers, tacos, ribs, salmon, pot roast, chicken are also on the menu.

Our food was good, the server brought our appetizers well before our dinner and she checked on us several times. We had a great time on the patio and will return.
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text:
This was our first time at Twin Peaks. We were visiting from Chicago and we've heard a lot about this restaurant. Don't be scared away by the parking lot...they have plenty of seating even if the parking lot appears to be full. We were greeted by a group of excited girls at the door. They were able to seat us right away. We wanted to watch a football game that was not the colts. The manager came over right away and asked which tv would be best for our table. 

We ordered an appetizer, sandwiches, and burgers. The food is reasonably priced and comes in large portions. The bloody Mary's are awesome!!...but the price is a little high at $8.75. 

They have a great patio with a ton of TVs. This will be great place to hang out in the summer. The garage doors open up to the restaurant. 

The service was ok but not the best. We would go back for the drinks and to watch a game. Overall...good restaurant with a great view!
name: Twin Peaks
categories: Sports Bars, American (New), American (Traditional), Nightlife, Bars, Restaurants

text: Jessica P is the best waitress. She is fun and exciting and cute. If I ever come back I will definitely ask for her! Food was good. It was crowded but still great service.

text: To be honest, behind the ladies and breast restaurant theme,  there is decent food.  They do good burgers, apps, and down home entrees.  Being a beer snob, i hate that serve craft beer at 29 degrees, but overall,  it's a decent place. I would gladly go back with friends
