I've been here several times. Great specials at the bar such as $1 oysters and $1 PBR pounders on Mondays. I've tried to beat that with a stick - and I've failed everytime.

The bartenders are all very friendly
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: Not inexpensive, and a bit noisy. But very good quality oysters. I also highly recommend the roasted beet and goat cheese starter. Their steamer buckets are fun - the large ones are certainly shareable. Wine list is weak, so you may want to make this a beer evening.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Went in last night for my first visit.  We were seated outside on a Friday night without waiting.  Throughout the meal our server Sean was friendly, attentive, and quick.  

We started off with the lobster mac to share.  The sauce and pasta were perfect!  

For a main course I had the fish and chips.  The tartar sauce was the best I've ever had, and the aioli with the chips was light and flavorful.  

She had the mixed plate with salmon, scallops, and shrimp.  Everything was cooked well and delicious.

Oh, their dinner rolls with butter were hot and fresh!  Our entrees came out piping hot so I know they didn't sit in the window.

Inside, they nailed the decor and ambiance with thousands of little touches that added up to create a gorgeous whole picture.

Highly recommend!
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
I love this place and I'm a frequent visitor. The first time I came here, they had a Wasabi Oyster special that they haven't had since. It blew me away and I keep coming back hoping that they will serve it again some day.

Besides that, the atmosphere is wonderful and the food has been consistently tasty. They have two fun oyster drinks as well: Slurp-a-burp which is an Oyster with cocktail sauce and lager or the Oyster shooter which is the same, but with vodka.

The oysters I've gotten there have been high quality and good-tasting. For the squeamish - I've never gotten sick. And on top of that the other dishes have been delightful.

The only problem I've had is that some nights they don't have enough people shucking the oysters which can cause really really slow service. But not to worry, this has only happened once in the several times I've been with family and friends.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Mediocre. I've given up on everything besides Buck-A-Shuck Oysters on Mondays. They have a really nice selection of oysters, and they're all really delicious. Beyond that though, it's all downhill. The most recent time I went, we sat for twenty minutes before our server remembered we were there. We ordered 24 oysters and calamari since we knew the oysters would take long time to come out. We ended up getting the oysters before the calamari. That's the thing about buck a shuck, expect to wait 20 to 30 for those oysters to come out, especially if you order a bunch all at once like I do.

Calamari was good but there were banana peppers breaded and fried in there with the squid so I kept getting a mouthful of Dear God No.

I haven't ordered food there since I went for "brunch" and left so hungry I went next door to eat. I ordered eggs Benedict but got eggs on uncooked English muffins with some ham and so little hollandaise sauce it literally looked like it came out of McDonald's ketchup packet. 

I mean it, one whole muffin didn't have any at All. What kind of eggs Benedict doesn't have any hollandaise sauce? 

Between that and never having what I try to order in stock (take it off the menu if it's so difficult to keep!) I see no point in counting on Doc's on anything beyond cheap oysters. But if you go, don't eat the oyster crackers.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: A great selection of raw oysters service was good, the " chowder fried" we're a great side hidden on the menu.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Mother's Day Nightmare

I should have heeded the other poor Yelp reviews that I had read & selected a different restaurant.  If you are contemplating going to this restaurant with children; please note this review as a cautionary tale.

Reservation was at 2pm & we were seated promptly & the table selection was perfect as we were placed in our own little section away from the rest of the crowd (this was a nice touch).  Everything went down hill from here.  We put in the kids orders (2 macaroni & cheeses, 1 crabby patty & 1 chicken tenders) within 10 minutes of sitting down.  An hour later, after 3 prompting conversations with our nice enough waiter; the kids' orders finally came out.  This was a consistent theme throughout the experience; nothing came to our table without continued prompting & near begging.  Our 2 appetizers came out 1.5 hours after sitting down.  Finally, our 3 entrees came out; nearly 2 hours after sitting down.  Again, nothing came to our table until I requested/complained/implored the waiter to please bring something to the table.  

The food varied; most of the plates were pretty good, grilled salmon, crab cake sandwich, lobster blt tacos, & calimari; however; the east steamer pot; both the crab & mussels must have been sitting & over-steaming; just as we did the same....the crab & mussels were completely overdone & was a similar experience to chewing on your tongue.

There was nothing noted, offered, or provided by anyone at the establishment; except a brief apology to the tune of; "sorry for the wait" from the waiter.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Doc Magrogan's is an oyster house specializing in seafood. They're in downtown West Chester, so parking's cake: street metered parking is free after 5, and on weekends too.

Friends and I met up here to take advantage of their attractive Monday specials[1]: their "Buck-a-Shuck" special meant raw oysters were a mere $1. We indulged in half-off appetizers, $4 classic mojitos - surprisingly good, with a kick - and $1 PBRs.

At the bar, bartender Mario[2] paid a lot of attention to us. Shared a huge, awesometastic assortment of thirty (30) oysters, trying about EIGHT different varieties, freshly shucked in front of us, and were some of the best I've had in recent memory. While sklorking them down, we watched the Olympics on flat screen TVs, then washed everything down with a few oyster shooters full of vodka. Mmmm.

Doc Magrogan's has lots of seating, and outdoor tables too. As more folks showed up, we were corralled into a side dining room. Meghan, our brave, sole server, somehow managed to serve the twenty of us.

I'll be back to Doc Magrogan's for their oyster specials, just not to sit at a table - at least, not with such a gargantuan party. Check them out, and tell them Dave sent you[3].

[1] Certain happy hour specials run from 4-6pm, while daily specials run until midnight. See their web site for the latest!
[2] May have his name incorrect.
[3] They will be thoroughly confused if you do this.

UPDATE 28 December 2009: Apparently they don't have mango mojitos anymore? Call to verify availability...
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: My friends and I had dinner at Doc Mc's last night. We went around 8-ish, it was pretty packed inside. The food was good but took forever to come out. I had something from the March mussel madness menu, one if their march specials I guess. It was pretty good, although one of my friends ordered scallops and we didn't think it was good. Needed more flavor. My other friend ordered their lobster ravioli, it was pretty good but the portion is so little along with the scallops. The drinks were good! I had orange crush. Overall, good was average. Raw clams were excellent and fresh. The orange crush was good. Waiter was nice and attentive. :)
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: Do not use your Open Table coupon at this restaurant. Better yet, avoid this restaurant. Mediocre food with service to match. The deal was supposedly a $60.00 meal for $30.00. Had we ordered it  off the menu it would have cost us $35.00. They also overcharged us for wine. What a rip-off!  We have used some of these restaurant deals before and never had an experience like this. A rude manager didn't help the situation. There are many good restaurants in West Chester; this isn't one of them. Maybe the oysters are good, but the "$60.00" dinner wasn't. Go to Gilmore's if you plan to spend $60.00/person.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Quite frankly, I had to dig deep to come up with 3 stars today. I've lived in PA for 6 years and Doc Magrogans was my first favorite spot for seafood. Wednesday are all you can eat crab night and I cleared my calendar just for that!! I was sooo excited!!

For an appetizer my daughter ordered the Little Bitch oysters, which she said were WONDERFUL! (I don't eat them so I'll take her word for it) but things went downhill from there. The crabs tasted as though there were boiled in plain tap water, no seasoning, no lemon juice or salt, NOTHING! When I mentioned this I was rewarded with a cup of dry Old Bay seasoning.

 We didn't bother w seconds but ordered the apple strudel for dessert. Of course there wasn't a teaspoon of ice cream to be had.we were brought sliced apples wrapped in phyllo dough, again with minimal seasoning or flavor. 

The server and manager were nice, but even after a discount, this was a epic waste of $50. So disappointed. But on the upside, Dia Doce is around the corner... I can get something yummy yet!!
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: This is usually my go-to restaurant, but EVERYTHING was off today. Two different tap beers were skunked and finally found an ok pour with a Lite. A Gay Street Lemonade was super sweet and not its normal taste. Ordered edamame and it came already shelled with no seasoning on it - it's always been in the pod before with sea salt. Finally, our mahi tacos and the seared ahi tacos were crazy dry (over cooked) and tasteless. I got extra wasabi and sauce but it didn't help. I'm not sure why, but something was really off today. I hope to see a big improvement in the future!!!!!
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: Stopped by for brunch on a nice sunny day.  Order several raw ouster which were delicious.  N my gf had a bloody Mary with shrimp and she said that was on point.  We both had a pasta dish which was delicious.  The bartender was helpful and service was right. I don't have anything bad to say about my visit.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: My wife and I dined here on 12/17/11. We had a $20 birthday coupon that we received in the mail.  Let me start with the only positive I can offer. the waiter that took care of us ws very friendly and efficient through the entire meal. Kudos to this young man. Now the bad. I ordered 6 oysters, the special of the night as an appetizer. They were so small, I could barely find them.  For an entree, I had the seafood salad, again, so small, I finished in 5 minutes. Considering the prices in this place vs. what you get, it is way overpriced, and I will not return. Do yourself a favor, when in West Chester, go up the street from this place to either the Iron Hill or Ryans Pub, and get a far better meal for a more reasonable price.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Close but lacking in the essentials...

I love seafood and because I am a foodie, when I think seafood, I think wine...the perfect pairing of a crisp white...any white..any red...I have never seen such a horrid wine list.  If a beer and shot and fru-fru umbrella drink is your thing, great.  Docs is your place.  If you love to wash down your oysters with something that does not make you wretch...consider-you have no options.  The wine list is, well, insulting.
I admit, my frustration comes with emailing the restaurant today and them telling me they had a great NZ Sauvignon Blanc by the bottle.  We arrive and are told they have been out of that wine FOR DAYS.  
Our waitress, though adorable, was spotty and did not get our orders correct.
  The food?  Solid.  The ambiance? Great.  The wine and "touches" of extra?  Nope.  I don't think I will be back...unless I am drinking bourbon on the rocks and sitting at the bar.  Everyone has their thing.  A nice glass of wine to go with great food is mine.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
We were all in the mood for good seafood and Doc Magrogan's did not let us down!

We ordered the calamari, New England chowder, and fresh Oysters for appetizers. The chowder was one of the best I've tasted- ranking among those tried in Boston. As for the main course, we ordered the lobster roll with fries and Oyster Po Boy with fries. Both were delicious! 

The service was great. Also, the atmosphere was very relaxing in the outside seating and we were able to enjoy the food in beautiful weather. 

The only downside would be the dessert. They only had various mousses to offer. I was hoping for other dessert items other than mousses.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: Pretty good food (with a tendency towards seafood).  Inside is more of a bar/pub feeling and they do offer outdoor seating.  Service is pretty good, mainly WCU college students, just like all the near by restaurants.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: Went there last month.  The server said without reservations (for 4 people) it would be 15 - 20 minute wait, we said no problem, we will wait at the bar. I checked with the server twice to see if she forgot about me.  She said I was the first on the list.  Long story short, we waited 1 hr and 45 minutes before I asked to talk to a manager.  The manager was very curt and said, follow me.  There was never a Sorry mentioned.  I followed up with an email to them and HAVE NOT RECEIVED A REPLY!  The food and the waiter were mediocre.  I would recommend staying away!
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: The raw oysters were really great. However, we really were looking forward to and went there for the lobster rolls. The lobster rolls were good For flavor and the roll was good but the amount of lobster was really disappointing and much less than expected or for the price ($22). They could of been more generous and made it great but skimped out on the meat!
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
West Chester is full of good restaurants, don't bother to stop here.
Two of four orders were mixed up.  We asked for one to be corrected, "Oops,Sorry!  We will have it in 5 minutes."  It came in 15.  We let the other misorder slide, big mistake.  The salmon was fishy, the shrimp were small and over cooked, and the scallops were like rubber.  While two people were eating their entrees a desert tray was offered to the other two diners, Then, the power went out and the fire alarm went off.  That was beyond their control, but they told everyone to ignore the alarm?  Oh well, it was a night to remember!
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: We had a new server on a very busy Saturday night, and we were a large group. He wasn't able to remember our orders or able to get orders in at the right time. My sister got the completely wrong meal. The scallops were completely over-cooked. And we told the manager, and her way to fix it was to give us more scallops. We didn't want more food; it wasn't right the first time! But she still did nothing to amend for the many mistakes. I will never eat there again or recommended it to anyone.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text:
Deiced we would finally try the food at Doc's since we have lived in West Chester for two years and yet to eat there. Headed in around 8 o'clock , hostess was really nice got a cozy table in back where it was nice and quiet. After a 9 hour day at work the one thing i wanted was a pint of Guinness and that's exactly what i got! Beer selection was decent, nothing crazy but they had enough.
That night they where running a special on "FISH BOWLS" which in my opinion is just watered down flavored liq in a cheap plastic bowl that is just the most annoying thing to walk around with. But if you are a freshman at W.C.U. and or a chick that wants to get "Wild" on a sugar high, its something that you might enjoy. 
So onto the food. I started off with there Fried Fresh Buffalo Mozzarella which had to be some of the best Ive ever had. I assumed that the "Buffalo" was for the fact that there where pretty large. Come to find out they where made with Buffalo milk. Main course was Doc's Signature Burger, nothing out of the ordinary just a delicious burger with fries . My girl friend went with there Steamed P.E.I. Mussels. From what she said they where delicious except for the occasional grains of sand! 
All in all a great restaurant, does start to get loud and over crowded after 9:30 but that's like most places in down town West Chester.
name: Doc Magrogan's Oyster House - West Chester
categories: Seafood, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Cocktail Bars, American (New), Pubs

text: This place is a dump. Its dirty and the bartenders are NASTY. Much better option down the road at Racks or House of Brews. Don't believe me? Give it a try. Worst bartenders I've ever come across
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: I've tried twice to get in on separate occasions! Once when I was 22 with a NJ state ID but I wasn't allowed in and was told I needed a drivers license or Had to be 24 to get in with regular state ID. Now I'm 23 with a probationary auto license and yet I can't get in still! I am of age and have been served alcohol with my probationary license so I don't understand why this bar is making such a big deal! Funny thing is I wasn't even going to drink on those two occasions I went to hang out with some of My fiance's friends! I honestly am over the fact of getting into this bar to be honest! I cant  say much for the service as I can't get in but this whole I'd thing is just plain stupid!  Its a bar not a damn airport!
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: After Washington Township just experienced a tornado, my family and I had lots of damage to our house, no air, and no food. We decided to grab a bite to eat at the sharkeys, one of the only places open to eat. After we sat down and ordered our drinks the waitress decided to card my 19 year old daughter, keep in mind my family and I were sitting at a table, after she had found out her age we were turned away from eating. Not only was the waitress rude, the bartender then proceeded to yell at us from across the restaurant. I've been to many restaurants in my life and have never experienced such rude service, I would not recommend this place to any family or any person for that matter.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text:
A great dive bar.  The kind of place you can take over if you bring three friends with you.  Shuffleboard and darts are always available.  Downstairs is usually pretty quiet, while upstairs is louder.  Not a great selection of beer, however they do now have Corona light on tap, which I have never seen before.  

Often have pretty great deals on liquor and beer.  (Fridays: $3 Corona, Saturdays: $5 redbull and vodka)

The food is pretty good for a dive.  Pretty good wings and sandwiches.

Bartenders are pretty friendly.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: Great wings, crispy and meaty.  Upstairs is for the younger crowd, downstairs for locals.  2 pool tables and American dart boards.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text:
This is a pretty cool local bar. Went there on a Monday night, not a lot of people there at all. Bartender was good. We just had a few beers. They have a takeout beer section too. Highlights: 2 small size pool tables which were really nice. All the cues were pretty beat up though. They also had a shuffleboard table and dartboard. I didn't eat there, so I'm not sure how the food is. My experience was average. Since then, I've been here about 4 more times, pretty much only to play pool. It's a dive bar but the upstairs is pretty cool when it is open. (Usually after 7pm) They have another pool table up there too.
Update- we come here all the time now, honestly, the experience is hit or miss depending on the the bartender. Most are cool and do a great job, but some are so terrible it makes me not want to come back.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: This is definitely a locals' bar. It was my second time there and we went for a surprise party. The bartender, Betty... AWESOME and so creative! She makes awesome drinks and shots! Everything was reasonable pricing and we enjoyed it there. Loved their wings/pizza rolls. Delish! My friends didn't love this place, but I think it's who you're with to really enjoy to place. Once you get a few Cotton Candy or Dirty Girl Scout shots in, you're having the time of your life!
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text:
Food, my quesadilla, was good in size and flavor.  Service was carp, bartender, well we needed to pretty vocal to get a refill. Out waitress, with the personality of a pet rock really had me question my food order.  She delivered the food, nothing else, except an awkward comment about the bill upon delivering food.  Evidently, you pay for food before eating, so they bring the bill while I start to eat, and force me to stop and pay while my food gets cold, not the waitress decision, but her execution was bollocks.  

No interest in returning to this place, even though it looks like it could be a fun night out....
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: I would go lower than one star if I could. They don't clean anything in there. I went there and had three drinks and was throwing up for 7 hours. They don't clean their soda lines and I doubt they clean much else. If they don't care about the health of their customers they don't deserve to even be open. I will never be back and I hope they go out of business and are replaced by someone who actually cares.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: If 0 stars were possible i would leave it.what a scummy place.the so called bartenders are a joke .very rude the food sucks the owner is a piece of trash. The fatboy bouncer is a joke .Hey fat boy your not tough or scary like you portray yourself.Do not eat at this scumbag so called bar.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: My favorite dive bar around town. Betty, the bartender, upstairs, is the best.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: This is indeed still one of the best dive bars in town.  Free shuffleboard? Yes please.  They also have 3 pool tables (1 upstairs, 2 downstairs).  They also have darts!  We went here with a group of 8.  Had one entire side of the bar to ourselves.  The bartenders were super friendly, but not the most attentive.  In the past the downstairs tends to be the older crowd with the upstairs being considerably younger.  We decided to stay downstairs and we here for about 3 hours or so.  I've never ordered food here and probably never will, but I did see a fair amount of people with food at the bar.  This is the most down to earth, unpretentious sports bars around.  We were probably the most loud and obnoxious people there, but never felt out of place or threatened.  Will always come back.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text:
Really rude and unprofessional management here.

Long story short, Im 23 and lost my license once so I have a duplicate ID, which understandably gives reason to request secondary identification. Bars usually will accept a credit/debit card, college ID, or have you recite your information to them, but that was not satisfactory for the bouncer here and I had to leave.

Understandable. A job is a job, and I'm all for giving second chances. He told me something with a picture and a date of birth is required, so next week I showed up with my current, valid US Passport.

Nope! Denied again. Funny thing, the bouncer said if I was a non-american he could accept my passport as valid ID.

This was upsetting cause I'm tired of going to the same bars in my town. I decided to call and speak with the owner/manager the next day. I explained my situation and asked what exactly is required for a person in my situation with a duplicate ID? She said the ONLY thing they would accept is an expired license, which I did not have, so I would not be allowed in. No passports no birth certificates no nothing.

To add salt to the burn, when I mentioned how I felt it was an unreasonable policy and will be discouraging friends from going as a result, she (the owner) said "You do what you want, Fuck you" then hung up.

Well, obviously I'm not gunna leave a positive review after this experience. I'm sure the lower staff there is nice and the regulars might be cool, but holy shit, what a immature, disrespectful businesswoman.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: Went here on a Saturday night with three friends. The beer-gut bouncer was rude and creepy towards two girls in my group. The downstairs bar was almost empty and the upstairs was filled. Understaffed, crappy music, and long wait times made us leave early. Only plus was finding a dollar some drunk had left in the juke box... Not worth the time
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: We went here after a wedding. It is a terrible dive. It took a while for our sever to come over. Maybe it was because they are not used to a crowd. When the server took our order, she seemed a bit bothered. When they finally came out, the fries were over cooked. On the plus side the draft selection was ok for the area. The wings were just ok. If you are stuck going after a wedding it's fine. I guess there are not many choices in the area. I would never choose to go here.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: Friendly bartenders, $1 pool tables, decent prices on beer and cocktails. Very casual and fun.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text:
Went out for a beer with a family member. Figured we'd give Sharkey's a try. The bartender was a bit rude, as if she was rushed to give us our beers when the bar was not really that busy. When we sat to drink them I quickly noticed why. She was busy dancing, singing, and shaking her butt in an attempt to get a good tip from two men who were there.
I understand when a bar is busy and buzzing you may have to flag down the bartender to refresh your drink. My company wanted another beer and instead of being aware of the patrons she waited over 5 minutes to get her attention to get another beer. Ridiculous. She acted as if it was a bother to have to do her job!
I hear the food here is great. I do plan to go back at least one more time to try their food. Hopefully service will be better this time.
I also noticed how unkept the woman's room was... Sure, people write on the walls and it's an adult establishment, but I would embarrassed to own a place with such awful things written ALL over the stalls in the bathroom. Not to mention there was toilet paper all over the floor and it seemed a bit dirty. On a busy night I can understand the bathroom being overlooked a bit, but not one employee stepped into the bathroom the whole time we were there to even check if it needed to be cleaned a bit. It made it seem that this is the norm. I'd hate to have to be there on a busy night! I couldn't imagine how gross it gets when it's actually busy if thats what it's like when it's not. 
It was also a cold, icy night when we visited and the parking lot was very poorly salted. There were give ice spots near and on the walk way, as well. Very dangerous, especially with inebriated people leaving. I wouldn't be surprised if someone falls and gets seriously hurt one day. If the owners are reading this please do a better salt job in the winter months. People are sue happy now a days.
Thumbs up for use music. I have to say it was a decent variety and more to my taste. No hip hop/rap. Stuck to the classics and that was the best part of my experience there.
I'm hoping when I try again things are better. If so, I'll change my review, but for now 2 stars is where it stands.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: We walked into this place and literally walked right out after 20 minutes. The bouncer was a prick to me and my friend and carded us after not saying a word to the two girls we were with and letting them go right through. When we went to get drinks, it took the bartender a good 15 minutes before she finally served us after walking right by us a few times. Overheard the person next to us say they had to wait a half hour for their food to come out. Highlight of the night was my friend finding a dollar. Parking lot was a complete dump. Most definitely won't be back.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: I've eaten so much food at this place over the years I may have enabled them to add a wing. Never had a problem.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text:
I'm sure the bartender is selling drugs. She does not want to get you a beer. I think her name is Lisa she drives a black Jetta. Sometimes a white ford pick up. The only reason I know that is I saw her seller selling drugs in the parking lot across the street. Avoid this place Unless you want drugs.   

Don't eat anything at sharkys you will get sick.

text:
Of all the Williamstown bars, Sharky's has the youngest most rock orientated crowd.  That's what really makes the place special.  Otherwise, its a decent neighborhood bar - not quite the dive others describe it as, though you'l never mistake it for an elitist establishment.  

The bar is spread between two floors.  Downstairs has a corner bar vibe, upstairs more of a sports bar.  The bar also has a deck upstairs.   Like the other bars in the area, Sharky's opted to put "good looking girl" ahead of "fast and attentive" in their qualifications for bar tender, though the service isn't bad.  Unlike House of Brews, Taylors, and Geets, the bar tenders are more milfy hot than out of your league tart hot.   Ordinary beer prices are what you would expect for a bar of this kind. The beer specials tend to be on nasty Coors.  They frequently have booze brand reps giving away trinkets.  

 But in the end, its the crowd and the music choice is what makes the place.  Bob and Doug's is ghetto.  Geets is more middle age and kind of lame.  House of brews is older and more stuffy.  Taylors is d-bag central.  But Sharky's is a house full of rocker kids.  Since that's my style (even if I'm a little old for it), that makes Sharky's the place for me.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: Went up the stairs by accident to the top floor and was told that we had come in the wrong way and had to go back downstairs and enter correctly. Keep in mind, Sharky's is nothing more than a dive and I'm pretty sure that we weren't inconveniencing the other 3 people sitting upstairs. A pitcher of Yuengling for $11. No thanks. I won't return and I discourage anyone from going.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: Would not accept a valid government issued military ID.  Would not recommend.  Very disappointing.

text: Sharkys use to be a great bar, horrible service and they treat military guys horrible.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill

text: I'm not usually one to leave reviews, but I really did not enjoy my time here. Stopped by on a Sunday night. Place wasn't packed at all. The food we ordered was pretty awful, not really worth any of the money we paid for it. Drinks were overpriced and small in size. The atmosphere inside this place was awful, there wasn't even music playing except the occasional song that someone put on the jukebox. No sort of entertainment at all. The bartender working that night had to be chased down numerous times, and she took our orders by screaming at us from across the room rather than coming over to us. Her friend came in at some point, and we were entirely ignored from that moment onward as they sat at the other end of the bar and gossiped with each other. Sadly, I will never be back here. I love a good dive bar and I'm all about supporting small businesses. But this was by far the worst experience I've ever had in my life.

text: Walked in around 12:45 because they are open until 3 am. Excited to get a drink or two in, until they refused my passport. Their policy is that they "can't accept passports". A bar/restaurant are supposed to accept them and I was shocked that they didn't.  I've been using my passport to get into places for months. text: This is my favorite bar. The staff is friendly, the food is great and the drinks are priced extremely reasonably. Their specials are great every day and we love the $3 shot shelf!

text: I love this place! Great spot to watch the game or just hang out with friends. Three pool tables, free shuffleboard and darts.  Daily food and drink specials too.
name: Sharky's Sports Bar & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Bars, Nightlife, Sports Bars, Restaurants

text: This place is the best restaurant around Glenolden! The food is amazing because they have professional chefs in there and the service is wonderful 5 stars.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text: 39 North has to have the best clams in white sauce in Delco. Tuesday nights is special all you can eat clams for $14.95. The first plate includes spaghetti, and salad or soup. The clams were the very small cockle type, perfectly cooked, every one of them open. Most important, these clams were CLEAN! not a speck of sand. I didn't count, but there were easily 20-24 clams on a reasonable amount of spaghetti. The white sauce was in a light butter and wine sauce, with plenty there to dip warm rolls into. Service was excellent, nicely attentive as they took away empty dishes & brought a second order of clams and sauce on time. A nice surprise in what appears to be your average Delco sports bar from the outside.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text: Really great food and the watress was really friendly. Great Beer on tap....we arrived at 7 p.m and they had live music until late.... At least until around midnight when we left. The Bartender was also super friendly and had great conversations with us.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text: Well it was another night I didn't feel like cooking. So I thought we could try this place out. We the Mrs and my self arrive with no other expectations other than getting some food and a few drinks. The server Annie was Awesome very professionalism prompt with any request or questions we had for her... she made us feel very welcome as I could go on-about our server. The food was excellent as if you read any of my other reviews you'll know that I am honest and will tell you what my true dinning  experience I had the all you can eat mussels and they were so good I had to force myself not to eat any more. I highly recommend this place if want some great food and service as for Annie and you can't go wrong.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text:
Went here for a Saturday night out to catch some sports and listen to some live music (which was going on from 5-8). 
The place was pretty crowded in the bar area, not so much on the table/restaurant side. 
Our Waitress Jess was very nice and helpful. It seems as though many people there knew each other which indicates there is a local element to the place which is fine, they obviously have a base clientele. 
We started with a few appetizers, the cheese steak egg rolls were good however one of them was a little overdone. They had good flavor with a little spicy kick. The other appetizer was a fried seafood sampler with Calamari, Shrimp and Clams Casino. This was very good and cooked to perfection with a nice portion. 
We decided to split a meal since we were pretty full from the appetizers. We went with the Chicken Marsala and again the portion size was generous. The Marsala sauce was tasty as were the green beans and mashed potatoes that came with the dish. No big complaints about the food. 
The noise level in the place is pretty high, probably because the place is wide open. This noise was apparent even when the live musician was playing. There was a DJ that started at 9 and he did a great job of mixing up the music genres. The crowd really picked up around 10 and the age group of the crowd was pretty diverse but leaned toward the 20/30's group. 
Overall this seems like a fun place to hang out or have dinner. The noise level is high so if you're looking for quiet/intimate then this isn't you're place. 
I will add that since it is winter we found the restaurant seating area to be pretty cold. There are 2 exit/entry doors on that side of the building and every time the door opened the cold air rushed in and there was no protection from it. The heat didn't appear to on very high so the cold drafts made it tough. We actually moved tables once to avoid the cold from the door opening. 
Overall the experience was great and we would definitely consider going here again.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text: Bad burger, pieces of bone , not tasty. Great Service.

text: The only reason I even gave one star was because the waitress was very friendly but I should have known there was a problem when she didn't ask me how I wanted my ribeye cooked, when I asked her about it she said that they all are done medium well to well, needless to say my steak came out well done when I like medium rare so it was like eating a hockey Puck, my wife got clams and spaghetti and I've never tasted a dull clam in my life until this place, no taste and the wine sauce was bitter as they come, the vegetables I had with my steak had a nice explosion of water with every bite telling me they were obviously frozen. Such a disappointment.

text: Went here when we were int own visiting family. I'll be honest, I didn't have high expectations and was pleasantly surprised. Our waitress was very sweet and accommodating. While I've definitely had better cosmos in my life, they had a decent drink selection at very reasonable prices. The bread basket was delicious, filled with warm pipping hot bread. Got the mussels appetizer which was great - tasted fresh and was smothered in a delicious white wine broth. I opted for the crab cakes which were full of lump crab meat and not a lot of filling. They were fantastic. It came with mashed potatoes and veggies, as well as a tasty, basic starter salad. The folks at our table ordered chicken piccata, scallops, a seafood pasta - everyone seemed to really enjoy their meals. The prices were very reasonable and the staff was friendly and attentive. There was also live music, even at 6pm on a Saturday. If I was in the area again, I would return.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text: This is honestly my first ever Yelp review but I was treated so well here I felt compelled to tell others about it. Got delayed in Philly and was stuck in an airport hotel and had to get out for a bit. Despite being from out of town I was treated like a local. Food was better than it should be for a sports bar but even more impressive was the service. Had 3-4 different people wait on me during my time here and if anything they were too attentive which is obviously an oxymoron. If this place was in my neighborhood I'd eat here once a week. Whether you're in town for 1 night or live close by give these guys a shot.
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text:
I stepped in for lunch and the place had two other patrons.  Bathroom floors were extremely sticky and didn't appear clean for a place that just opened an hour prior.  Strike 1

I went to order their main featured burger off the menu, but they were out of the cheese for the burger.  Strike 2

I ended up ordering a "Specialty Sandwich", the Chicken Inner Harbor -Boneless Chicken Breast Sauteed in Olive Oil w/Garlic, Roasted Peppers, Sauteed Spinach & Smoked Mozzarella.  The bottom of the bun was completely soaked, Chicken was very bland and it had a hint of Smoke.  The spinach was probably the only decent part and you could detect slight garlic.  $9 was a bit on the high side for what you get.  Fries were $1.75 additional.  Strike 3

$8 for a 10oz pour of craft beer outside the City is on the high side as well.  

Hard to excuse a poorly made sandwich at all, but when only three people are in the establishment during prime lunch time with a whopping three food orders, that's pretty bad.  The server was a nice young girl and that is why there's an extra star. I'm one for giving a place a second try, but I'll pass and spend my money elsewhere.  Definitely a reason why only two other people were in your place at lunch.  Yikes
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text:
I've been meaning to give this place the full treatment for a while. It finally happened yesterday. 

I didn't come in with high expectations. Bars on Mac Dade Blvd aren't always known for food quality. I was content with a simple sandwich and a beer. 

The menu itself is rather basic. It's heavy on sandwiches, appetizers, burgers, and cheesesteaks. But yesterday they had two items on special that caught my eye. The French Onion soup and New Orleans chicken sandwich seemed like a good combo. 

The soup surprised me. It had a nice amount of cheese along with good flavor in the broth. My expectations suddenly were raised. 

The sandwich was huge. It was overloaded with chicken and cheese and had a great Cajun bite to it. Most importantly it was juicy. Grilled chicken sandwiches often dry out. This one was perfect. 

I came in thinking I would get a pretty basic lunch experience. I left feeling like I ate something pretty special. Kudos!
name: 39 North Taproom & Grill
categories: American (Traditional), Sports Bars, Restaurants, Bars, Nightlife, Steakhouses, Salad, Beer Bar

text: No unreasonable waits, great service, and their food is a decent local alternative to Italian chains.  Do not go to the other two Gavi's!  You will be disappointed.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text:
So sad to see the restaurant leave the northwest side at their Foothills Mall location. It was not the most authentic Italian food in town but I had never had a bad meal there. I absolutely loved the seafood manicotti and many other dishes from the menu. It always tasted fresh and very homemade.

Plus, my husband and I got engaged there. Not the most romantic ambiance some might say but it was perfect for us. 

Good bye Gavi, you will be missed.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text:
Probably my favorite restaurant in Tucson.  The peppers, pasta and bread they give to start your dinner is amazing. I have tried numerous things there and everything is always excellent.  You can't go wrong with this place.  The only downside is most of the dishes are rich so either eat less or accept the calories with a smile. 

I recommend this place to everyone.  It delicious, reasonably priced and not pretentious.

Also their house salad dressing is really good.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text: This place has been great every time I've been.  They have a huge selection of pastas (and a lot without meat, which I appreciate).  Their house salad dressing is sooo good.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text: horrible service. no  croutons on salad. no salad forks at all. overpriced slop.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text:
Gavi is not a nice romantic Italian restaurant.  It is mostly green, with a wall full of alcohol bottles and sports paraphernalia littering the walls.  The dining room consists of many tables and two booths.  There is also an outdoor seating area that feels like it's part of the parking lot.

They have a version of mozzarella sticks that are a must try.  They're more like two slabs of cheese fried and then smothered in marinara sauce with basil and parmesan sprinkled on top.  Very good and you can use the extra sauce to dip the complimentary bread in.

The menu lacks flavor on all things but their marinara sauce.  The marinara sauce is not too sweet, not too tomatoey, not too bitter.  The fettuccine alfredo is bland and requires lots of red peppers.  The mozzarella prosciutto sandwich is my favorite thing on the menu, the bread is soft with a firm crust, the meats and cheeses are only alright at best, but the mustard-mayonnaise sauce gives it a nice kick.

I can't resist cannoli's.  They have them here, and for $6 you can get something that looks like a cannoli, is called a cannoli, but is filled with cream instead of cheese.  Still, it is very good and worth ordering.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text:
This was a 2nd choice as our first choice in Tucson proper was packed.

I had the spaghetti with meat sauce which was pretty decent. It was a homemade sauce with lots of meat and even chunks of real tomatoes in it. The sauce was not sickeningly sweet and actually tasted pretty decent.

The bread was fresh on the table and the cold antipasti was excellent. Salads were fresh and not from a bag and the dressings were decent.

A loud atmosphere inside and the crowding of the tables inside would be the only downfall. Also, they sat a party of four at a table that at most could fit 2 comfortably.

Service was decent, but not exceptional. There were times our table of four was ignored but drinks seemed to be refilled on a regular basis. Hostess staff was not impressive and seemed to be bored or uninterested and seemed to spend most of the time flirting with the waiters as they ran their tickets next to the host staff.

From my two local Tucson natives, this location is better than the one on Broadway I believe.

I wanted this to be a 4* review but due to the few shortcomings it will have to remain at 3. Not good for groups due to the small, crammed together tables and relatively few booths.

Typical mall parking situation.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant
categories: Italian, Restaurants

text: Love this place.  It's hard to find because it's one of the storefronts in the Mall but it faces out towards La Cholla near the intersectin of Ina.  I haven't been to any of the other Gavis, but this one is cool.  Great, great pastas...and believe it or not the best French Toast I've had for breakfast (yep--all three meals).  Amazing, amazing wine list organized by the region and appellation within Italy.  Did I mention the pasta's were great? Love this place! ...I know, I said this already.
name: Gavi Italian Restaurant

text: Best sports bar with amazingly good food. Ice cold beer and huge beer selection. I'd come weekly for dinner and the get my la batt blue draft beer
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
This is the best sports bar and restaurant you can go to in Wesley Chapel! Located on the second floor of Florida Hospital Center Ice, it overlooks Rink B and Rink D. Like any sports bar you can watch any sport on any of the many TV's they have. You can also watch hockey/figure skating/curling/public skating in person while dining or having a drink. Then if all of that watching gets you motivated you can go and do it at the same place! 

There is a full bar including many craft beers and the owners very own tap of 81bay's beers. There is also many other local Tampa brews on tap! 

As for the food, many are surprised that this is not your average sports food there is a nice diversity and there are many healthy options and divulgent options too for any diet or preference. The food may take a bit longer wait than expected but that is only because almost everything is made fresh from scratch in the kitchen. There is a snack bar owned by the same owners downstairs in the rink if you are more in a hurry.

Their menu has influences like Ybor City for the Ybor Eggrolls, Canadian Hockey traditional Poutine dishes, and a Tampa Bay Lightning Bleu Burger. They have a small kids menu and the whole restaurant including the bar is Kid-friendly. The chef is an amazing person who sometimes comes out to talk to customers as are all the staff including the owners, bartenders, hostess, servers, and kitchen staff. They also cater and are very patient and accommodating to any problems or special requests.

I highly recommend this restaurant! Make sure to stop by if you are looking for something more fun, exciting, and authentic than a chain-restaurant can provide you.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text: Starting with the positive, the Cuban egg rolls are great, the homemade chips and wings are good (that all comes on one appetizer). The negative is very, very slow service and very pricey. It was $85 for a family of 4 with 3 soft drinks and water, 1 appetizer and we each ordered a meal. The rest of the food was only average. And the menu has changed, so what you see online may not be what they actually have.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
The service is phenomenal and attentive! Everyone is so polite and our glasses of water was refilled constantly when I didn't even notice. 

Okay to the best part - the food!! We had the grilled wings with their house wing sauce it was delicious!! It was perfectly grilled and very meaty. Unlike the typical deep fried wings served at other sports bars, these wings are a specialty here and I highly recommend it! We also had the nachos and tuna stack, they were so good and the nachos were served on a large tray it's perfect for sharing. The tuna stack was so tasty for an appetizer I could've eaten that as my entree I loved the crispy wonton and plaintain chips served with it. 

I'm very impressed with this restaurant/sports lounge. It's conveniently located in the Florida hospital center ice, you can watch the ice skaters or catch the sports games on any of the (many) TVs that they offer here.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text: For my yelpers that love hockey or sports bars  in general. This place is low key and a great bar. It's @ the Ice centre on the 2nd floor. I forgot who the name of the bartender, but  she was really nice and helpful.  But love the idea the Bar is between two ice rink where you can eat and drink, as well enjoy  some hockey. Okay, now for the food, I'll tell you try tuna bowl or any burger. But i definetly had the bowl called the Thunder Chop Chop(Chicken Blackened). My significant other had the Classic Burger that was well seasoned. I will definitely be coming back here really soon. The environment seems real laid back, but  i can see already on weekends the place is pack due to adults and kids coming to skate at the Ice centre on weekends. I think this is best bar in Wesley Chapel period. Especially better than the basic commercialized restaurants.

text: Came here thanks to recommendation from the great Yelpies, Boon & Grace! We were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and awesomeness of this grill inside the ice rink. We liked everything we ordered. The food was more gourmet than typical bar food and offered good selection, like tuna tartare, tuna bowl as well as salads and grill selections. I do have to knock their point for flubbing happy hour offers. We ordered draft beers thinking they were part of the HP and later they told us that they were not-- only 4 beers were part of HP. In my opinion, since they mistakenly told us all beers were included at first, they should have honored HP prices. This restaurant is still very new and so is the staff so hopefully they get this right.

text:
So... Found this hidden gem sometime last fall (with the yelp "map search"). Wandered over to have a quick beer. Saw some of the food, and couldn't resist. 

For a one who doesn't like to read...  This place is a very cool sports bar, with exceptionally good food. Just come over and find out in person. If you like to read, please continue...

First visit was a Tuna Bowl. Absolutely perfect seared tuna over a big bowl of rice. Lots of wonton chips. Was miserably full, but couldn't stop eating (my problem, not theirs). 

Two visits over the winter. Tried different angus burgers. Delivered as promised. 

Finally tried the "brisket bender".  Absolutely delicious, but more of a pot roast texture. Maybe I am just to hungry for a truly objective review.  I don't care what cut of beef it is, I can't stop eating. 

Anyway... this place is worth a visit. It's a sports bar, surrounded by ice skating rinks, so business casual would just confuse them. Attire is anything you want, from casual to beach formal. Anyone expecting a formal event will be checked into the boards!
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

Bonus is you can typically see live hockey below for some added excitement or take a little half time stroll on the ice yourself. Met the owners who are local and really care about their product and patrons. Would highly recommend and get the Cuban egg rolls they are on point!

text:
**You'd think the oven baked fries wouldn't be crispy unless it's deep fried except these were a surprise & excellent - a crunch in most bites for Slash Heat Poutine! LOVED the sautéed onions & jalapeños, which I wouldn't mind more of because I love a bit of heat! The sweet corn and bountiful amount of brisket is exactly what the Dr. ordered in 2020!**

**Hubs got a Dirty Martini - they use a cheap Vodka, which is acceptable for $4. I especially liked my 81Bay (another fav. local brewery) Lightning Lager for a surprisingly low price of $3.50. Happy Hour is a good deal!**

In case you didn't know, Top Shelf is located on the second level w/views of two hockey rings - this is one of the coolest discoveries, especially if your kids are at hockey practice/game. 

QR menu available!

Areas of improvement:
1.) Sat for 5-8 min. before being greeted, am extra patient because of Covid-19.
2.) Our waitress didn't have her nose covered while wearing a mask - she was younger whereas the manager was following protocols!
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text: Food was surprisingly very good. Wings were some of the best I have had. I recommend the original ones. Decor is a little too cafeteria like but, staff and food are worth the trip
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
So tonight I had the pleasure of dining in Top Shelf Sports Lounge. Now a few days prior I did the delivery route and it was not what my fellow Yelpers been writing about. After tonight I definitely can say I must Retract my last review. 

Everyone deserves a second chance and tonight was that chance. I met one of the owners (Ray) along with an AMAZING STAFF and the genius master creator of their food the Chef. 

For starters, we had the top shelf chips and the Bruddah Rays Ahi Tuna Stack. The chips were yummy but what separated these chips from everyone else was the Balsamic drizzle. I swear if I did not ask the waitress to take the plate away I would've still been indulging my mouth with these chips. Now the Ahi Tuna Stack was a masterpiece of art within itself so dope that you do not want to destroy it. But once you get the courage to do so the taste is an epic experience. The wonton strips along with the ponzu sauce will keep you wanting more.

My children had the kids mac & cheese, kept them happy that we even took home the leftovers. Now my entreé for the evening was the Top shelf Wings. Hands down the best freaking wings I came across since living in Tampa. I thought Union 72 BBQ had good wings. Not no more! 

The thing about being a reviewer is the truthfulness we write on what we ate or tried at an establishment. What made me go and try Top Shelf in person this evening was the fact that the owner reached out to me. This showed me on how much pride they take in the food they prep and deliver to their consumers. Any establishment that wants to show me, a reviewer that I was wrong, is a place that I can respect. 

I left here with a full belly and already planning my next visit along with family and friends. Kudos to Joe and Ray along with the Top Shelf Sports Lounge staff. You won me over with love being put into your dishes.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text: I absolutely love the food at Top Shelf.  I'm surprised to admit that a restaurant at the hockey rink is my favorite restaurant but it is. Great food, friendly staff, decent specials on certain days. Full liquor bar with great signature drinks. My only bugaboo is that drinks are really expensive, but the food will keep you coming back, I promise you. It's so good I try to order something new every time so I can try everything and  EVERYTHING has been delicious!
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
When we first visited the Ice Centre, we know there is a restaurant going to be open in the Centre. It take them a year for this restaurant to be open. When we know about the news for opening this month, we decided to stop by and check. I also invite couple of Yelp friends to join us. 

Judging the price of the menu, it is about 10% more than regular restaurant. However we were no regrets that because the food measured up with the price we paid. It still has some bump to iron out, our waitress is still don't know which beer is happy hours. They offer happy hours item from 4 pm to 7 pm Monday to Friday. The app is 25% off from the pregame section. The draft beer is $2 off. 

We started with Ybor egg roll. It has mojo pork, ham and salami wrap together. Who can resist it. I also get the tuna bowl. It seared blacken Ahi tuna over rice and Asian slaw. It has the honey soy ginger sauce. It was quite good. Lastly we have the Top Shelf wings. This is must have item. It is about $0.20 more than normal outside restaurant wing place. However, it worth the money. This wing is marinated in mojo sauce, then grill over the open flame and top with the house sauce. It was delicious. 

Overall is good experience. The place has TV. But who actually watched it when you can see live hockey from the high school competition. Love the game, love the food.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
Not bad. The Farmhouse Club was a good sandwich, but not what you'd be expecting of a typical club sandwich.  This is a fried chicken sandwich with avocado, bacon, onion, and tomato, not arranged on layers of toast.  Disappointing were the house chips.  Although advertised as "seasoned", these were considerably more bland than Kettle Chips, but thicker. 

They have a pretty good selection of beers and spirits, but my second glass of water was slow to come.

This place is not worth a drive, but if your child is playing hockey or ice skating, or if you're a guest of the Hampton or Holiday Inn they are a fairly satisfying stop.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
I would have given Top Shelf 10 stars if I could. 

I am a regular at this establishment and decided to order catering for my office for the first time. Not only was the process so simple, but the food was incredible. We got the house wings (which I think are the best), house chips, cuban (OMG) but the real shining star was the pasta salad which was the best I have ever had. It was so full of flavor in every bite I just had to have seconds. Portions were great for price and the food was incredible. If you have not eaten here, RUN! Certainly best food in the area. WOW!

text:
This review is only based on their "Soon to be Famous" house style wings! I have not tried anything else yet on the menu.

Can I just say that the house style wings was one of the BEST tasting wings I ever had and In my opinion it is the BEST in WESLEY CHAPEL. 

They are grilled not fried so it's not greasy at all. They were marinated overnight so they are very flavorful. Delicious!!! When you can eat the wings without needing any ranch or blue cheese, I call that a WINNER! 

SN: it is more expensive that other wing related restaurants in the area if you compare prices but it's sooooo good!

Other than that, it's located in a ice skating arena. It's not uncomfortably cold in the restaurant. It's a bar type, casual atmosphere and it's overlooking one of the ice rinks in the arena.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge

text: A true hidden gem! This sports lounge is located INSIDE the Advent Health Center Ice rink! Who would have thought?! The lounge is on the second floor of the rink and you can see the rinks down on the first floor which is really cool. They have a full bar and excellent food! Staff was friendly and always had a smile. I ordered a sangria and the Buffalo chicken Mac and cheese. It came with garlic bread and was full of crispy chicken and scallions. My date got the BBQ bacon burger and said it was delicious! Will definitely be back when I'm back in the area! (PS-I hear they even have brunch!)

text: Yuck! Not what I expected at all (not even close) especially after being impressed with the food pictures (tuna dishes are my favorite). The decor was very minimal (minus the ok bar) and it looked as if they specialize in pizza and wings. I'm not an ice skater but thought it would be a cool place to start a friday night with friends. Guess it would be cool if you're into ice skating (and use to the musty smells of old socks) and wanted to watch a game while the kids were skating....its a place to grab a beer but definitely not the environment I expected considering the name and pictures posted here. text:
So just did the delivery route off of Uber eats and was kind of disappointed. Not surprised for I'm always a person who believes what you order in-house is not the same love as they send out. Tonight that was proven once again. 

My expectations were set on a 4 star and better rating meal delivered. For the reviews on here were great from my fellow Yelpers. Unfortunately, you can't believe all that you read. Will say in their defense that they do not have control of the Uber drivers. For this, our food was warm and not hot enough. 

Our meals of choice for this evening were for the Mrs. I ordered her the blackened shrimp lettuce wrap. She loved it and my wife is very hard to please so kudos to the chef at the Top Shelf Sports Lounge. For my boys simple and a basic rice and beans. Nothing fancy about it they were okay with it but not the best rice and beans they had. Lastly, for myself, I ordered the Thunder chop chop bowl which I wanted to love. But due to a sufficient amount of burnt rice in the dish, they fell short of receiving my love. 

Definitely willing to try them again this time in-house. So until I make it over there this rating will stand. Everyone deserves a second chance to prove themselves. Till we meet again Top Shelf Sports Lounge.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
Wow! This  restaurant you can  eat meal, drink beer and watch live  hockey game at the same time.  "Top Shelf Sports Lounge is a 2,500 Sq ft. full service, high energy restaurant and bar that position on the second floor in the dead center of the Florida Hospital Center Ice Facility"  There  are happy hour deal for certain beer and appetizers.
The menu was well designed. They   cover everybody's old time favorites- BBQ , burger,  sub, taco , chicken wings and the  trendy Poke bowl.  We tried their chicken wings, tuna bowl and they were delicious . It was fun watching sports programs from TV on the wall as well as the real hockey game down at the rings. Their glass wall overlook the two ice skating rings that on  Friday night the  high school hockey league was playing.  
Good service, cool ambience and yummy food, this is a sport bar not to miss, specially hockey fans!

text:
Top Shelf Sports Lounge is a bit of a hidden gem. You would not expect great food at an ice arena, but they will check all your expectations right into the penalty box. They are a bit hidden in the upper level and they are open during regular hours even when there is not an event.  For the most part unless they are busy, you can just walk through the arena and get a bit to eat.  

I tried the tuna bowl and Havana bowl, both tasted excellent. The tuna bowl has slices of seared blackened tuna and the Havana bowl has mojo roast pork.  Prices and quality are great. Some menu items such as the bowls are fairly healthy others are more like pub food. They also have burgers and Poutine, a delicious Canadian dish with french fries cheese curds and gravy. I have not tried the poutine, but look forward to next time!
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text: Amazing! We loved it! The place was packed! Started off with the nachos, which were delicious and came with homemade potato chips with a yummy sauce and mojo pork. I had a bowl with rice and shrimp that was amazing, came with an amazing sauce on there and it was the perfect amount of spicy and had amazing flavors. My boyfriend had the brisket bender, which came with mashed potatoes and kale, which he loved. We talk about the next time we can go back all the time as we live about 30 minutes away, but loved it so much! The menu has some incredible options and I doubt anything ordered will lead to disappointment!

text:
If you can't handle a miscommunication and resulting frustration without resorting to mocking and laughing at your customers, you probably shouldn't be in business. 

We gave this place one more go after a couple inconsistencies throughout 8 or 9 orders (missing ingredients a few times, wait times for to go always seemed like our food had been sitting way too long - plus usually nobody out front, they all hang out in the kitchen)...honestly when the food was good, it was really really good, ya know? 

Too bad we chanced it again and had the same issues today, thankfully we caught it at the car and went back inside to recover 2 missing ingredients. They took care of the quinoa for my boyfriend's salad but said the avocados they had weren't ripe enough yet, and both entrees listed avocado. Somehow this wasn't noted by anyone or relayed to us while ordering. My boyfriend asked for some sort of compensation for that and the instances before - not a full refund, just to help with the repetitive inconveniences. Note that we never asked for a full refund, at any point...

Somehow the manager could not comprehend this. He offered to take back the food and then grabbed the bag from me, and I snatched it back because we had already paid and he refused to hear us out. I simply didn't want to return my food after being told a 25 minute wait time that seemed horribly inaccurate given the sparse state of the restaurant. 

What resulted was a bit of chaos and confusion. Everyone got more frustrated trying to get to the source of the problem then he began mocking us as I explained our experiences in the past, quoting my words back and laughing. He couldn't understand why we would come back if we had noticed anything wrong to begin with. The reason was me giving them the benefit of the doubt because anyone who's worked in restaurants knows that it can be variable and stressful... Joke's on us though as proven by his incredulous laughter, followed by "I'll just get you the full refund. I know what kind of people you are and what you want." 

At that point I felt we're dealing with a personal bias more than anything else. He would rather pay $30 back to us to be rude and unapologetic, rather than admit any fault or discuss the matter logically. Also, when someone says "I've been in the restaurant business for years" as a defense tactic when I ask why I'm being laughed at... it doesn't give them credibility. It feels like pulling at straws because they don't know the right way to handle a lack of communication from their employees. Terribly unprofessional, and a horrible experience, but maybe that's why they're in a place with guaranteed business from the sports rather than trying to make it on their own.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

I got food poisoning from this restaurant.  I ordered a turkey burger with avocado, spinach.  Two hours later I'm in the bathroom.  I ended up in the hospital 5 hours after that from sickness and dehydration.  I spoke to owner wanted to claim no responsibility but wanted to give me a gift card for my troubles.  I said no I want you to pay my hospital bill!  Don't go there unless you want to get eix

You didn't give me a gift card I didn't want a gift card.  I wanted my hospital bill paid.  Why would you offer me a gift card if you feel like it wasn't your fault.  Food was mishandled that day, I'm sure of it.  Many servers were very busy.  I am sure that the proper procedures weren't being used.  I was sick from YOUR RESTAURANt no where else.  I also wasn't the only one who got sick.  I'm just the only one with guts to say something. 
Sorry is not enough!  I missed two hockey games ( was there from out of town for my son's hockey tournament) spent over a day in bed and went to the hospital and got a large bill even with my insurance which is extremely good and expensive every month.  And I'm sure I will get more bills.  It's not fair!
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
categories: Burgers, Sports Bars, Bars, Lounges, Restaurants, Salad, Wraps, Nightlife, American (New)

text:
Tried this place out after reading all of the other reviews. Our kids had a blast and due to the TVs and bar atmosphere, I wasn't worried about bothering others with their noise! Got to watch some youth hockey and the lightning game! Beer was cold, service was fast, food was great! 

I got the house wings and they didn't disappoint! Husband got the tuna bowl, scarfed it down! The kids got the Mac and cheese... both loved it. Will definitely be back!

text:
The food here is seriously good, and that's impressive because as a destination place they could easily cut corners.  Top notch ingredients and they must have a good chef. It's always packed and they have weekly specials and trivia.

It's very loud and mostly bar food but again the quality is there.  Service is as best as can be given the labor crisis which affects most small businesses in the country.  

Biggest negative is they make you give a credit card when ordering. even when seated at a table.  Never experienced that in my life at a restaurant but not a deal killer.  I do highly recommend trying this place out.  Bring a jacket because you're in an ice hockey place.
name: Top Shelf Sports Lounge
