text: This is my new favorite place for happy hour! Half off all tap wine! By the glass, carafe, or bottle. The atmosphere is wonderful and open. The food is to die for! A MUST order is the mushroom pasta, just wow. Side note, if you're lucky enough to get Chance as a server, makes the experience that much better.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The food here was amazing and the restaurant is super cute inside and outside. Our sever Justin is what really made our experience enjoyable. He gave us many recommendations on the food and beverages. We are also here on vacation and he also gave us recommendations on things to do for the rest of our time here. Would recommend this restaurant to anyone and will be back before we leave.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Thats was Thursday night after hurricane in New Orleans. Place was packed, so it caused a little waiting time on everything. Friendly hostess helped me to find a spot inside, because outside was pretty chill. I tried few items there, and I can't say that it was something special. But I really like exterior and interior. Place looks so cool to me. I really enjoyed being there.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great place with tons of potential but ultimately they need a lot of work. Food was ok, service was poor, drinks were weak, and they do not honor there happy hour on saints Monday game days. This should have been explained when I booked my reservation being happy hour was the reason we were dining here.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Absolutely fabulous food the brussels sprouts were scrump-delicious the green salad was fantastic with candied pecans  and the margarita pizza was wonderful. Do not under estimate the serving size. I  order way-more than I needed to eat but  plan on eating every single bite.  Definitely worth a try.  I will be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Such a fan of this place! I've been twice now, the most recent being with a group of friends for happy hour, and both experiences were amazing. Happy hour starts at 4 and offers half of the carafes of wine. In addition to ordering a few different wines, we also shared several small plates including the duck fat fries, olives, and vegetable flatbread. Everything was delicious, reasonably sized for a medium group, and a good complement to the wines we ordered. 

While the food and wine (on tap!) is definitely worth a trip, their outdoor patio is PHENOMENAL. The live plants and simple, but rustic seating makes an intimate "getaway" from the hustle and bustle of the CBD/downtown area. The crowd is professional, sophisticated, and relaxed. Definitely worth a visit!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Excellent food, phenomenal drinks, superb service, delightful atmosphere.  We had Wonderlust cocktail and margarita pizza with crab deviled eggs and tuna salad all was delicious!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Enter through the courtyard on the corner of Poydras and O'Keefe. Go through the first door on the left to find host stand inside. Had the happy hour tuna tartare w/caviar and bacon wrapped dates. Both were good. 5 stars for service and gorgeous plant covered courtyard. Hostess was welcoming and my server Cemile was a sweetheart. Bonus: They have easy touch-less QR code pay option.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Presentation of the Place: The Bathrooms are nice. It reminds you of  an overpriced hotel that you can feel fancy in while taking a dump. The inside of the place reminds me of an amalgamation of the sets of Cheers, Sex in the City, and some French Noir.

The Food: 

Starter:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs

So, this is the first of many dishes were the common complaint is the lack of salt in the food. From the egg, filling, and crab itself, everything was void of salt or seasoning except for what was a little paprika. The textures are boring and 1 dimensional. For 8 dollars, you are getting 3 deviled eggs at the lowest effort of innovation and care. It is something with less flavor and passion than the ones you are partaking in during Thanksgiving at your grandmas.

Brussels Sprouts with Garlic Aioli and Grated Parmesan.

The Brussels sprouts are cooked exceptional well, which is rare. This is ruined, by the lack of salt and seasoning again. I assume this is due to the amount of Parmesan shaved on top of the dish. This gives the dish an overwhelming umami flavor, and it forces you to reach for the garlic aioli to counter it. After about 10 bites, you begin to realize how white you are because you are essentially eating cheese and mayo. 


Entrees:

Ratatouille with filet

No salt on the filet on top. No salt in the dish itself. What is on the Filet is a lot of balsamic vinegar, which is overpowering. The tomato paste hasn't been stewed long enough, so the dish is really acidic especially with the amount of balsamic vinegar being used.  

Quail and Boudin

This dish is weird. If you ever had a fever dream and was wondering man I wish I could eat that, this is what it taste like. The portion of boudin and quail you get is actual small for the price. Guess what the quail doesn't have on it? The fry on the quail isn't good and the breading breaks offs. The chicken gumbo taste so strange like they almost put soy sauce in it and also has notes of sour. The boudin is really good and is the oasis in this odd dish. 


Drinks:

1 Bottle of the Smith and Hook. Your standard Cabernet nothing flashy.
 
Service: 

I usually don't critique service. I understand that we all take breaks at work, but man no water refills, the restaurant isn't busy, and people from the pass are having to bring our food. This is happening while you and your bartender friend are talking the entire time. Not a good look hombre.  

Verdict: A Salty No

If you want to have a glass of wine with the girls or boys, while you look out at Poydras St. I guess this is the place for you. In my opinion, there are far better options location and culinary wise for you to go to.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
HOOOOOOOORIBLE!!! It was 8pm, a friend and I walked in after hearing how "AMAZING" this place was and were left standing at the host stand for several minutes.  I honestly thought the place was closing although there were several people seated both indoors, outdoors on the main floor and outdoors upstairs. 

Finally this chipper but rather confused host comes out to semi great us, but was paying a lot of attention to what was going on back where he had just arrived from. When I asked if we could sit upstairs, we were informed there was a party, which was fine, and then requested the main floor patio. 

After about 10 minutes, the host came back with 2 empty glasses, no water, no tea, no soda, just 2 empty glasses and then walked away. 

We were both starving and it was getting late, awful service, dry drinks, figured we would get better service elsewhere, and we did.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Ok, we didn't have a reservation but they said a half hour wait and we would be able to get something. Well an hour later and she forgot about us.... no big deal we were sitting at the bar and they have over 30 wines on tap! Great concept right? Well we finally got seated outside upstairs. Another great idea, but the street lighting made it incredibly difficult to see the menu and your food. As for food we'll it was a disappointment. Very bland considering New Orleans is a culinary mecca. The layout and looks of this place has incredible presentation. Food needs to be better and this place would be an absolute home run making it almost impossible to get a table on a Friday or Saturday night. Love all the wine options and bartenders down stairs. That's the only reason for the 2 starts. This is New Orleans people! Your food needs to be much better!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
What's better than great food & wine? Great food, wine & service   

Nic took amazing care of us again!! We came for brunch and we were enjoying everything that we ended up staying for lunch as well‍‍

Today we tried the 
- baby Dutch pancake (5/5) 
- 8 oz wagyu burger (5/5)







Love the ambiance perfect outdoor patio seating right in the heart of downtown. 

The landscaping is everything you can tell they really care about details . I also really appreciated the great service thanks Nick R for all the recommendations they were all superb. 

Highly recommend! We will definitely be back I heard they have an amazing brunch.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The Crusher petite syrah - 100% varietal and DELISH. Great atmosphere. Good, solid food. Brussels were excellent. Waiter was friendly and personable. Comfortable environment.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Perfect spot for a group of people or a date night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I got a flight of 4 wines. They say it was 2.5 ounces each but I think they had a heavy pour! They explained each wine and left me with the names written down. We split the goat cheese and fig flat bread and the charcuterie board. The charcuterie board was worth the money. They offered plenty of  accoutrements with the selection. High quality meat and cheese noted and were not skimpy on portions. Probably could skip the flat bread next time. Split the impossible burger which is the best one I have tried thus far in the city. We swapped fries for Brussel sprouts which were worth it. I can't wait to go back to try more wines.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Enjoyed a glass of red and the fig goat cheese flatbread on the patio with a few girls. Wine was delicious as usual! I will say our server did not have one of us sample it before serving us all, which I found a bit odd considering it's a wine bar. The fig and goat cheese flatbread was fresh and came out warm. I did feel it was lacking a bit of flavor- although the goat cheese was great it was really the only thing I could taste on it. The atmosphere is wonderful and our server was friendly. Would consider trying again
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: John is the best sever you're will get period. Such an amazing experience, and the food was delicious. Highly recommended!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Finally got to try Copper Vine for brunch.  Basically, the two big pluses are the food and the ambience.  The courtyard is VERY nice now that we're starting to get some cooler days.  The food was also mostly very good.  The deviled eggs appetizer, while good, wasn't really a standout over other deviled eggs I've had at restaurants.  The main dishes, however, were much better.  My salmon dish was pretty good.  The salmon was nicely cooked and seasoned.  The spinach was very well seasoned as well.  In fact, for some it might be TOO well seasoned.  For me it was enjoyable because I like a bit of spice, but you guys may want to mention on the menu that the spinach features a pretty heavy sprinkle of red pepper flake.  In fact, I'd probably refer to it as a "spicy" spinach because I could definitely see some people being taken by surprise.  The crabcake dish was also very good.  Crabcake was very heavy in crabmeat and light on filler.  Potatoes were done nicely, and sauces on both dishes were handled just right.  As far as main dishes go, the main negatives were the Dutch Baby being I think a bit underdone and the poached eggs having slightly overdone yolks but slightly underdone whites.  No idea how they pulled that one off...    But the main reason for subtraction of a star is the service.  First off, lil black dude who was the host, seemed to have ZERO care about doing his job.  We walked in to no smile or greeting or anything.  He just looked at us.  Fiancee says Hi table for two please.  He says "this way" and unceremoniously brings us to a table right next to the other two parties in the entire place.  So the courtyard has (I counted) 11 tables.  There are 3 parties in total dining at the time.  And he thinks it a good idea to sit us all on top of one another.  That's just a lack of care or common sense or both.  Spread us out a bit!!  He did seem to care GREATLY, however, when an attractive single diner came in.  Even came back to check on her at some point to see that she was "doing OK" *eyeroll*.  Our waitress, on the other hand, was very nice, but maybe seemed to not have a great grip on the POS system as literally EVERY DISH was brought to the wrong table.  Not just ours, but everyone else's.  By the time we had all of our food, there were only 4 tables occupied.  How hard can it be?  Also, she completely forgot my second drink.  BUT she caught her mistake and brought it on the house.  So that is a great positive.  She realized she made a mistake and went above and beyond to make it right without me even bringing it up.  But at the end of the day, the food was very good so I'll very probably be back.  Just, in all honesty, replace the host.  I'm never one to try to rid people of their employment, but if he's only going to show hospitality to patrons he thinks he can flirt with, then he is quite simply in the wrong business.  That, and retrain your wait staff on the table numbers.  I think if y'all can do that, combined with the quality product that the kitchen is putting out, y'all will be very successful.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This is an awesome place to pop in for a light snack or refreshing sip. We popped in on our anniversary and the service was wonderful. Will definitely be back to try some more of their menu items
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
The atmosphere was great, but the receptionist was kind of rude to my group. He directed us to our table but didn't give us the q code to scan for the menu. He sat another group after us with the q code. He never made eye contact with us. After waiting 10 minutes without seeing a server, I got up and asked for a menu.
The food was okay. Kind of overpriced for the quality. We ordered brussel sprouts, truffle fries, 2 orders of deviled eggs and 2 cups of soup for our starters. The brussel sprouts were our favorite even for my friend who never liked them before. The soups were good, but the eggs and fries were just okay, nothing special.
We then ordered the large cheese board to share and the lumpcrab gnocchi. The cheese board was adequate. No complaints there, but the gnocchi was served half- burnt. The taste was interesting but not in a positive way. The drinks were okay. I don't know if I would go back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Food was perfectly seasoned and yummy! The Brussel sprouts were our fave! John was friendly and knowledgeable and made our experience even better! He was very attentive and went above and beyond! Great service and food!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
We were a party of five at 6:30 pm on a Friday night. We had called for a reservation but might not have been necessary. The restaurant did fill up shortly after our arrival. Everything we ordered was amazing. We started with the deviled eggs, three cheese charcuterie board and the marinated olives. Everything was so good! Many discussions took place over the quality of the cheeses and the olives and maybe capers.
Two of us chose a two selection flight of wine, one of us was recommended a vodka cocktail and very much enjoyed. Nick was our waiter and he was top notch. 
We weren't sure if we were going to order entrees and then the quality of the food definitely had us anticipating those specialties. I ordered the grilled vegetable flatbread. It was excellent, the slices roasted garlic brought it to the top. My daughter had the chicken and boudin gumbo, very enjoyable. Another guest ordered the short ribs and mashed potatoes, her words "try this, it'll change your life". This will be a definite must stop on future visits.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We snagged a coveted outdoor reservation during happy hour and were seated promptly. While we were waiting for our drinks, a party of three walked in and seated themselves at a large table behind us. The hostess came over and explained that the table was already reserved and they could be seated inside. One of the men was awful - so condescending and entitled - barking that he knew the manager and to just tell her he'd be sitting down. The poor hostess went to get her manager, Lydia, who came out and greeted the customers warmly. Lydia didn't waste a moment before throwing her hostess under the bus -- she apologized to the rude patrons on her hostess' behalf, and said she had moved around other reservations so they could have the table. Now, a party who had actually made a reservation and requested an outdoor table, would be bumped inside because the manager refused to stand up to this patron -- not a great way to run a business. Now for the food -- Copper Vine has their menu coded with "gluten free." Nowhere does it say that the items are only GF when specified or modified -- it just labels them GF. I ordered the pork belly, which purports to just be gluten free, but mentioned that I have celiac, and our waitress responded "oh, let me actually go ask the kitchen. I don't think the menu key is right." She went and checked, and much to my shock, was right. At this point, I was rattled and wanted to talk to someone who truly knew what was gluten free. Our waitress sent over the manager, Lydia again, who had literally no information. She started off with "well I try to eat gluten free too," which is never something that someone with celiac wants to hear. I could tell she was making it up as she went, as she couldn't answer any follow up questions. If I'd been with my boyfriend, we would have just left. Since I was in NOLA visiting friends, I stuck it out, opting for a seafood dish that I was confident was naturally GF. The food was good, but management makes or breaks a restaurant, and Copper Vine needs to spend some serious time retraining their staff.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Came here with a friend who made a same-day dinner reservation for a Saturday night. It was a rainy weekend so unfortunately the patio was closed for seating, but I can imagine dining in their outside space would be so nice! 

We split a bottle of Malbec wine (750ML, $36) and 3 appetizers: black truffle fries ($9), brussels sprouts ($8) and the bianca flatbread with added charcuterie on top ($14). We were a bit worried the portions would be too small to share but it filled us up perfectly! Everything was tasty. The parmesan aioli that came with the fries was particularly good, and I actually preferred it over the aioli that came with the brussels sprouts. We added charcuterie to our bianca flatbread for an extra $3 and while the amount of meat was on the measly side, it was very tasty and paired well with the three cheese flatbread -- in layman's terms, it tasted like mildly sweet little cubes of ham LOL. The water also tasted like it's cucumber-infused. 

In light of the new COVID mask guidelines, some staff members were and some were not masked. Service was extremely attentive. We were asked a few times how everything was and were also offered a dessert menu towards the end of our meal. They were able to split our bill between two different cards. We stayed a while (probably longer than welcome) to just chat and finish our wine, and I didn't feel too pressured by staff to hurry up and pay and leave. As for the ambience, while definitely nice, people eating there ranged from couples dressed up for date night to just casual groups of friends i.e. dress up if you want to but also don't feel pressured to! 

I've been told from friends who have gone to Copper Vine prior that there used to be a popcorn dispenser free to customers, so not too sure what's up with that anymore. Overall, seems like a popular spot for a fancier night out! Would love to visit and check out their happy hour.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Copper Vine has been on my list of must try and so happy that we went before the Pelicans game . 

First , beautiful space that feels cozy and open inside and with a delightful patio that insulates from the busy street .

The menu has an excellent variety of both small and large  plates  and for all eating choices . 

We enjoyed our wine , cocktails and dinners and had leftovers . 

The staff are professional and friendly . Thank you to our excellent server Ari .

We look forward to many more happy hours and dinners .
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Wow. This space has certainly come a long way since it was Happy's and I really have to commend the owners on the change. It honestly looks nothing like it used to and there's even a fancy upstairs area now!

David and I were here for his cousin's birthday celebration and we were seated upstairs. We didn't have a full dinner, but we did have some really good fries and we had a few cocktails. First, since it's a wine bar, I started with a really good malbec that was reasonably priced. I like that they give you the option of a half pour or whole pour, I guess in case you want to just do some tastings. Even though they mainly specialize in wine, they do have a full bar and a pretty decent beer selection. I had the Holy Roller IPA which was a fairly priced $7, especially considering the atmosphere of the place. 

We hung out at a while and they didn't rush us at all as we basically just sipped drinks and enjoyed conversation. Every now and then I did feel that they forgot about us (I ordered coffee that never came), but all in all it was a good experience and it good place to start your evening.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We visited Copper Vine last week. Our server, Grace was wonderful. We ordered a few apps. The food was good but what stood out for us was the service. Copper Vine has multiple wine menus...I wanted to try something new but didn't know where to start. Grace made a few knowledgable suggestions and even brought over the sommelier. Since we were having a casual night I was unsure about bringing over the sommelier...typically I would shy away from something like that. WOW, I was so pleasantly surprised! She was so bubbly and friendly. She didn't sacrifice any professionalism in her demeanor but talked about wine in a way that wasn't elitist...I felt like she didn't care if we thought she knew a lot, she wanted us to know about wine and the brand. This girl is something special. By the end of our talking I had a flight of 3 amazing wines...a Napa Valley sauvignon blanc, a chardonnay from Santa Barbra, and an Albarino....and I could tell you about all 3, Thanks Copper Vine!  The night we visited was busy and we definitely weren't the table spending the most money....the sommelier still came back to check in and continue conversation. Grace was attentive and ensured we enjoyed our experience. We felt welcome and every staff member seemed to be happy and passionate. It looked and felt like a family run operation in a classy modern atmosphere. So cool! Great venue, Great food, Impressive staff. Worth a visit!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Went for brunch and found the food to be just fine. Certainly not bad and there were some moments but overall not excited. We had the fritatta and chicken and waffles.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Had business meeting on Tues last week during Happy hour starting at 2 :00 pm Plus I'm a Day Drinker Hahaha,  where can I start the  Atmosphere is Truly Amazing with all the gorgeous vines hanging everywhere,  then I ordered the Tatar with Caviar every bite was excellent  tasting experience especially with the Caviar as i was sipping my fresh made Mojito. The fresh made  Flat bread Margherita pizza had totally Killer flavor & the crust was nice and soft which I really enjoy !!!

text:
Love! Love! Love!! Decor (check) wine (check$   Gender neutral bathroom (check) customer service (check)   

Copper vine is a must do for groups and friends from out of town! Came we saw we conquered. Order multiple 2.5 pours and make your own flight.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
High quality ambiance, food, and service. The brussel sprouts were divine - especially the garlic aioli! So flavorful and crispy. The beet salad was very colorful yet light on the stomach. The charcuterie salad was a unique and delectable option on the menu. Every restaurant should add this option! It's all the variety of tastes and textures of a charcuterie board with the added bonus of dressing and greens. The fig and jam flatbread was perfect to share and very savory! Wine is on tap and comes in a variety of size options (different pour sizes, carafe, bottle, etc.). 

If I had more time in town, I would go back for their bottomless brunch! Michelle was an exceptional server who took great care of us.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Beautiful wine bar with plenty of selections on tap! We had the Cuban sandwich and burger which were delicious & reasonable priced. Nice music playing and manager came over to ask how everything was. Clean and unique restrooms and decor and table settings very inviting.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: So delicious: the outdoor patio is the best. John S. was our server and he was so great. Helped us pick amazing drinks and food. Will absolutely come back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: So fun! Great drinks - wish they had more of their cocktails on happy hour but all the food was delicious!

categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place is an oasis on the corner of two busy streets downtown. The plants create an excellent barrier from the street and provides for a great atmosphere and background. This place is extremely photogenic if you're looking for pictures for instagram. I would not recommend the indoor seating. The outdoor patio seating is so much better, but it's small and fills up fast. Make a reservation for this because you want to be outside! The brussels sprouts are a must order. Even if you don't like brussels sprouts you will like these ones. The truffle fries are also a delicious appetizer. Their happy hour is weekdays 2-6pm and they have great prices for drinks and snacks. I've never been for brunch but I have heard great things about it. This place is a favorite for me and I can't wait to return!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This restaurant does not only have amazing wines and a very cute patio downtown but also good food and service every time I went there: girls day out, celebrating birthday or even a book signing.. I never had a bad experience there and that's the reason why I highly recommend it!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: WOW! Everything we ordered was perfect! Best shrimp and grits EVER. Our server, Jen was awesome.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I love this place!!! This was my first visit and I am hooked. The food was delicious and the drinks were great. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I love the decor and the inside or outdoor seating options. This cute place was definitely a vibe!! Will definitely be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
I've been to Copper Vine twice now and can say that both experiences have been less than mediocre. 

The space is beautiful; walking distance to the dome jf you want to go before the game or easily accessible to an after work happy hour for people who work downtown. 

The menu is creative but maybe a little too ambitious and the kitchen seems to be a little sloppy. The best appetizer I've had is the lump crab deviled eggs which are served as 3 halves. Three. Not 4, not 2. This makes splitting awkward and every time I go I chuckle about not getting the remaining half. I've had the ratatouille which is hearty but despite all the different ingredients tastes like it's just oregano. This dish also led to unfortunate digestive issues later. The second time I visited it was for brunch and my crab cake Benedict, along with another persons dish, arrived with hard boiled eggs which were supposed to be poached. I stuck my fork in the egg expecting the yolk to come dripping out but instead the ball just rolled elsewhere on the plate. I felt bad, but I had to ask for another egg. Even though we were one of maybe 4 parties in the entire restaurant, by the time I got our servers attention the crab cakes were cold. The egg they brought me later was undercooked enough that I questioned if it would make me sick (the white still has clear parts in it) so I opted not to eat it. 

I feel like I've given them a fair shot at this point and they've disappointed me each time so I don't plan on returning again.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Brunch in the Big Easy!  There are so many spots for brunch but this aesthetic is BOMB. SUPERRRRRR cute. The food matches the ambiance!  Shrimp and Grits, duck leg and waffle, steak and eggs... You really can't go wrong. $25 Bottomless mimosas during brunch.  (P.S. Texas, please take away the anti-bottomless mimosa law ). If you're in NOLA, especially with a group (we had 9 of us) check out Copper Vine! AMAZING! Joseph will take great care of you.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Have been here for both brunch and dinner! They have unlimited mimosas or rose' for brunch! The food is not heavy and very delectable! Try the duck leg and waffle for brunch and seafood bouillabaisse for dinner! For appetizer try the crabmeat deviled eggs! Haven't tried the wine on tap, but the sangria was good!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Wow!!! One of my top three new favorite places to eat in New Orleans. Very great ambiance with vintage/earthy accents & decor, wine on tap, self-serve popcorn and amazing service. What more can you ask for?! 

No complaints regarding the food, our server John made great recommendations: Toast of the day with salmon dip, bread pudding and the charcuterie board paired with some wine. 

Def will try more next time and recommend to all of my friends and family :) perfect for group dinners or even a date night!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Only came for drinks and dessert but the Banana Fosters was Amazeballs!!!!! Service was amazingly too!!!!

categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Walked here during the week to get my lunch. I got my lunch to go, so that and COVID-19 safety precautions made up the bulk of my impressions.

You enter the restaurant through the courtyard, which is a decent size for the CBD. The existence of a courtyard is especially noteworthy in pandemic times - some people want to avoid dining indoors - and the fact that it's shaded is major bonus points.

I placed my to-go order with the host and then sat in a corner to wait. There was a table with wipes and sanitizer by the door, and all the employees seemed to be properly wearing masks. There wasn't anyone dining in, but I got there right as they opened, so it was still early.

I was brought my drink immediately, per my request, though they also offered water while I waited. My food was ready about 15 minutes later. I got the Pick 2 combo of crawfish grilled cheese and sunflower arugula salad, and along with the standard utensils and napkins, they included 2 packets of alcohol wipes.

The crawfish grilled cheese was great: thick, gooey, and packed with flavor. I'm not normally a salad fan, but the arugula salad was pretty good too, and I'm glad I got it to balance out the richness of the sandwich.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I am so pleased we chose Copper Vine for our first meal out/anniversary dinner. The decor is pretty and comfortable. The staff was friendly, all wearing masks and gloves, and people were appropriately spaced apart for social distancing purposes. We started with the crawfish beignets- absolutely delicious and my favorite part of the meal. We then shared the fig flatbread, wagyu burger with Brussels sprouts, and mushroom pasta. Everything needed some salt, and the burger needed a little more condiments. Other than that, it was delicious! I would absolutely come back :)
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Was our first visit to Copper Vine after I had been eyeing it down for some time, and it was just as good as I had expected. Food was delicious, our server Christopher was excellent. Great cheese board and brussel sprouts! We will be back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Yum! Yum! And a great view from the top!!! Our server was awesome (wish I could remember his name) and the food was great!!!! 
4 stars cuz no place is perfect! And we walked lots of stairs for an empty room when I would have been fine on the patio or bar! Next time I'll just say something, they seemed very accommodating 

Go here for a nice dinner!!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Came here for brunch with a bachelorette party. Made an online reservation and got seated on the beautiful, picture perfect balcony. Our server greeted us and asked us if we had been here before-we haven't-and then he ran through the menu and several of the popular items. He was very helpful answering any questions we had and offering suggestions. We all ordered coffee, which was amazing. We ordered crawfish beignets and lump crab deviled eggs, both which were great and not items you can find everywhere, so definitely recommend but you only get 3 each. For entrees, we got the crawfish grilled cheese (so so good), apple fritter french toast (so decadent, ate it for two meals), fried chicken sandwich (messy but good), lump crab benny (amazing), and the chicken and waffles (good, cornbread waffle was a different texture but not bad). Service was great and atmosphere was +++++
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
5 stars for food, service, and ambiance. Tracy, our waitress, was absolutely wonderful. All of her recommendations were spot on. From wine, food, dessert to champagne-she nailed it! Loved it all. 
My steak was so tender and perfectly cooked. All of the garnishes paired very well. 
If you come here ask for Tracy to be your waitress. She's fire.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Mom and I have been trying different restaurants for the past few weeks in order to support the community. Copper Vine was this week's lunch date. It was incredible! Justyn was our server and he was so nice and service was on point. Thanks, justyn! The food was really good, too. I was starving so we started with the crab topped deviled eggs and truffle fries. They were both amazing. Then we got the lunch special and as soon as he described that cauliflower soup, we were both sold. Thanks for the great lunch, y'all!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Casual laid back vibe, but also very loud, so if you're planning a romantic date, this is not the place. Food was good, gumbo with boudin, amazing! And the roasted beet salad was delish. Flatbreads were fine, just not any wow factor to them, we tried the duck confit and margarita one. Be warned, bread pudding is Huge! We had the cranberry orange one, and it was hot, super orangey and yummy! The wine and drink pours are stingy, which surprised me, given the cost. Our service was fine, I found myself wondering a few times where our drinks were, but it did get busy at the bar, so it may not have been his fault. Overall, I'm torn on whether I'd go back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I'll start off by saying I only went to brunch. The atmosphere and the decor was nice. Very nice outdoor patio but for the fall. The three stars however are due to the small portions relative to the price. Plate sizes were a lot smaller then we imagine. I had the crabcake Benedict which was only one crabcake and one egg on top of potatoes. Taste very good but again size made the difference. My friend had the steak and eggs, steak was very very small and over cooked to his preference, which he stated at the time of ordering. But I am willing to give them another shot for dinner.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The duck was amazing and the champagne was priced fair which is hard to find in the Quarter. My husband  had the white trout and enjoyed that as well. Who dat!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Found this cute wine tap bar while visiting New Orleans last month.  This is my second time here and I love it even more than the first time.  

Drinks to order:  Cucumber Gimlet and the Sangria Roséé is one to die for.  

Venue is modern but still has that New Orleans feel.  Great location and amazing patio.  5 stars!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Relaxing Ambiance. Jazzy Aesthetic. & Wine On Tap... What else does a girl need! I really wanted to get dolled up and enjoy a nice vibe. I had the opportunity to have dinner here and it lived up to all of my expectations. I booked a reservation through OpenTable. Upon arrival, our table was ready as soon as we walked in!
Our server Chris was phenomenal. Since this was our first time, he took the time to thoroughly explain the menu offerings. Also, he had great wine recommendations and allowed me to sample them but fully committing. 
For my entree, I tried the new cornflake chicken sandwich and it was delightful! I highly recommend this place for brunch with friends or date night with bae!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Seated on the back patio, we had heaters to warm us up on a cold winter night... I loved it! 

Anyways, drinks: beer selection is weak, but I went into this understanding this is a winepub so no need to dock points there. Additionally, I was still able to find a great beer to satisfy me. We also ordered two carafes of wine which was top tier.

The food! Bacon wrapped dates were incredible and rich, the burrata and eggplant caponata was bright and light and paired with some fantastic bread, the LA crawfish grilled cheese was also rich and quite tasty while paired with a side of Cajun carrots that were unique, truffle fries were your run of the mill truffle fry experience, and the cornflake chicken sandwich was uhhhhh bland and not seasoned and the only bad part of our meal.

Pros: our waitress (I wish I could remember her name), the decorations, music, outdoor patio, the burrata and eggplant caponata, wine selection, the zony mash sour beer I settled on

Cons: that poor chicken sandwich

Closing notes: absolutely will be back, as I already have a list of new menu items I want to try
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Not sure about Copper Vine yet.  This was my first visit and the food was ok (a solid B+).  The service was great and the atmosphere was very inviting, but the food didn't quite hit the spot.  Granted we were some of the first customers in the restaurant this morning and there were a couple of larger parties already seated for brunch.   So, I don't know.   We'll try them again for a dinner service and see.  Hopefully this was a one time situation.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Ambiance was amazing, the food was delicious and I loved my wine.. however the service was HORRIBLE!! It took 20mins before anyone even came to our table. I had to flag someone down, they took our drink order then took off before we could order our food. Waited another TEN mins and I had to flag down another server to place our food order but he couldn't take it since someone else took my drink order  seriously, I shouldn't have to hear why the servers can't handle their section or be managed properly... by the time we got our food, we were the only ones on the patio so I'm not sure why they were so "swamped" and would have loved another glass or two of wine but couldn't get anyone to take our order. Get better management and training to the staff if you're gonna charge those prices
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This my first time coming and the food was great and the service was amazing. Our server and the other servers were super attentive and on top of our drinks and making sure we were good the whole time. I will definitely be back. Nice environment and great music as well.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My friend and I came here after waiting to try for so long. Needless to say, the customer service is beyond poor. We sat at the bar, the young lady came and assisted us with a drink. She never came back there after. We had to ask someone else ten minutes later can we order our food. He then proceeds to respond with "we're back up and we make drinks for everyone in here but I'm here now." Okay. We ordered. Twenty minutes goes by (no food) the young lady who first assisted us comes over to us, takes a drink menu from us to assist someone else and doesn't say a thing. This was beyond unacceptable and disrespectful. No "excuse me" or anything. Mind you, she never came back for our food order either (we asked her for a food menu.) I asked for a manager at that point since it is rude to reach over someone without saying anything for one, and two, she never even acknowledged us since then. Manager came over to remedy what was left of the situation which did nothing because I was ready to completely walk out. The young lady came over (because of the manager obviously at this point) to check on us. We completely ignored her. The guy who we gave our food order to came over more frequently as well to check on us. Had we been told by either of them, "we're very busy, but we'll get to you as soon as possible," we would have completely understood. However, that was not the case. We believe this is happened to us because we are African American women and this establishment is served predominantly Caucasians. Regardless, we have NEVER been treated in such a way and will never come back or recommend anyone we know to come here. If I would be able to give this review zero stars, I would.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: What a great find in New Orleans on a Monday evening. We slid in under the Happy Hour expiration and my husband had three local brews at a fab price. Our food selection was all from the starter section of the menu but the entrees sounded amazing - will be back to check them out. Fig & goat cheese flat bread, truffle fries and a charcuterie board are highly recommended. Shoutout to our server Chavez for superb service and great conversation.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: If you're in New Orleans give this place a visit!! You won't regret it. Great food, great ambiance, all for a great price.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Coppervine 

 Looking for an intimate space and a good time? @coppervinewinepub is located right on Postseason. This sleek spot is very comfortable and up to date with a beautiful, fun courtyard.

 For cocktails, I ordered the lavender sprits with Magnolia vodka, elderflower liqueur, lemon, lavender simple syrup, and Lambrusco. Simply put it was a lavender and tonic lol.

 For lunch, I started with the " Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs". They seem to have a strong mustard and pepper taste. I also ordered the "filet mignon brochette" which was cooked very nicely and accompanied with wild mushrooms. The sweet pepper whipped garlic forest glaze was the perfect pair.

 For my main course, I ordered the Wagyu burger with Brussels sprouts! Listen the burger was extremely juicy, with the perfect choice of gruyere cheese and served on a soft burger bun. I was so happy ! The brussels sprouts were cooked great and the garlic aïoli was awesome. I even put a little on my bun!

The cultured chef, Amy Mehrtens, has traveled and lives all throughout the world and the menu gives you a hint of what she has experienced. 

If dining in, beware that you may have to pay for parking and that it is on a very busy street! 

Server (Rebecca) 4/5
Food 4/5
Atmosphere 5
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Had dinner last night. Fantastic food, great service and the house Red Wine blend on tap is a must try!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Let's wine about this place, copper vineeeeee. We took our pick and explored right off of cbd central, something I don't usually do... but hey why not! 

It was as hot as the first crawfish boil and the cement was sizzling, we did have reservations but it took the server, or hostess,  some time to configure where we were sitting. But always, mask up. 

This is def a "let's catch a drink while we're downtown" or pregame here! Or def, drink before football game kinda vibes. There's no parking, so off street it is! M there is a paid parking lot in the back if you choose to park. 

They handed us our handy dandy QR code so we can scan them into our phones and view the menu that way. Very nifty with what society is coming up with during Covid times. We got good snacks and awesome truffle fries! There's something about truffle that's makes me feel classy every time I consume it. The outside is decorated very nice, and so is the bathroom. 
I def. would like to return just to grab drinks before to make sure my liver knows it's time to function in over drive.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: What a cute restaurant and fresh delicious food! We sat on the balcony in the sun, even with their shades it was a bit hot, so just be aware of this. I had the Tuna Niçoise salad which was so fresh & well balanced. The restaurants has many different sections, floors and outdoor seating.  I love the blue paint and green plants that really give this place a cozy welcoming feel. Service was great too. Itll be on my list to dine again when i return to visit Nola!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Started off the Birthday Boy's day with some Brunch at Cooper Vine.

First off, service was outstanding by John. He knew the menu well and gave us suggestions on what to order. We ended up getting a bunch of items and we all shared and every was delicious.

Must Haves IMO are:

Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs
Chef's Charcuterie Board with 3 meats & 3 cheese
Brussels Sprouts 
Wagyu Burger
Chicken Salad Club
Chicken Fried Duck w/Cornbread Waffle (THIS IS A MUST TRY) 

The ambiance was beautiful with an attached patio that is super cute!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: A wonderful concept that delivered in every way. Great atmosphere, great decor, friendly service, and creative food and drink menu. The bacon, wrapped-goat cheese stuffed dates were unique and delicious. Will definitely be going back. If you haven't been you must try!!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: YUM!!! Copper vine not only has a great atmosphere, but their food and cocktails are delicious as well. We started out with apps for the table: the truffle fries (cannot recommend enough), Brussel sprouts, and the fog and goat cheese flat bread. All were so yummy! I had the crawfish grilled cheese with sautéed veggies for dinner. The best grilled cheese I've ever had!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This review specifically regards the WAGYU BURGER. Besides the meat being a little softer and having "Wagyu" in the name, this is your standard burger. There is nothing special to it and it is really quite mediocre. The burger is definitely under-seasoned and lacking needed flavor. There is also no x-factor condiment/topping, and this simply adds to the mediocracy of the burger.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
On the menu: 
Apple Old Fashioned and White Sangria
Truffle Fries
Cornflake Fried Chicken and Waffles
Cochon de lait Cubano w/brussles 

Verdict:  Would recommend!
The attention to detail and customer service was inviting and welcoming. The atmosphere, simply gorgeous -a modern simple chic vibe. Food? Delicious. 

Ps. They do have bottomless mimosas for brunch, if that kinda thing floats your boat . 
Thanks! We will be back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Went on the Friday the 26th & it was pretty busy. I was so looking forward to finally going. We missed happy hour, which was totally fine. Now for the review, their rose sangria was literally rose poured into a glass and a fresh strawberry & a basil leaf were thrown in -- not exactly sangria folks. Then I ordered Mayor Roffignac, which is supposed to be a Maylie's signature drink -- allegedly cognac, raspberry shrub, simple syrup, & sparkling wine -- it was godawful and tasted like cough syrup. Food-wise, we ordered duck fat fries & they were great (that's what got them at least a single star) and the large cheese board. The server came out, unceremoniously dropped the board down and spun on her heels without a word of explanation of what was on it, and we looked down and there was literally a total of an ounce of three tiny slivers of cheese sitting there.  That's it!  The bill for five cocktails, fries, & cheese board was $100 including the tip.

In a town of fabulous craft cocktails everywhere you go & restaurants opening & closing on a weekly basis, their game is lame and duck fat fries can't be the only thing carrying you. Needless to say, we won't be back. Next!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My friends and I came here for brunch on a Saturday (made a reservation). We sat upstairs on the outside balcony. It was absolutely beautiful, the view was nice and the balcony was very picturesque. Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and was friendly and fast. The food was outstanding and cocktails super refreshing plus there's bottomless mimosas. I got the chicken and corn waffle that was topped with gravy, it was like nothing I've ever had before and definitely recommend! We also tried the poutine, gumbo, and onion soup - nothing disappointed! During COVID, a lot of NOLA was closed or not operating to its full potential but this place was perfect and we all felt it was the highlight of our day!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great spot! I would come here with friends! Everyone is very friendly and I appreciated the staff being so helpful and checking in often on my table! The outdoor area is beautiful and everything I ate was great! Cool place!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
WOW this place is incredible. My mom and I went for our first dinner when visiting New Orleans, and at the end of our 5 day stay and a LOT of food, we still said this was our favorite meal. 

Great atmosphere and the walls are filled with really cool art. Also, the tap wall was really different and great- I wish I could have tried more wine!

When we went we just shared a few appetizers so that we could try more things and it was so fun! We tried the goat cheese + fig flatbread, salmon toast, and the pork belly & corn fried oysters. The oysters were soo tender and to die for.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: As someone who works in the service industry this totally bums me out! The veggie burger was dry and over cooked. The small charcuterie cheese only literally came with 4 pieces of cheese and was all thrown on a box with 4 slices of bread and 5 grapes! It cost $18!!! There is absolutely no reason with the amount of people that we are able to serve in the service industry right now that something this sloppy should be happening. We should be sending out perfect orders every time and making sure that people want to come back. I  I literally spent $55 and didn't eat any of it except for my four slices of cheese! Total overpriced bummer! To further add insult to injury the delivery guy brought me a hot can of soda and left my order in front of Someone else's door even though I left specific instructions on where to meet me text me when they arrived. I wish I would've spent my money somewhere else.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
* great place for special occasions! *

i was here recently for a friends birthday, and it's a great place to go to to celebrate! it's very nice and fancy, and the food and drinks are pretty good too. the price point is a bit high, so i personally would only go here for special occasions 

i split a charcuterie board and rose sangria with the table, and the my were both delicious! the 3 meats, 3 cheeses board was *just* enough for 6 people and had some really tasty meats and cheeses. we did have a cheddar that was super sharp, and i think that was the only cheese that didn't get fully eaten 

the rose sangria was delicious! it came with a lot of ice though - like A LOT - probably because they want to give you less alcohol... it was super good but about 65% of our pitcher was ice, which is not so good

i got the croque madam for my main dish, and it was good but the ham and sauce were both a little too salty for my taste personally. but i had a bite of my friend's wagyu burger and it was so so good! cooked super well and also very well seasoned

so imo the dishes are hit or miss, the charcuterie board was great, and the drinks are kind of a rip off but they're tasty if you're willing to pay!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I thoroughly enjoyed this place. My son chose it for a dinner date to somewhere new and I was pleasantly surprised. The outdoor seating is impressive as it has the feel like you're elsewhere, not in the CBD. The food was phenomenal with the exception Rolf the French Shallot soup which was oddly thick and served at room temperature. We had a great dessert and the ambiance was lovely. Going back with friends soon.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
This was my first brunch dining experience since COVID & I must say I felt comfortable. The staff were wearing mask, super friendly, & they don't bring menu's they have the barcode where you can scan on phone & it brings up the menu for you! Super cool! The tables were sanitized & spaced out a good bit! 
I ordered the Crawfish grill cheese & I was not disappointed! It consist of crawfish, mustard remoulade, roasted tomatoes, & aged cheddar on sourdough bread. I just wish there was a bit more crawfish but it was super delicious. Love their fries! 
I also had the chicken & boudin gumbo & it was really good! P.S. They have bottomless mimosa's! 
Can't wait to be back to try more!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Lydia and Rachel, are the shit.  This bar is instagram super beautiful but also will take care of your alcoholic taste buds. Cheers, get your ass here
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
I had my reservations about this place. I only went two times before this last time and I had all mixed feelings about it. My first time was amazing. My second time was not so great but I did get a cute birthday pic in the bathroom. And what is brunch without a selfie in the bathroom? Am I right people??

Anyways, I met up with a friend from out of town at this place and was super excited. Of course, I looked up the menu that morning and decided what I would get. You also have to decide what you and that person can share too (foodie tip: if the person you go to lunch with doesn't mind splitting things, then do it!) Get separate plates and go ahead and cut things down the middle. Usually their sandwiches already come cut!

We got the lump crab deviled eggs, LA crawfish grilled cheese, the goat cheese and fig flatbread, and the soup of the day. It was alot of food but so good. HIGHLY recommend the LA crawfish grilled cheese. It comes with fries that are just too good to pass up. Also, ask to sit on the patio. If you make reservations, give them a call and see if they can sit you in that area or the balcony. Cute pictures for days and all the vibes you need.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Sitting on the patio is definitely the way to go. Came with my husband during Covid and sat on the porch. Atmosphere was perfect!  I had the beet salad and red drum. Absolutely amazing!

I highly recommend and would come again!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
In the midst of Covid-19 angst, having really good food delivered helps one to cope with the daily stress of it all. Last night I decided to try a new UberEats offering, Copper Vine. The menu via UberEats is pared down from what I see on their main website. Not sure if that's an app limitation, or just an inventory issue when I placed the order. In any case, what was offered seemed very appealing to me and my family. We ordered two of their take on the Impossible Burger, their Waygu Beef Burger, their Copper Vine Cuban sandwich, and the Baby Herbs Salad. After placing the order, my wife and I went back to the distraction of streaming TV. After probably 20 minutes or so, I got an alert from my UberEats driver that there was an issue and he would be delayed. I called the restaurant and was told that the chef wasn't happy with the presentation of one of my entrees and was remaking it. I thought to myself, "Wow, perfection during a pandemic. That's a good sign." ... and I have to say I was more than happy with the food. When it did arrive a short while later, my family was more than happy with the quality and presentation of the food. Everything was top notch and delicious. 

If you're looking for your next meal in lock down, you really should give them a try. 

Thanks, Copper Vine!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place works for anything. After work happy hour, date night, family dinner, before or after a visit to the dome, or just when you need a glass of wine. Located on Poydras there is street parking and a park mobile lot behind on Okeefe. Reservations help but are not required. They have a wonderful lush patio. Indoor seating is nice with several different setups on the first floor, as well upstairs dining, and small second floor balcony searing. They have many wines on tap and you can choose a flight (smaller pour/reduced price), half glass, full glass, etc. They also have a nice list of bottled wines. Happy hour is Monday - Friday from 3:30 - 5:30pm, $5 glasses of our Signature Red and White Blends, 1/2 off bottles of any wine on tap, and snacks starting at just $5 and as always complimentary popcorn!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The food was delicious! The crawfish grilled cheese was excellent! The service was great, too! Really nice and always made sure we were satisfied. And the atmosphere is so cute

text: Great service and very knowledgeable servers.  Server recommended a Seaglass Pino Noir which was excellent.  Menu seemed limited but we ordered the Margherita Flatbed for a light snack.  More than enough for two people.  Atmosphere was very laid back with both indoor and outdoor seating.  Definitely will return.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
This is my new brunch spot! Came here with a friend on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Had the bottomless mimosas (get it with grapefruit juice) Brussels sprouts, crawfish beignets; our main entrees were the Croque Madame and the Jumbo Lump Crab Benny. Everything tasted great. Presentation is beautiful. Service is top notch! Tiki was our server. She was so sweet and helpful. Copper Vine is a Instagram influencers' 
D R E A M! Plenty of places to take great pictures for the Gram. ESPECIALLY their gorgeous restroom.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Stopped in here for lunch and was pleasantly surprised. The food was delicious and their outdoor seating is beautiful. If you come you have to get their jumbo lump Crab meat deviled eggs!!! The gulf fish was also delicious - I really enjoyed its preparation. The staff is all very nice - my waiter recommended this cocktail and I wasn't disappointed; however they couldn't really give me a read on the menu as apparently they haven't tried much on it which was disappointing to me.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
A great first meal in NOLA.  I don't normally eat much French food so I relied on my server's picks and they were spot on. The restaurant has more than 30 glasses of wine on tap--I went with three half glasses: the Malbec, Zin, and Albariño were all $4-$5 each for a small pour and I'd get them again as I thought they went well with my entree, esp. the Albariñoo. Bouillabaisse was excellent--the sauce was light and buttery and was the perfect complement to the seafood. My server's rec of the buttermilk cake was perfect.

I will be in town all week for a conference and am sure I'll be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place was recommended to me from a group of friends that (now used to) go here. If you want to get "sold" and ripped-off, visit this place. If you walk in a few minutes to when Happy Hour ends, you won't get served until after Happy Hour is over. Then you're going to get upsold on items thinking they are provided as a courtesy to make up for not overriding the Happy Hour pricing. They got our money in the short-term, but we won't be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place satisfies the nostalgia for Old New Orleans cuisine and atmosphere in perfect balance with a desire for the fresh and creative flavors so many ambitious local chefs are doing now.  We shared a bottle of wine and the perfectly prepared Brussels Sprouts with garlic aioli and ordered the freshest, most flavorful and not over seasoned ratatouille and bouillabaisse as our meal.  The only thing I can think to say I would have preferred is more broth in the bouillabaisse and a bigger spoon. Located in what used to be Maylies on Poydras for nearly 100 years, Copper Vine offers great wine at reasonable prices and the service is second to none.  Grace was our server and was an absolute delight.  She was not only hospitable, charming and knowledgeable of the restaurant, food and libations but she was also very well versed in the chefs and food scene within 30 miles of the Metro NOLA area.  On your visit to Copper Vine, it is worth asking for Grace to be your server.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
First off the greenery in their outdoor seating area is amazing! I was with family on a trip when we drove by at 2am. I knew i would have to try them before we left. With an EXTENSIVE wine selection I with the Bordeaux and my sister the Albariño. DELICIOUS!

I found that the "sharing is caring" approach was the best way to enjoy all of our meals. We started with the truffle fries (TO DIE FOR) and the tuna tartar topped with caviar #YUM! As main course items we chose the gnocchi dish with crawfish+andouille sauce  and the ancient grain + sugarcane salad! After a weekend of indulging in fried goods Copper Vine provided a refreshing meal packed with FLAVOR!

If you're ever in NOLA give them a try! Our waiter was even kind enough to provide us with activities/things to do in the area that was rain proof... we decided to travel there with a tropical storm passing by
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Hi to whoever is listening!!! JUSTIN & DEREK are AMAZING! We received such awesome service and the food was freaking . You have to come here!! The staff is just so friendly and welcoming & the set up is absolutely perfect. We were lucky enough to sit on the balcony during peak brunch time with a perfect view. It doesn't get any better than this!! Seriously. Forget all those restaurants at the French Quarters (except Corner Oyster Bar and their fried Oysters) and COME HERE! You will not regret!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great service, great wine and delicious food. We went there before seeing a show at the Saenger and it was perfect! Will definitely be back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Bartender was great. Chatted us up.  Had an AMAZING cornflake chicken sando with housemate it at least locally sourced pickles, sliced okra, and onions.  Came with a smart arugula salad with fresh shaved parm.  Delightful.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We made this reservation last minute and completely lucked out. The crawfish beignets are amazing and should not be missed. Our server had fantastic wine recommendations. The gulf fish amandine was really, really good. The (dessert) beignets and bananas foster were the absolute highlight of the meal. The wine selection was fantastic. The half glass option was so great so we could enjoy the perfect pairing with each course.

text: Top notch cocktails but disappointing food other than the black truffle fries.  I had been really looking forward to this but will only go back for drinks in the future.
name: Copper Vine

text: First time going for brunch. Service was good, keep the mimosas filled. Food was good as well. However, the shareables were very small portions. I got 3 pretty small lump crab deviled eggs for $8......yeah. But the cornflake fried chicken and waffles did satisfy
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We are from out of town and we had a terrible experience with the staff.  The service was terrible.   I would not recommend this place to anyone.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Unfortunately, I had to give it 3/5 because of the fries and the shrimps. They were just too salty. 

The pork belly and fried oysters tasted unexpectedly pretty good together. The sweetness from the cha siu complimented the oysters. When you eat any type of seafood, there will be this fishy taste to it. Due to the bbq flavor from the cha siu, I didn't taste any fishiness from the oysters. 

The herbed mushroom pasta only came with a poached egg, so I decided to add the shrimps for some protein. Big mistake. I love salty food, but the grilled shrimps were just too way salty. The mushroom pasta itself tasted delicious. Maybe that's why I should not add any extra topping. 

The tequila mule was really good. I love cocktails that do not just straight up taste like alcohol. If they put too little alcohol, you won't be able to smell it. If they put too much, then the alcohol taste will be too overwhelming. The tequila mule was just perfect. It was sweet, strong, and ready "to kill ya". 

I will definitely come back for more drinks and to give the food menu another try.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Full disclosure, I haven't tried their food, just their happy hour wines. Their patio is so cute, lots of greenery, plenty of parking outside (metered) and service is always good. The happy hour has $5 glasses of wine (red, white, rose, orange). I think they also have some small bites on happy hour.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Christopher was best server I've ever had 10/10!! Amazing menu knowledge and made experience so much fun for everyone.

text: The chicken and waffles were so tasty! I loved the rosé as well!! The outdoor seating was a plus because the aesthetic was what me and my friends were looking for.

text: The wait can be long but the food was absolutely amazing! The steak and mushroom appetizer (forget what it's called) is sooooo delicious. Christopher was our server and he was very informative and friendly.
name: Copper Vine
