text: I had such a good time today at Copper Vine. This felt like such a down home visit. The vibe inside is like a cafe with great food and our waiter, Dor, was amazing. My party really enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and the food was heavenly. Everything was timely and on point, I really really enjoyed my visit.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I have been to Copper Vine many times before and there are so many things to boast about as the entire experience was to die for. I would recommend getting a reservation because every time I have been, they have been extremely busy, and especially with the cooler weather lately and their patio being so lovely, it will stay busy. They have an entire wall of draft wines which is a very interesting concept, and though I am not a huge wine fan, I can see how people would be extremely enthused. The patio is gorgeous with a lot of plants and it feels as if it is in the heart of the city with the nearby buildings and bustling street. I highly recommend getting the fig and brie cheese flatbread, the 3 cheese gnocchi, or the crab deviled eggs as the appetizer. For entree I got the Crawfish Grilled Cheese with a side of fries, and my friends got the Wagyu burger with the aragula salad. For dessert we got the Rum Bananas Foster, I believe. Overall, the experience was fun and different and our service was amazing, especially for how busy they were!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I totally enjoyed my lunch at Copper Vine. Dusty was my server and he was awesome. Dusty recommended the Creole Tomato Sandwich with Grilled Chicken added. Let me say, bomb.com!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Our God Daughter pick this restaurant for lunch after her graduation from Loyola this past weekend.  The five of us were blown away!  Our server John Paul (JP) added so much to the occasion.  Four of us ordered the cornbread waffle with fried duck, powered sugar, Tasso gravy and were completely blown away!  As an extensive traveler I have had many awesome dinning experiences and this one ranks among the top.  Thank you JP and Crew for making this special event one to remember.  When we are in NOLA you can be assured that we will be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My friend and I went there for the first time today and it was AMAZING!!! From the Rose' Sangria to the Bread pudding it was excellent. Shoutout to our waiter John, we felt so connected to him and he had really great recommendations. Can't wait to come back!!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Continuing on with the culinary tour we had dinner this evening at Copper V. 

Thumbs up to the white sangria! Crawfish beignets were also a highlight. I had gnocci and enjoyed it, along with truffle fries. Generally most of the party enjoyed dinner and the space was great for a larger group (8 of us).

text:
BLUF:  I would go back in a heart beat for the food. 

I know it is a wine bar but I'm not a wine connoisseur. I got a full glass (5oz) for $12 and I think it was their cheapest. It was good but I can buy an equally satisfying full bottle for less. They had a couple beers but they were common beers for the city. My lady got a cocktail (the Smokey?) which was very interesting and very good.  

The highlight here is the food. I got the crawfish grilled cheese which was very rich and pretty good. Fries were great. Lady got the fried chicken sandwich and it was unreal. Makes Chick-fil-A/Popeyes seem like a bag of fried trash. It was awesome and huge. We also got the pork belly and oysters which was great. 

We finished with the chocolate-butter creme broulate (I can't spell) and it was awesome.  

Service was great. 

Go for the food and sneak a bottle in.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Horrible service and so-so food.  The server didn't even take app plates away. We stacked our own plates and they stayed on table while we ate. And, the cocktail was horrible. Big mistake coming here.  Too many good places to eat in NOLA.  Why did I eat here? Group dinner. We made rezzies and it still took a very long time to be seated. Bottom line: skip this place.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Went for lunch and sat upstairs on the balcony. The food was AMAZING, the drinks inventive and delicious, and the service was 20 out of 10.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
this place is so cute! i wanted to eat in the outside area with the plants but it was really windy that day so my friends and i opted for inside seating! it was kind of a small area, but it felt so spacious with the open windows and the natural sunlight everywhere! even the bathrooms were aesthetically pleasing.

i got their flatbread, and my friends and i shared the friends and brussels sprouts. it didn't seem like a lot of food but by the time our flatbreads came out, we were almost full from just sharing the brussels sprouts and fries(it was a group of four people)! everything was really good, and i enjoyed my meal! 

will definitely come again, i want to try lots of other dishes that they have on the menu!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Beautiful look on the outside and inside. Lots of greenery and plants hanging outdoor! It's a very popular happy hour spot with wines on tap at the bar. Don't expect to get great seating service especially if you do not have a reservation.. there was a bit of a line and we asked about seating at the bar.. the host didn't seem to care about it so we just grabbed a drink at the bar while waiting for our table. Luckily 2 people left the bar and we were able to snag some seats. However, the bartender was nice. We came in only to grab a drink and an appetizer so we got the brussel sprouts because we saw they looked delicious while walking past a table. They were made perfectly being well cooked and soft while crispy and charred on the outside. The parm cheese and the garlic aioli topped it off. I absolutely recommended definitely getting the brussel sprouts for sure. My husband ordered a cocktail that was basically a Manhattan but it was supposed to have coconut syrup but they ran out of it which was unfortunate. Their wine list was pretty cheap but that's me speaking coming from Seattle.. $12 for a 5 oz pour of the rose. #roseallday
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Dillon was an amazing waiter, I ordered the Gumbo and the deviled eggs, I'm still
Confused as to why I was served 3 deviled eggs. My count can't be that off?! I'm missing an egg. Two eggs cut in half is four deviled eggs. My gumbo lacked rice!!!? 1/3 slice of of boudin link that's crumbling does not Substitue rice at all. Add it!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Wow! I did not expect to like, let alone love Copper Vine. I was a bit skeptical when I heard that it was wine on tap and thought that it would be like WINO, downtown. Cooper Vine is super chill and has a restaurant vibe to it, because it is a restaurant. I went for a work event and we had a private space upstairs. We ended doing a 4 wine flight where our servers brought unmarked bottles to the tables and we had to guess which wine we were consuming. 
Half glasses start off at $4-$5 and most bottles range from $36-$54 with wines from the east coast to the west coast and your usual South American, European , and South African wines. 
What I did not expect was to love the food. It was sooo good. We started off with french fries, deviled eggs and Brussels sprouts, which was absolutely divine. The Brussels are fried then baked and served with grated Parmesan. They were sooo good that you did not need the sauce that accompanied the sprouts. We also had a few different flatbreads which were all delicious! My favorite was the pulled pork flatbread with caramelized onions. 
The staff all seemed to really enjoy their job and were super helpful and friendly. My group definitely wanted to come back again for brunch, but rest assured the brunch menu will be available within the next couple of weeks and they will be available for brunch on both Saturdays and Sundays. 
In addition, the bathrooms were clean and I appreciate them providing paper towels instead of a hand dryer.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
In the midst of the pandemic, my wife and I have been supporting as many of the restaurants as is possible for us. So far, we've ordered take out twice from Copper Vine.

The first time, we ordered their jumbo lump crab deviled eggs, steak frites, and shrimp and grits. Our second order included their fantastic deviled eggs, Wagyu beef burger, their Cuban sandwich, and a couple of draft beers consumed while we waited for the food to be prepared.

Both orders were promptly and exactly prepared, nicely packaged, and delicious. They also included 20% off on food, and 50% on beer.

We shall return!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
I was very disappointed in this place. Dylan was our waiter about an hour ago and he seemed fairly pleasant but not very attentive or understanding. While some of the food was decent, a lot wasn't and the service was pretty abysmal. 
We weren't told bottles of wine would come in an already open reusable bottle from a tap. I would think that there would have been a spiel like "have you dined with us before? No? Well just to let you guys know all of our wine is on tap and not from a bottle...  blah blah blah"
We ordered wine and apps and got the apps before the wine. We were 100% done with all our appetizers before our server came back to take our main order. We tried to tell Dylan the red wine was un drinkable while he was taking our main orders and he said he would come around when it was our sides turn to order, but then practically ran away without giving us time to bring it up again. When we told him a second time and he seemed snarky. We all ended up ordering soup for our mains because we had such a long time after completing our apps we weren't really hungry anymore. Good for us (because we would have over ordered) bad for him (because his ppa went down and way less of a tip.) When our mains came two of us were splitting the poutine (cochon au lait debris fries) and while the plate was scorching the food inside was luke warm at best. We would have brought it up but he never asked if the food was good. He was MIA the rest of the meal (not that he was very present to begin with.) Or even friendly when he was present. Oh and eventually our other wine came but that took forever too. It was also very hard for us to get gross dirty plates taken away from the table. The French shallot(onion) soup had decent flavor but it was a tiny little dollop of cheese (not your normal smother in cheese and then baked French onion soup) floating on a Very chewy stale piece of bread that I couldn't cut at all.  Three cheese gnocchi was good. Although pretty watery and he didn't bring a spoon until I flagged him down about 10 minutes later. Over all not a fan. There are Many better places in town.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My wife and I just moved to the city after many years of visiting and this is the first time we experienced this pub. 33+ wines on draft, a very nice space with beautiful decor. Patio to die for, great food and friendly staff. This is now in my top 3! You must go try it.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
As bad as I want to give this place 3 stars, I added an extra because of its potential and me being willing to give it another try. 

Came to Copper Vine for Sunday brunch. Love the ambiance here and the patio area! My expectations were high as I've greatly anticipated dining here for quite some time. Our waiter was very knowledgeable about the menu, took his time to explain things, and made quality recommendations. For an appetizer, I had the filet mignon brochette as the waiter suggested; it was fantastic! It definitely set the bar. While waiting for our entrees (yes, my friend and I both ordered 2 entrees, don't judge), we occupied our time indulging in the bottomless mimosas which were also great. 

Entrees: I had the chicken and waffles as well as the crawfish and andouille gnocchi. The chicken was really good and paired well with the gravy that came with it. However, I was greatly underwhelmed by the waffle. It was super thin and crispy, almost like a wafer. I prefer thicker, more fluffy waffles. I ate the chicken and played over the waffle for those reasons. As for the gnocchi, I was not impressed at all. It was disappointing for me. My friend also got the chicken and waffles in addition to the Apple fritter French toast which said was phenomenal. 

Next time, I'll have a better feel for what to get!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Nice variety of wines at very reasonable prices and the bartenders very knowledgeable and assisted me in making some great selections.  Quite busy but the service was on top of it.  Cool classic old school building in cbd - easy walk from fq.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The food and service were excellent! They had tempura mushrooms that I will dream about and the fig and goat cheese flatbread was outstanding! I asked for the lightest rose they had, which was the Angeline and it was excellent. We also had the Brussels sprouts and fries, which were amazing as well. I don't have anything bad to say! Our server, Justin, was very informative and so much fun! I can't wait to go back and I will definitely ask for him again. If you are wondering, definitely go and try it out and ask for Justin!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Trash. Just came here Christmas Eve for lunch, the hostess turned us away saying no more guests were allowed; they were booked. There were sooooooo many empty tables my bf & I just looked around  thinking "really"?!! I wouldn't recommend. Idk when certain New Orleans' restaurants became so pretentious & bougie but I won't be visiting Copper Vine ever again. Customer service has been lacking in our society today & this place definitely confirmed that.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Ordered a Zin and fig and goat cheese pizza. Very tasty. My daughter had the burger. She liked it. I enjoyed her chips and garlic sauce that came with her burger. I could not stop eating them. In better weather I would like to sit outside. The outdoor seating looks very pretty and relaxing.

text:

Also had the gnocchi au gratin and brussel sprouts, no photos but definitely also recommended

text: I went here for the first time a couple weeks ago! I loved it so much that I would definitely go again! I had an amazing server who actually took her time to explain her favorite wines on the menu and why! Everyone was spread out safely too! The food was really good also!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Copper vine is a beautiful wine bar in the CBD. I have been there countless times for happy hour--where bottles of wine are half off and have thoroughly enjoyed the duck fat fries. They also have a beautiful patio with greenery that is great to sit under and Instagram worthy. 

I hadn't gone to copper vine for any meals until my fiancé order brunch for us during Mother's Day weekend (i just became a dog mom) Just wow. It came with pain perdu,chocolate ganache,cane syrup, sweet cream, strawberries, blueberries, oranges, bacon and candies pecans. It was honestly to die for!! We had so much left over for the next day as well. Run to copper vine and order a great brunch to-go!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Copper Vine is a modern vibe Downtown. New Orleans is beaming through the traditional French Quarter French Doors, however, the dining room and courtyard add flavor. Service was great, as expected. I ate once before at the bar before but have returned with my fiancée. We came during Coolinary month and Copper Vine's selection didn't disappoint. We shared the appetizer and dessert. This isn't a traditional New Orleans cuisine, but you can certainly taste the influences. Flavors are a bit more light and fresh rather than spicy and in your face. The chicken and boudin gumbo appetizer was not mom's gumbo, but pretty good. Paige got the Wagyu burger while I got the Gulf Fish Bouillabaisse. Both great. The Strawberries & Cream Bread Pudding was GREAT. I'm pretty sure it was garnished with champgne strawberries. Those were a dope touch. While a little pricy, it's a nice change of pace when you feel like being downtown but out of the noise.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great new restaurant in New Orleans. This place has an awesome atmosphere and great employees. Our server John was very attentive, helpful, and friendly. The food was also delicious. We will be back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: What a cute spot! We came here for wine tasting before dinner reservations but will be back to try the food because the ambiance was awesome and so was the service.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My family went to Coopervine Restaurant for lunch on Christmas Day.  We were seated by the door as a party of four.  We ordered our food and my daughter, who sat in the chair closest to the door had placed her new purse on her chair back. While we were sitting down my daughter went to look for her purse and it was missing. We immediately checked to see the location of her I phone and it was going down Rampart Avenue. We informed the restaurant we needed to leave in an attempt to recover the purse and her new I -Phone but we had to wait to pay the check. Our food would be packaged to go.  We were unable to Lacaze the phone since the phone was turned off and we returned to the restaurant to file a police report.  The restaurant has a camera and we were informed that the on duty manager didn't have access to the camera and we would have to wait until Monday. As of today we have not received a copy of the tape nor has the restaurant called us. So I contacted the restaurant and spoke with Derick who is the on duty manager. He informed me he was unaware of the incident and would inform his GM to contact me.  It's amazing the restaurant no only failed to communicate to staff to avoid future occupancies, but they totally dispelled the incident. Clear message that customers are not valued but if you are a victim of a crime on their premises, they are unwilling to assist you.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Copper Vine is not taking the necessary precautions for Covid! I called to reserve an outdoor table for 4 and was told they would be able to fulfill my request. Fast forward to the next day...I arrived and lo and behold there wasn't an outdoor table available. I didn't want to inconvenience the others in my party, so we agreed to sit inside. At first, there appeared to be adequate social distancing. BUT no one inside was wearing a mask or required to wear one while not eating. About 30 minutes later, the place was well over 100% capacity. There were way too many people in there and no one was masked, except me and another at my table. Most of the staff had on masks, except one guy who stood by our table for a loooooong time talking to another employee. I was really uncomfortable. 

Now on to the food. I ordered the Cuban sandwich. It was big! The pork was delicious but the ham could have been better in my opinion. Overall, I'd give the sandwich a 3.5. I upgraded my fries to the truffle fries. They were good but I feel I only got enough to go with one half of my sandwich. My friend had the ancient grain and sugarcane salad, add oysters. It looked delicious and she said it was!

We decided to pay using the QR code on the receipt. After submitting payment, we realized we didn't have the option to tip. Upon looking at my email receipt, I noticed that Copper Vine took it upon themselves to add a tip at the rate of their choice. I did not like that and it should have been communicated to us ahead of time. 

Will I return to Copper Vine? Probably not! This was the first restaurant I chose to eat in since Covid started and I feel they failed tremendously from a safety perspective.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Went to Copper Vine tonight, my first night in New Orleans at the recommendation of a friend. Our server John was super personable and helpful finding me a great glass of wine.

We ordered duck fat fries, and a few flatbreads to snack on. Everything was delicious and was served quickly. Hope to come back sooner than later.

text: Great service! My server was perfect. I had the chicken sandwich but with a twist it had puckered okra on it which really made it stand out! It was also filling I couldn't even finish My salad! Over all 10/10 and heads up the bathroom is gender neutral

text: Stopped in to Copper Vine on a whim our first night visiting NOLA and was incredibly happily surprised! Everything was absolutely perfect! text: Fantastic service and great food. I was very impressed by this place. Ordered the Impossible Burger and Brussels spouts. Even tho I've had the Impossible Burger before? name: Copper Vine

text:
I reserved a table for a Saturday night dinner for a bachelorette group. When I made the reservation I asked about vegan options because I didn't see anything on the menu. The person who took the reservation assured me there were vegan menu items so I assumed the menu online was outdated or didn't have all items listed.

When we arrived at the restaurant, I was disappointed that our vaccine cards weren't checked- there was no request for anything like that. We waited for a few minutes in a lounge area near the bathroom before being seated, and were seated pretty quickly after that. We placed drink orders and then a lot of time went by while we waited to order appetizers. I eventually had to get up to ask someone if we could place an appetizer order. 

When ordering dinner, I asked about the vegan options. The only menu item that is vegan as-is was a bowl of olives. Our server said there were no vegan options. I asked her if she could check with the kitchen because the person that took the reservation was very reassuring about vegan items. She came back and said they could do a vegetable plate with "what we have in house." When I asked, she said it was carrots and green beans. I asked if there were possibly grains or beans in addition to the veggies? Nope. Just two veggies apparently. I let her know how disappointed I was she was defensive and not apologetic or kind about it at all. I would have expected more from a restaurant that has a chef in-house, especially when it was not busy in the restaurant, and because I had called ahead. 

I ended up getting a salad without bacon and cheese (of course it is the same price without those ingredients - hello vegan tax!) and having some fries left over from our appetizers. It reminded me of the early 2000s when fries and a side salad were the only meat-free items I could order at most restaurants. 

The best part of my meal (aside from spending time with my friends!) was two wonderful glasses of wine. The food and especially the service was so underwhelming. I have previously really enjoyed sitting outside on the patio with my wine, but I just don't think I'll be back after this.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
This place is definitely good!! The aesthetic and vibe here are on-point. Bar is super cool, drinks are good, happy hour is cheap. We got a bunch of apps and some happy hour wine and it was good. However- service is definitely subpar. This place has the venue and menu to earn a 5-star rating, but the bartender and servers and short, a bit sassy, and not very helpful! 

Bottom line: almost everything is great- except the $20 cheese/meat board. We received *literally* two pieces of cheese. I asked about it and the bartender awkwardly pawned me off to another employee who didn't know what to say, so they just named the meats and cheeses placed on the board to add in some filler words. They give you a small portion of meat and legit two slices of cheese and then throw on a bunch of random leftovers from the kitchen. They definitely make a big profit from these cheapo boards- beware!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Amazing food , amazing ambiance, and amazing service! Our server John did a great job and made our experience that much better.
name: Copper Vine

text: Perfect environment/ atmosphere!!!! Very quaint & a relaxed atmosphere!!!! Be sure to ask for J P on your visit... very informative & very well knowledgeable of the menu items/selection! They even offer complimentary popcorn w/ 4 different seasonings!!!! The Shrimp Grits WILL NOT DISAPPOINT!!!!

text: Love love love this place on a beautiful sunny day! The atmosphere is everything! Whether you're sitting on the patio or on the balcony you'll have a great view! I've come here for brunch, lunch, random times just for drinks and I'm never disappointed! This is always somewhere I recommend when people ask me where they should go to grab a bite when it's nice weather outside. Copper vine is a staple for the city!

text: Amazing service and great food! We had Angela as our server, and she was fantastic and gave great recommendations. Will be back for sure!
name: Copper Vine

text: The Mothers Day Brunch was simply fantastic!!  I enjoyed the Bottomless Mimosas, which I highly recommend!  It's served with champagne in a glass w/orange juice on the side so you can mix your own perfect blend.  My appetizer and entree of choice were the Jumbo Lump Crab Deviled Eggs & Almond Crusted Gulf Fish.  The eggs were light, seasoned well, and the perfect amount.  The fish was light, flaky, well seasoned, and so delicious!  The greens (underneath) and cream sauce, garnished w/caviar, and roasted almonds all created bursts of flavor!  The ambiance was warm & inviting.  Our server was attentive and accommodating to special requests.  I recommend this restaurant for special occasions or just because!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Charming ambiance and tasty apps! We caught up with friends on their cute patio, which conveniently had heaters to mitigate the cold. We ordered the crawfish beignets and truffle fries, and both dishes were solid. Wine selection was very strong. Wait staff was charming and gracious.
name: Copper Vine

text: This was my favorite stop in New Orleans and we ate about 5 different places. It was within walking distance to our hotel. The flatbread pizzas was great. My chicken salad was fantastic, I had a bite of the burger and that was great too. My daughter said the cornbread waffle was outstanding. The cocktail I had was great. Thank you cooper vine for your amazing service SHOUTOUT TO STEPHEN!
name: Copper Vine

text:
This is a very, very welcome addition to the CBD. 

I've been here three times, and I've grown to like it more and more with each visit.

The wine options are very solid. I appreciate the fact that they are not so numerous as to be overbearing: I typically don't like being presented with a long list of wines that doesn't seem particularly curated. For each wine type, they have 1-3 options at different price points. Another great selling point is that you can try each wine in different sizes; in other words, you don't have to fully commit to any one wine if you want to be more experimental.

The food offerings are delicious. I've gotten a few flatbreads and have never been disappointed. The duck fat fries are mouthwatering. For entrées, I've only gotten the bouillabaisse, but it exceeded my expectations. 

The food can seem a little pricey, but it is honestly on par with the area. Additionally, the wines are reasonably priced and there is a good happy hour special.  

The atmosphere is sleek, clean, and trendy; the outside patio is a must in better-weather months.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My first trip to New Orleans on 12/28, first stop was copper vine. We were seated outside and after 15 mins of waiting and no service, I finally went inside to speak with someone. I went up to the bartender and explained i had waited 15 mins and had not seen a server his response was "well did a hostess even seat you". I explained that a hostess did seat us and he proceeded to brush me off. I ended up just saying i would leave and the response was "okay bye". I have never seen such poor customer service, not to mention it was my birthday..if you're a first timer to New Orleans I would recommend going anywhere else!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Cool wine bar located in the CBD. They have a unique selection of wines on tap, the snacks are good, and it's a great atmosphere for drinks with friends or a date. I especially love sitting in the outdoor courtyard area, which is great for a warm spring afternoon. I've tried a variety of their small plates and really enjoyed the Brussels sprouts (obviously) and the flat breads. Copper Vine is a great spot to grab drinks and snacks after work for people who work in the CBD or before a show at the super dome/ smoothie king center. I highly recommend making a reservation if you are trying to get a table before a popular concert because it gets very packed. They also have happy hour on their bottles of wine (I've heard that they have happy hour on some snacks but that wasn't the case when I visited). I'll definitely be back!

Food - 4 stars
Wine - 4 stars
Price - 3.5 stars 
Service - 4 stars
Atmosphere - 4.5 stars
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My friends and I were looking for somewhere quick to eat before leaving New Orleans and stumbled up on this place. They were opening in at 10:30, so we decided to wait. Although, we didn't have reservations, they were able to accommodate our large party upstairs. Once seated, our waiter greeted us and began taking drink and appetizer orders. A few people ordered mimosas, coffee, or sangria. I had the red sangria, which was so good, I ordered two! For starters, we ordered the black truffle fries and LA crawfish beignets. Both were really good, but the black truffle fries were definitely a table favorite. For entrees, a few people ordered the wagyu burger, the LA crawfish grilled cheese, and the cornflake-fried chicken and waffles. A couple of people had some issues with there orders from food not  cooked properly, lukewarm food, or simply not liking it, but our waiter took care of it right away. I had the LA crawfish grilled cheese with Brussels sprouts and it was pretty good. The Brussels sprouts were lukewarm, so not as appetizing for me; however I would be willing to order them again in the future. Overall, I think most people enjoyed their dining experience and would be willing to try it out again in the future. If you're in the area, check this place out!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Ordered takeout through Uber Eats. Good Wagyu burger and we also liked the deviled eggs. However, we each got the truffle fries with our burger for an additional $3/meal and maybe got 15-20 fries, which was super disappointing and expensive for what you get.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The food was great, the staff sort of ruined our experience though. Due to covid we were seated at a table put right next to the bar, the but the bartender was not waiting on us. Although he was very adamant about being apart of our experience. My boyfriend and I were celebrating my birthday and we just wanted to have an intimate dinner. Our server was hardly ever seen, one of our dishes was missing a component and the server didn't quality check us at all to fix the problem. The dish was cold by the time it reached our servers attention. The bartender wanted to "craft" me a cocktail then ended up just mixing two ingredients together and charging us $30 for it. Skip the cocktails. Go for the wine. Or just order take out.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Another spot that had been on my list of places to try for a while. Finally got around to going for dinner and was quite pleasantly surprised by the food. 

We ordered the crawfish beignets to start and surprisingly I loved them. I know you're thinking from the name, "Well, what's not to love?", but I have to admit I was a little skeptical for whatever reason. They reminded me more of a hushpuppy than a beignet, but they were divine nonetheless. 

I got the chochon de lait cuban sandwich with Brussels sprouts as my main dish and wowee was that sandwich good. After living and working in Tampa and the south Florida area, my hopes weren't super high, but I hadn't had a cuban in a while and decided to try it. While it wasn't traditional, it was damn tasty and that was good enough for me. The sprouts were also really delicious and the garlic aioli took them over the top.  

I wasn't the biggest fan of their cocktails, but the sangria was pretty tasty. 

I would love to go back and try the brunch!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: One of my favorite stops every time I'm in New Orleans! The staff is so friendly and always ready with a list of recommendations. You have the option of indoor or outdoor seating (on a balcony with a view) or downstairs on a heated patio! The food is absolutely amazing with a great selection of wines and cocktails. I recommend their happy hour flight of wines and the crawfish grilled cheese which is my go to. The Brussels Sprouts and truffle fries are my favorite sides- the sauces are delicious!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Thought I had written a review already but maybe I cut them some slack and decided against a bad review after my first visit.  Second try and this place just doesn't do it for me so it's story time.  Cause I'm in quarantine so this review is going to be a long one. 

Spark notes: Expensive bad food. 

I remember when they opened. So happy to see the skeezy place before it replaced.  Like a basic bitch I oooed at the thought of cocktails in the beautiful outdoor courtyard. 

If you're not with your gal pals, you're on a date.  That's just the type of place this is.  Like I said the courtyard is insta worthy and if you didn't happen to notice, the building preserved its historic charm.  Stand on poydras and admire those beams... 

Unfortunately, that's where my love ends.  The first experience, a date, was disappointing to say the least.  Not the date, the food. Which is worse. Bad date I can handle, bad food? No ma'am. 

You're in a beautiful courtyard what do you order? Charcuterie of course.  Let's feel like we're under the Tuscan sun surrounded by grape leaves... 

Back to reality, you're in New Orleans and this meat and cheese plate is nothing like Italy.  Forget fresh prosciutto or cheese from a sheep.  They can't even serve bread that's not stale.  Before you hiss at me, yes crostini is toasted.  I know the difference. My date and I agreed, this hard bread just wasn't going to do.  After waiting longer than I'd like for food that doesn't require cooking, we got more bread but there was no difference.  I'm sure we ate some other stuff but it wasn't memorable.

After first experience left me unimpressed, we never went back.  We would drive by and comment about our bad memory. Expensive bad food. 

Fast forward to Quarantine 2020.  I'm surfing IG because that's honestly all I do now. Some places are starting to offer family meals. We eat out often so more food for less money sounds like a good plan.  

20% off food at copper vine, let's give it another try. I called to place an order and the person answering the phone was not aware of family meals and when I asked about todays was told it's pork chops not pulled pork? Unfortunately I ordered from some where else.  This place upset me again. 

Is there a character limit on these reviews??? If you're still reading you must be in quarantine still. 

So I decide to say something about it. Cause I've never been one to keep my mouth shut.  Sent them a DM on IG.  Fast response. So sorry for the confusion. How about a free meal? Sweet! Yes please.  Never asked my name...Swing by to pick up my meal prepared for the worst.  Manager must have been expecting me.  Although my order was for a specific pick up time, I might as well have ordered when I got there. Ended up waiting 20mins and there were zero other people waiting. 

Time to eat. Fried Fish, Mac, green beans, bread pudding.  Edible. Certainly not worth normal price tag. Bread pudding was beyond dry.  This is where their stale bread could come in handy yet they somehow made it more dry... drench that shit in whiskey sauce and eat my free meal.  

The strong will (hopefully) survive this quarantine.  I'd be shocked if it's copper vine.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: great place on Poydras Street.  Make your reservation because they ate always crowded.  The food was great. you gotta try the eggplant appetizer and the crawfish.

text: Came here on a Saturday night for our date night and we were left very unimpressed. I really wanted to like this place because of friend's recommendations. The interior of the restaurant itself is very nice. The host greeted us and we told him we would like to sit at the bar, which is just first come first serve. We sat down and it took 10 minutes (I timed it bc it was taking so long) before the bartender even came up to us to only hand us food menus and walk away, didn't even get the drink one I had to grab one near me. Even then he didn't greet us or smile and didn't even say he would be right with us or if we had any questions to let him know. It was a very unpleasant beginning and start to our date night. We just felt unwelcomed to be there. I don't know if it's because he was the only bartender or if it was that busy, but I think he could've at the very least acknowledged us when we sat down right in front of him or told us he would be right with us. I was trying to give the situation the benefit of the doubt the whole dinner, but nothing got better because it did eventually slow down. He simply took our orders and handed us our orders. However, there was another employee who was standing in the corner of the bar who helped us get pepper flakes and had a nice conversation with us. We would like to try this place again because I see really good reviews, but we will not be sitting at the bar. I was mostly upset with the experience because the food was good.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

Food: Charcuterie Tray 

Drinks: Frose and HH Rose

Pros: HH Rose - not to sweet and it packed a punch, Charcuterie Tray - super tasty, the atmosphere

text: I can not say enough good things about Copper Vine.  It is very comfortable.  They have a gorgeous patio for outdoor seating and a balcony with fantastic views of the city.  They just added umbrellas to the balcony seating to provide shade and an even better dining experience.  The Charcuterie board is my favorite to start, and they have a great variety of wines and artisan cocktails.    The shrimp and grits, and the duck confit gnocchi are my favorites.  They also have great salads if you are looking to eat healthy.  Also, bottomless mimosas for brunch Saturday and Sunday!  I highly recommend this place!
name: Copper Vine

text:
The Food: Stopped in with a few co-workers. We ordered the Margherita flatbread and Brussel sprouts for apps. We also shared the Milky Way dessert. I ordered the pick two option, which consisted of 1/2 fried shrimp po-boy and gumbo. 

The flatbread, brussel sprouts and dessert were off the chain! I highly recommend and would order again. The crust of the flatbread was crispy. The red sauce was perfect, not too sour and not too sweet, but jussst right. It was cheesy and the fresh tomatoes were on point. I love brussel sprouts done right and these did not disappoint. Firm and roasted in olive oil. Is that bacon I taste? I don't know, but I wanted seconds. The presentation of the Milky Way was too cute. It had chocolate fudge and blondie/brownie bites, popcorn and honey roasted peanuts, on rings of caramel. All surrounding a center of orange chocolate ice cream from the Creole Creamery. I don't remember the exact name of the ice cream, though. 

My fried shrimp po-boy was good. The bread was toasted and the shrimp were seasoned. The pepper jelly glaze was a nice touch. They applied it with restraint, so the flavor wasn't overpowering. I would opt for the full sandwich next time. The gumbo was earthy with a dark roux. It reminded me of the gumbo my high school served. It was missing the rice and grilled cheese sandwich like the high school version, though. The andouille was good, but they were a bit stingy with only one piece. I think the meat was mostly turkey, which left a lot to be desired. I would've preferred smoked sausage, shrimp or more andouille. Overall, it was a good meal.

The Ambiance: This is one lovely restaurant. I would use it as inspiration to redesign my family room. The colors--navy, copper orange, tan--furniture, fabrics and decor were all breathtaking. I felt at home. It was bright and airy. They also have a cute and sizable patio for outdoor dining. 

The Service was great. Our server was attentive, enthusiastic and knowledgeable. He was passionate about the menu and spoke highly of different dishes.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
A Sunday off from work? The perfect opportunity for me to enjoy brunch for once! Weather strikes again and my courtyard reservation had to be moved inside! I arrived early to my reservation, and while many tables had recently been moved indoors because of the weather, the hosts were happy to acknowledge my table would be opening up momentarily. At the bar, I ordered the Gentle Sage (gin, grapefruit, sage) that I had seen online and the manager ensured my drink would be added to my tables tab. I was really impressed by the staff's hospitality and flexibility due to the weather and how an event like that can really throw a wrench in the gears for a small place. 
The dining room was LOUD! It's definitely a hot spot for brunching babes, so I hope to return when the weather isn't so spotty to sit outdoors.
Our server Rebecca was attentive and upbeat, happy to share personal recommendations and ensure our drinks were plentiful.
The menu is expansive and it was hard to choose, so I kept my paper copy to check off the things I had tried, and want to try. A nice detail were the notations indicating vegetarian, and gluten free options! 
We shared the bacon wrapped dates (slap yo momma!), tuna tartare and the sunflower seed salad (I really delighted in the toasty seeds and shaved cheese-not a salad I'd pick outright so it was a delight!)
For mains, we tried the truffle and thyme frittata and the small mushroom pasta with added lump crab. My runny egg was hard boiled but thankfully not over cooked and there was no way I'd be sending my dish back just for the egg. If they are sous vide poached eggs, I hope they recalibrate.
The wine was delicious and the variety of pour sizes was a nice option if you wanted to bounce around and try your palette out on several varietals. However, the standard 5 oz pours are pricey and I didn't see any drink specials that might assist your wallet. Definitely save up if you plan to go bottoms up at brunch.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Update: 

Finally got around to visiting for brunch a few weeks ago and it did not disappoint. We were able to sit in their cute courtyard and enjoy the nice weather. All staff were masked and the tables were decently spaced out. 

The brunch options were most pleasing; it was a little hard to choose. We decided to start with the jump lump crab deviled eggs which were light and a great way to open the meal. The crab was fresh and it was a great twist on a classic favorite. For our meals, I settled on the Apple Fritter French Toast and my friend got the Cochon De Lait Benny. 

That french toast? *chef's kiss*. The bread was thick and held up really well against the caramelized fruit and syrup. The pecans offered a nice crunch that broke up some of the richness of the dish. If you're into more sweet/dessert-style brunch options, get this! I wish I could have eaten more but I didn't want to overstuff myself. The Benny was equally as delicious. I loved that their take on it with using a grit cake instead of an English muffin or biscuit. The pork was tender and flavorful and the greens were rather tasty for a restaurant. 

Our service was awesome! Our server, Justin, took really great care of us. If you're ever in his section, please show him some love!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great patio, wine and food! Will for sure be back to try more dishes on this amazing menu. Happy hour 3:00-6:00 and a dog friendly patio with great service!
name: Copper Vine

text:
LOVE that the old Maylie's space has a restaurant that is as beautiful as it was... OK Maylie's (which closed in the 80s was kind of run down but it was still beautiful and that wisteria vine was gorgeous in the spring). Definitely a 5 star space especially considering the last incarnation that was here.

My review is for the brunch menu only. The menu was interesting and had some variety to it. The winner was the dutch baby pancake... that lemon curd was to die for. Even my friend who isn't into sweet breakfast was swayed. One friend had the crab cakes which she said were good but was raving about the duck fat potatoes underneath. The other friend had the couchon and grits. And I had the smoked salmon and egg. So here's the thing each of our dishes had a poached egg and none of the eggs were poached properly. All the yolks were set and for one of us the yolk was set but the white was somehow undercooked. It was weird. 

For my salmon dish, it was tasty and the salmon was well cooked and not overly salty, but the hollandaise (of which there was maybe a tablespoon) was only on the egg, when the salmon could have used the moisture. I think the dish could be excellent with a bit better plating and egg cookage. 

Our drinks were tasty (mimosas and an old fashioned). And they were offering a Veuve special which we did not participate in. One of my friends has been to their happy hour and said it was great but they don't have any information on that on their website. 

Service brings this above a 3 since our server was hustling especially after the restaurant filled up by midday. They've only been open since September so I hope they find their footing.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Came here for brunch w 5 others. We weren't tended to right away which was kind of annoying bc it seemed like there were several people down there that could've helped us but anyway we were eventually seated upstairs which we didn't mind. Our server Chance was probably one of the best servers I've had. My friends did the bottomless mimosas and I swear their glasses were never empty at any point...

For food we started off w deviled eggs, Brussels sprouts, duck fat fries, and fried oysters w pork belly. No complaints with any of the appetizers we got. Everything was seasoned well and the garlic aioli the fries and Brussels sprouts come w...SO good. For my entree I got the fried duck and cornbread waffles omfg the duck was so juicy and a lil spicy. Loved that they blow torch the rosemary it comes w and the rosemary infused gravy was amazing as well.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Absolutely amazing. The service was great. Every server we had was so friendly. The wine was delicious. The French shallot soup was out of this world, and the best I have ever had. I got the mushroom pasta with shrimp, the small portion was perfect. I have 0 complaints. We even made reservations for the wrong night and didn't realize till the last minute. We called and they managed to work us in. I was in town visiting a friend, but when I am back I will definitely be coming again. My friends I'm visiting will definitely be returning.

text: I can't believe what a truly terrible experience this was all the way around. I am still reeling over the awful brunch my fiance and I has this afternoon. The fish dish was entirely flavorless, "charcuterie" salad was basically uncooked bacon that was slimy and cold and the deviled eggs were so bad, I ended up coming home and making my own. To make matters worse, the place was crawling with bachelorette parties which totally crunched the vibe and when the manager did come by and basically made me explain why I wasn't eating the salad, he didn't even bother to apologize. Instead he said "oh, you don't like MY pork?!"... I was blown away after having that experience discussing it, he didn't even bother to take it off the bill or bring over a glass of champs to apologize, as it was flowing down the gullets (for $20 bottomless) of everyone in the joint. Extremely overpriced for the less-than-flavorful experience and wouldnt come back after that. Oh yeah, and the waiter tipped himself 20%, which is typically what I would tip except sort of presumtive considering we went without waters or drinks for long lulls and watched a beer sit at the bar for over ten minutes. So watch the tab process. Or take my word and just don't go. There's too many other good restaurants in New Orleana.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Three of us, all first-timers, came in here for Happy Hour, and we all agreed Copper Vine is a winner. It's classy without being snooty, fun without being so loud you can't hear across your table. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and not afraid to tell us his favorites.

We all took a different approach to drinking; I went with their happy hour flight of house white, rosé, and red, and liked them all. Another tasted two reds and chose the second. The beer drinker did a beer flight, which meant three 12-oz pours, instead of the five or six smaller servings I expected. 

When the beer drinker spotted the duck debris fries, he looked no further. I, on the other hand, agonized between several things before going for the crawfish grilled cheese sandwich on the advice of our server. I loved it! It oozed with cheddar and cream cheese, the crawfish, and tomatoes on perfectly toasted sourdough. The brussels sprouts ($2 upcharge from chips or salad) were delicious as well. My second and third choices, cochon de lait Cuban and Creole tomato sandwich, I'll leave for other visits!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Copper Vine is a great place for date night or even just a fun night out with friends. Everyone had on a mask and there was great distance between tables. I went on a Saturday afternoon and sat at a high top table by the bar. We were supposed to have one server but they never came to our table so another waiter, Nick ended up taking our initial orders. The other person still hadn't come so Nick ended up being our waiter for the entire time. I've been to this place more than 5 times but Nick was by far the best waiter I've had here! We had about 4 different wines, all which were great, and price point wasn't bad either. I had the crawfish beignets and my bf had the banana foster rum cake that had just been added to the menu. He raved about this dessert for the next two days. Both were very very good and exceeded our expectations. All in all we will definitely be back and we hope to have Nick as our waiter.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Used Uber eats to deliver to our hotel. Service was timely and good food. Excellent shrimp and grits.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great service and great location. I love the outdoor patio area on a nice summers day. My husband and I enjoyed the Rose sangria since the beer taps where down, and my husband raved about the grilled cheese and tomato soup for the rest of the day. My prosciutto flatbread was also excellent and we couldn't have picked a better place for a quick lunch during work.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: A must when visiting NOLA. I love this place- love the food and the wine (it's on tap and so cool to get a flight of whatever you want). The service is amazing and so is the atmosphere/decor.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Visiting from out of town and noticed this restaurant as I was walking around. Thought I would enjoy, but I thought wrong. Terrible and unfriendly waitress. She took my drink order and never came back. She walked past my table to check on other guests but never acknowledged me. I had to ask another waiter to get her attention and she still never came back to take my food order. Terrible customer service. I believe if my skin color was different then I would have received better service.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Talk about curb appeal! We had walked passed this place before and had put it on our foodie list. Next day, we came for brunch. My only regret is that we had not gone sooner on our earlier trips to NOLA! Instagram dream to say the least. Presentation is very easily overlooked many times but not at Copper Vine and the flavor profiles were just as good. We had a wonderful spread of Tomato Basil soup, Beet salad, Crab Cake Benedict, Brussels Sprouts and Biscuits! The Beet salad is a must. Shout out to John S for keeping the vibe more enjoyable and relaxed!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This was our first visit and we were extremely impressed. I had deviled eggs that were to die for and my entree was pasta with wild mushrooms which I added shrimp to. It's small so definitely reservations but highly recommend
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Before I start with the compliments, I have to say one thing... Y'all have to get locks or vacant signs for the bathroom doors. I love the unisex idea but I would like to use the bathroom without a fear (which came true...) of someone walking in. Let's do better. (This was September 13, 2018. Hopefully, they've updated since.)

Besides that annoyance, everything was great! The food was delicious. The decor was gorgeous!  The staff was accommodating​ and friendly.  I was there on a busy night and my drink order was lost in the shuffle but it was understandable and the problem was taken care of promptly.  I would definitely go back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: What a lovely place! We had the cauliflower which was great! The waitress appeared to working on her own so at the beginning was a bit standoffish but she settled down after a while. The chicken and waffle was great!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I had the sunflower arugula salad and added crispy oysters. It had a great flavor and I was definitely satisfied. The ambience in the outside patio was beautiful. Lots of greenery and hanging plants.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
The CBD is pretty dead, but Copper Vine is poppin' and deserves a visit! The atmosphere and ambiance is top-notch, the decor is beautiful and welcoming. I also am one of those people that pays attention to the music played, and they were playing ODESZA - aka my favorite electronic duo ever. Music was on-point with the vibes. 

Service was AMAZING! Our waitress (I forgot her name) broke down the menu to us and was very detailed in her descriptions. 

We ordered the cheese & charcuterie board (blue cheese, Brie, & a cheddar I think), the duck debris fried and jumbo lump crab deviled eggs. The debris fries were delicious, and you can't go wrong with charcuterie. The deviled eggs were good, but $8 for only 3 and barely any crab, so I'd pass on these next time. 

We didn't get any entree plates, but there are plenty of small plates & apps for the table to share and for everyone to try a bit of everything. I heard the LA crawfish grilled cheese was good and hope to try that on my next visit! Overall, really really amazing restaurant that I look forward to experiencing again.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Copper Vine is hidden gem located next to the French Quarters. The food was very refreshing and healthy. Great spot for lunch. Highly recommend the courtyard sitting area.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Just amazing. Had lunch with my daughter and everything rocked. The deviled eggs were perfectly spicy and I loved the "Green Vine" - plant based burger. This burger is absolutely meaty and delicious. Loved the Brussels sprouts too. Can't wait to try it again!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I went on a Monday evening for happy hour, and couldn't decide on what to drink or eat, there were so many good options. I finally settled for the Flight Club Flight which is a sampler of a red, white and Rose' (it didn't disappoint). For food I ordered the Brussels sprout, tuna tartare & caviar, crawfish beignets, and black truffle fries all of which was amazing. The crawfish beignets are very rich, creamy and cheesy... it was a bit much for me but nevertheless delicious!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I have been passing this place for a while so we decided to pop in. Sitting outside on the patio is very inviting, cozy and it reminds you of being in the tropics, except for the traffic noise because it is located in the CBD. I am in love with the outdoor eating patio. The crawfish beignets are delicious.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great happy hour spot!  Enjoy the outdoor patio on a nice day.  Wine flight added to the happy hour.  Brussel sprouts were excellent.  I would make a reservation - nice atmosphere and good bang for the buck!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Absolutely incredible. My now-fiancée and I went for brunch the morning I proposed (about a month ago), my efforts at getting a reservation at one of the major brunch players having failed. 

Well, I've never been happier with failure. The staff was welcoming and friendly (and didn't know the occasion, so they weren't playing it up). The food was some of the best I've had. I would give up every Seattle brunch spot to have Copper Vine closer to home. 

That morning we had the Brussels sprouts, the Apple fritter French toast and the cochon du lait benedict. All were pure heaven. Even though technically not part of the proposal, I can promise you this food makes it into every recounting of the story. 

We told my sister and brother-in-law they had to go the following weekend and then I went once more before my flight the weekend after that. You better believe Copper Vine has made the list of places to go every time we're in town and we've recommended it to everyone we've found out is heading to New Orleans. 

Thank you, Copper Vine!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
One of my friends suggested this restaurant for a Saturday brunch.  It is right off of Poydras, and I had never noticed it.  We sat on the garden patio, which completely hides the fact that you are sitting on a street corner. Plants completely envelop this patio, and it is incredibly beautiful and pleasant.  

We visited during coolinary, so there was a special coolinary menu you could order off of if wanted (you could also order from the normal menu).  I chose the french onion soup, croque madame, and the dessert beignets.  Every single item was delicious and decadent.  The beignets were the best I've ever had - they are light, airy, and puffy on the inside instead of heavy like they are at Cafe Du Monde.

There is a clean bathroom "suite" right inside the door, with unisex enclosed bathrooms.  This is a little weird but works out fine.

Paid street parking in front or paid parking lots near the restaurant.  Bus Stop one block away.

I'll definitely be back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I love the aesthetic in this restaurant! They have a small outdoor patio covered in vines. The decor isn't your typical New Orleans decor. They also have a room upstairs that's available to rent for parties. These fries don't even need ketchup or aioli. They're literal perfection and dream worthy. They have a great drink selection! I went for lunch and had a few glasses of white wine - so refreshing! Definitely check this place out if you haven't yet!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: If you are at this establishment during the summer or early fall you must try their frose! It is Devine but seasonal. One of the last places in the city with all you can drink mimosas. Food is great and atmosphere is fabulous. The balcony is a great spot for cooler days but the outdoor seating is so nice for weather that needs a little more shade.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Had never been to Copper Vine for brunch, but they accommodated a large party of 9 for a special occasion. They initially had us placed at separate tables, but the manager quickly rectified this for us. I had only been for dinner and the brunch menu had a lot of the same overlap of some items. 

The duck debris fries are a MUST GET. they were devoured immediately. The flatbreads are also a great choice! I wish I had stuck to getting some small plates as my entree because the crab Benedict just didn't really do it for me. There was no flavor/spice in the tomato-sherry Holland size and just was a really bland dish unfortunately. I tried the waffle with the chicken & waffle and it was tasty, so maybe I just picked the wrong dish. 

Definitely won't fault them for that, but just a heads up for those planning to visit CV for brunch in the future :)
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Loved this place! Beautiful little wine bar! I was visiting NOLA and we ended up coming here twice during our vacation. I really appreciated the diversity of the wine list and the food was top tier as well! We loved the fact that we could order 2.5 oz pours of wine which allowed us to try many more wines. Great Vibe! I definitely would recommend!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Loved copper vine! So yummy and the cocktails were great. I got the sage something 10/10 recommend! For food I got the chicken sandwich, very good! It was great for my friends birthday dinner! Loved the area and the decor of the restaurant!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
I will be returning. Because I just still cannot believe I enjoyed EVERYTHING I tried at Copper Vine. Yes I am a bit animated but I'm not exaggerating my experience--I truly recommend this place! Me and my friends came here for Saturday brunch to celebrate a birthday so we had it on our mind to spend some $$$. The restaurant is gorgeous. The patio was to die for; I didn't know if i wanted to sit inside, at the bar, on the patio or on the balcony (yes balcony!). Our server Justin was amazing. From the first introduction we fell in love with their personality. Great service really makes a good place a great one. Antonio also helped us towards the end of our visit. They were both funny, knowledgeable & provided great service  

We got bottomless mimosas and I swear we never saw the bottom of our glasses.... That was a first! Most places make you buy a bottle and call it "bottomless" or give you a glass or two but here you will keep getting that champagne refill until you LEAVE. And in great Louisiana fashion you can take your mimosa to go :) okay let me get to the food

Apps:
- Jumbo lump crab deviled eggs
- Black truffle fries
- Filet mignonette brochette (Our FAV! The mushrooms were the best part... seasoned & cooked to perfection wow)
- Pork belly & corn fried oysters (least favorite but it was not bad. I would just recommend the other apps if it's your first time)

Entrees:
- Jump lump crab Benny (our server Justin recommended this for me! I added steak on the side also) 

Cocktails:
- Bottomless mimosas (we had orange juice, cranberry, & pineapple juice. All yummy but the pineapple juice was an all around fav because of how fresh it tasted) 

- Everything's Coming Up Roses: I usually stray away from floral drinks because it's too overwhelming or not blended well but I surprisingly enjoyed this mix. Told Justin to send my compliments to the bartender fr ahah! 

Of course after we left someone told me I should've tried the beignets smh. No worries I'll be back xD
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I came here for Sunday brunch while I caught up on some work. I sat out on a very cute patio upstairs and was served by Jasmine. I was very thankful of the seating because it sat away from everyone in the restaurant and gave me a nice quaint spot to catch up on some of my work. I would give 5 stars but my food took a while to come out. My entree took nearly 45 minutes- however it was well worth the wait. I ordered the Crab Benny and it was such a delicious flavorful dish. Jasmine was very sweet and funny. She was very apologetic and even remarked that she "had to go and cook the food herself". She kept the atmosphere light and I did not feel rushed. She actually bought me some beignets (which were divine) to apologize for the wait which I was very appreciative of. All in all, the place is cute, food is good and service is amazing. Would 100% recommend for all of my brunch junkies.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Checked out this place for the first time last night and loved it! Such a cute outdoor patio area, very nice for getting together with friends or a date night. I love that there are fans in the outdoor patio, which makes sitting outside in New Orleans 90 degrees and humidity much more bearable outside. The wines were yum--I'm a cab girl and really enjoyed the copper vine cab and the silver totem. The food was amazing also! We got the black truffle fries and goat and fig flat bread to share, and I had the crawfish grilled cheese. I wish the black truffle fries were a little heavier on the truffle taste, but the fries themselves were great! Very crispy and nicely seasoned. Service was timely. Would definitely come back! Great atmosphere and great food/drinks.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Update because I came back for a dinner date with a friend: i love it here! So glad I gave them another chance. The food was great and so were the drinks (I highly recommend the frosé, thank me later).
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: It was a last minute decision to go here and this place did not disappoint at all. The device was amazing!! The food was just as good. The place was super cute. We literally ordered everything off the menu. If u are looking for great food and wonderful ambience...this is the place to go!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Copper Vine Wine is stunning! There is indoor, outdoor and balcony seating available. I had the pleasure of sitting in the outdoor area that looks like a tropical oasis with all the beautiful plants. The decor inside the restaurant is also very modern and chic. Besides being extremely picture worthy, the food is really good too. It's rare that you can find a brunch spot that checks off all the boxes on my checklist. 

I think people are starting to take notice of this gem, so if you are thinking about checking it out be sure to make reservations. For this brunch I didn't go with a typical mimosa. I went with a sweet red wine called Lambrusco Dolce Fiore and it was delicious. 

We started off with snacks the LA Crawfish Beignets and the Jumbo Lump Crabmeat Deviled Eggs! I especially loved the beignets, the eggs were okay. I mean I wasn't expecting anything spectacular, after all it's just a deviled egg.

My cousin and God-Daughter got the Wild Shrimp and Grits which included Sauce Piquante, Roasted Peppers and Pickled Onions. They both enjoyed it but my God-Baby eats like an adult..haha. I will say this isn't a kid-friendly restaurant. I went with the Seared Gulf Fish with Summer Squash, Corn, and Butter Bean Succotash. It was light and fresh but equally delicious. 

We definitely enjoyed our experience. Our waitress was very pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu. I love that.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: If you want some nice cute drinks with a nice greenery this is it. I love that that they have inside and outside seating. I had a frosé that was very tasty. Would recommend
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Love it! So Yummy! Everything was 100% and our waiter was so cute and sweet. Strongly suggest cubano and cheese tray
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We went Saturday around 1:30 for just drinks and a snack. We didn't have a reservation, but they were able to seat us at the bar. The bartender was lovely and very personable. Compared to other spots, there was plenty of staff to get service from which was great. The frozen sangria was fresh and really enjoyable. My friend loved his amaze mint mocktail. We were glad to see it as a listed option as nondrinkers/designated drivers should have fun options too! The black truffle fries were tasty too. I would love to come back for brunch or a casual post work drink/snack as the ambiance and drinks were lovely and the value seemed solid. I can't wait to come back :)
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
AMBIENCE !!

This restaurant is beautiful inside and out. I am OBSESSED with all the hanging plants and greenery. This is one of the cutest spots downtown to grab an after work drink, have date night, or just a simple evening bite. 

Happy Hour is fantastic. With $8 flights of beer or wine and appetizers ranging from $3-7, this is sure to be an affordable afternoon spot. Additionally, i truly cannot rave enough about the brussels sprouts. The Copper Vine chefs have PERFECTED the art of a divine brussels sprout with their perfectly roasted technique and mouth watering side of aioli, these are a MUST!

Additionally the staff is always light-hearted and make for a fun atmosphere. They do check for vaccine cards as well, woo hoo!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
The cutest little place in downtown New Orleans with a great covered patio for outdoor seating! They also have a large selection of etOh & a great meal selection! We got their Petit Filets w/ Wedges topped w/ a yummy green chimichurri 

@phidingthefam
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place was great I loved their food and drinks, I'm so happy they were open.  The cv margarita was my favorite along with the creole tomatoe sandwich it's a must try.  And definitely try the Cajun carrots
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Food was average at best. Fries were great. Server was weirdly passive aggressive. We ordered multiple mimosas, yet found out later that they had pitchers, which was never offered as an option. The mimosas are served in a teeny tiny glass..... They offer "optional" sides with your meals in their opening speech, but then later say it's an up charge. The food runners were fabulous. 
Honestly very odd experience.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
A group of five of us came here for dinner to catch up and we had a really great time!

AMBIANCE: The aesthetic of this place is extremely boho chic mixed with a bit of New York style. The seating in the restaurant is like none other, there are a variety of booths, tables, and bar top seating. Additionally, the greenery is so well kept and is likely to make guests feel extremely comfortable.

APPS: We got three types of appetizers: the truffle fries, the fig and goat cheese flatbread, and the Brussel sprouts. The truffle fries were so fluffy and light, they were eloquent and tasteful. I could have done without the flatbread. The goat cheese and the fig created a strange texture. I did not personally taste the Brussel sprouts but I heard that "THESE ARE THE BOMB"
