ENTREE: For my entree I got the LA Crawfish grilled cheese with the fries. The grilled cheese did not disappoint. It was super creamy and the remoulade was very smooth.

DRINKS: The Magnolia Spritz was extremely bitter, but that is to be expected. I chose a cucumber martini, which was amazing (was not too sweet and not too strong)
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Delicious!!! I can't say enough good things about copper vine. From the drinks to the food to the great staff, 10/10 experience for sure. Can't go wrong with any of the small plates offered. My favorite dish has to be the seafood grilled cheese. The perfect amount of seafood and gooey cheese *chefs kiss*
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
This is my second time dining at Copper Vine, and I loved it. I ordered the LA crawfish grilled cheese... WOW it was good. The grilled cheese consisted of cheddar, slow-roasted tomatoes, mustard remoulade, and crawfish on sourdough bread. My only complaint is there was not enough crawfish in the sandwich. 

I also sipped on some Cultivar Rose (a Pinot Noir Rose). It was delicious! This was a birthday lunch for me and it was lovely. Also, it was one of my first experiences dining out since Covid 10 - the staff was very clean, wearing masks, and the tables were nicely spaced. I felt very comfortable the entire time.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Today I took a visit to Coppervine @coppervinewinepub 

It was happy hour when I arrived so I got the 3 wine order of a red, white, and rose all for only $8. I also ordered the pick two with the Cochon De Lait Cuban and Chicken and Boudin Gumbo. Both were delicious, I wanted to order another sandwich but needed to leave. I will be returning to try the rest of the menu.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: A cute little space in the CBD. Outdoor seating was available, and looked very nice, but it was too cold to sit outside. Service was right on top of our needs, making sure our drinks and water never were empty. Appetizers (shareables) were good portion sized, the meals were very good.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: my FAVORITE restaurant in nola!!!! This place was absolutely amazing. The atmosphere, the food, & the service was excellent. We all loved every bite of the food, and the drinks were delicious as well. The arugula salad was great as well as the truffle fries and the Brussels sprouts. Highly recommend this place all 8 of us enjoyed our food and could not stop talking about it.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I went here with an old friend to catch up and I didn't think to get a reservation, but they were still accommodating. We wanted to sit outside, but they were booked up so they allowed us to sit inside until a table opened outside. We got the truffle fries as an appetizer. Delicious! I got the impossible burger as my entree and the brussel sprouts instead of fries. The burger was so good I thought they accidentally gave me meat. The brussel sprouts tasted as though they were deep fried in grease however. Wasn't a fan. I also got the Lavender Spritz and it was great. I wish I could give this place a 4.5 stars bc the brussel sprouts only took like a .5 off for me. I would definitely recommend!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Tracy, our waitress, was the first and most impactful part of why we fell in love with this restaurant. Her wine recommendation was spot on, too. I had the pork plate and it was tender and juicy. The dessert was perfect: espresso poured over vanilla ice cream. And the interior décor, coupled with overlooking the downtown scape, was picturesque.

Side note: The gluten free options were excellent.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
My friend and I caught a matinee at the Saenger Theatre, and we were looking for a nice place with a unique ambiance to grab some snacks and wine before leaving the city. We remembered a recommendation for Copper Vine, so we walked over. The renovations done to the building after the former beer bar closed are astonishing. The patio with amble seating and vines is like a little oasis in the busy area of the city. The dining area is open and well lit with airy space and windows. There are long dining tables and two seaters available. We simply sat at the bar where we had the most delightful server tend to us. He was friendly and engaging, and that just added to the experience. We ordered wine and two shareables - the filet mignon brochette and the fig and goat cheese flatbread. Wow, from the delicious wines to the mouth watering snacks, we were so pleased with our experience. I wish we had been a little more hungry so we could have snagged some of the mains or more small plates. 

I eagerly await my next trip into New Orleans to place this back on my list, maybe for the spring season I can curl up on the patio with some of the signature cocktails. 

Standing ovation for Copper Vine, I will return for sure!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Cool little spot downtown close to the Dome. Great atmosphere with lots of wines on tap, and an amazing junglow courtyard space outside!

Service was enthusiastic and friendly on their second night open. We shared a bunch of apps and small plates which were absolutely fantastic, and then ordered two desserts, which were a little disappointing.

I had a wine flight and loved having so many options. The roasted beets were superb, the deviled eggs, divine. Flatbread was basic, but yummy and oysters were good, but pricey at $4 each! Would skip next time. Desserts were a bust. Disappointing. They do have a self-serve popcorn machine with different seasonings: cheddar, kettle corn, asiago pepper and dill.

Would def come back to try a main entree and hang out in that gorgeous courtyard outside dripping with beautiful greenery...
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Enjoyed our brunch here. Lots of wine selections to accompany your meal. 

We decided to start off with beignets and coffee. They were warm and delicious. We had to get another order. 

The crawfish grilled cheese was flavorful and came with a nice side salad. 

I enjoyed my crab Benny. There was a lot of meat and loved the spice and sauce.

The frittata was cooked perfectly. Plan on getting that if you want to share or have leftovers because the portion was huge. 

Service was nice. Great spot to relax. Their patio is beautiful and they offer bottomless mimosas on Sunday for $25.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place was so much fun! The menu had so many options. We sat outside and it could not have been more perfect. All of the plants are absolutely stunning. It wasn't too hot outside and we also had fans blowing on us. The food and drinks were fantastic. Our server was so pleasant and helpful. I'd love to go back and sit outside anytime :)
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
This place is AMAZING seriously. Second time in as many weeks.

Lunch here was great both times - the jumbo lump crab devil eggs are to die for and their cocktails are delicious. Second time around I tried their berry salad which was so fresh and crisp! Both times I got the gulf fish it was sooo good!! Definitely stop on bye.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Copper Vine is a pretty cute brunch place and was one of the few places in NOLA that actually let you take your drink on the streets with a to-go cup. The food was pretty good and the service was ok - it wasn't packed when we went and the food took forever but it was pretty nice when we finally got to eat. 

I love the atmosphere and decor of Copper Vine. It's much bigger than what it initially looks like outside, but I'm learning during my NOLA visit that there are multiple restaurants that have levels to them. Pretty cool!

We ordered the margherita flatbread and it was not that impressive. It had a good crunch to it but looked dismal. Unlimited mimosas here for like $25. 

I ordered the quiche with crab and it was really tasty - I wish it was bigger!!! The arugula salad on the side was so fresh too. 

The gnocchi was probably the best serving I've ever had - usually it's pretty soggy and hard to get through but this had such good flavor and texture. 

Overall, Copper Vine was one of the better restaurants that I got to experience on my NOLA trip. Definitely get a to-go cup for your champagne!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I loved the food and the atmosphere. I got the crawfish grilled cheese and was obsessed. I was, however, not really happy with the service. We were a group of 6 and was able to share the 3 cheese charcuterie board!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This wine bar had a good selection of wines, mostly from California, on tap with 4 size options. You can get a half glass, 5 ounces, 8 ounces, or a bottle. I really like the Zinfandel I tried. The food was also tasty. The portions for the entrees were on the smaller side but the portion for the fries was large. I got a pick two with an arugula salad which came with Parmesan and sunflower seeds and chicken and boudin gumbo.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Our server was awesome! The ambiance is great and the location is conveniently in the CBD which makes it a prime spot for tourists and locals alike. 
The appetizers were good and perfect size for sharing for our large group of 6 but nobody was crazy about their entrees but would still recommend for drinks and apps!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Excellent food and ambiance. Tracey was a phenomenal waitress, knows all the dishes and wines. Will definitely be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Ate Sunday brunch with a few girls while in NOLA for a bachelorette party and it was AMAZING!  We shared the Brussel sprouts (snack) and each had an entrée. The Brussel sprouts were sooo GOOD! Perfectly crisp  and I'm still dreaming about the garlic aioli sauce

We all ate off of each other's plates and they were all very good!! Lots of flavor.
FRIED DUCK & CORNBREAD WAFFLE-- huge waffle!
The CRAB CAKE BENDICT-- recommendation came from our server and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!
& the SHRIMP & GRITS-- so yummy. Our only complaint was that the shrimp in the shrimp & grits was a little undercooked. 

We choose to add the bottomless mimosas option for $25 each and we all thought that was a great idea! It was nice because we were able to switch up what kind of juices we wanted with our Champagne each time we ordered a new drink! They also let us take a to-go cup 
Would love to go back and try their  dinner, but would 100% recommend their brunch!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Tonight, my friends and I went to Copper Vine and it was really amazing. From the beautiful views in the courtyard to delicious wines; this was really a great dining experience. Not to mention, our waiter John was so awesome!!!! He definitely added to the entire experience. He's was very knowledgeable about the wines and everything on the menu. He was so attentive and literally was there for everything we needed! Such an amazing dinner.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Had a FANTASTIC meal at copper vine! I have heard so many good reviews about this place, I made a reservation ASAP! Our reservation was ready right when we got there and we sat in the upstairs dining room! Not very loud and a great view! Their menu was so hard to pick from! My party ended up sharing a bunch of appetizers since we couldn't choose just a few! 

1. Tuna tartare and caviar- amazing! My favorite appetizer out of all 6. Flavor is amazing and it spreads so easily on the crackers! Love that it comes with avocado on the bottom! 
2. Pork belly and corn fried oysters- loved these so much! Flavor was great and loved that they came with blue cheese crumbles and ranch! They come in an order of 3, but the ones we got were quite small. Taste was amazing though! 
3. Bianca flatbread- so delicious. More on the plain side on the flatbread options, so we decided to add charcuterie! Definitely added flavor to it! It was cheesy and delish! 
4. Bacon wrapped dates- I love seeing dates on a menu, I was excited to see them served at copper vine. They were warm and delicious! The syrup on top really made them worth it! If you don't like dates, I would still try it! The bacon flavor really changes the way you will think about dates! 
5. Burrata and heirloom tomatoes- literally mouth watering. My second favorite thing and maybe even tied with the tuna! The burrata and tomato mixture was just so good. The cheese was so creamy and the tomatoes had so much flavor. It came with crispy pieces of bread that made the whole burrata experience! 
6. Gnocchi Au gratin- this was good but very heavy. When it came out, it looked like baked Mac n cheese! I like that the top was crunchy and the inside was creamy. This app will fill you up fast if you have too much though! 

Of course we did pair some wines with our apps, and they were so good as well. If you like sweet drinks, their sangrias will be perfect for you! Otherwise, they have a huge wine list!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Looking for a cute brunch date with your gals and a nice patio? Copper Vine has it all! Can't forget the cute bathroom pics either. Their backdrop is beautiful. 
Booked this place two weeks in advance for a party of 9 on Open Table (love restaurants that use this platform)! Gave this place 4 stars because the food is good, but nothing crazy! Our waiter was amazing. Food came out really fast and they kept checking up on us. Always a plus for us, especially a large group of 9! The crawfish beignets are bomb. Have to get this! I had the LA crawfish grilled cheese, I liked this a lot as well. The lamb appetizer was very flavorful and really good. The crab Benny was okay. Truffle fries are a must here as a side. If you're looking to get a cool drink, I would recommend the frozen Sangria. A pitcher if you're feeling it! Overall, great experience, good time with friends and the staff is great! Can't beat the outdoor patio. It gets hot quickly in NOLA weather but worth it in the spring!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: John was an incredible server who set us up with a great wine selection and was super personable. Will definitely be back soon.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
We had the most superlative experience at chic Copper Vine last night. It started a few weeks ago when requested space for a private party with 25 people within a certain budget. Not only did Mike speedily respond with the friendliest invitation and enthusiasm for our event, he kept up that standard of communication every time we emailed asking for this or that small tweak as our final guest count kept wavering and the party's dietary restrictions filtered in. He provided a quick solution at each turn. 

The food and drink menu choices he offered blew me away with the variety and creativity. Terrific balance of regional specialties and nouveau cuisine choices. I was able to make selections to accommodate all of our known food issues among guests while having a spectacular menu. The contract process was smooth and split up into two payments which made spreading out the cost very convenient. Furthermore the contract was very clearly spelled out and perfectly aligned with my own math, no surprises! 

The service itself was unparalleled. Antonio and Dylan meticulously made sure no one's beverage was empty. They accommodated ad-hock special requests (no mushrooms on one, allowing another guest to order something not on the pre-arranged menu) with cheerful professionalism. With each of the 4 courses, it seemed as though we were all magically served each plate at once. They made sure my mom - the guest of honor - felt honored without provoking any fear of a humiliating public fuss over her birthday. These gentlemen have mastered their craft. 

Onto the food! MY LORD AND ALL THE SAINTS IN HEAVEN was the culinary portion of the party beyond. Beyond what? Everything, that's what. Course 1: We started with caprese skewers - perfectly proportioned with just enough balsamic glaze to pop the flavors of the basil, cheese, and perfectly ripe pretty tomatoes. The goat cheese fig flatbread was another masterpiece of balanced flavors and texture. Course 2: The gumbo was flavorful, obviously made with a rich roux, but light enough to reasonably be a mere amuse-bouche leading up to the stars of the show. However my favorite was the arugula sunflower salad. It's bright citrusy front notes perfectly transitioned into the fresh peppery notes and cool texture of the arugula. Course 3: Wild Shrimp and Grits. Utterly swoon worthy. The alternate Herb-roasted wild mushroom pasta served with a sous-vide egg that upped the intensity of the creamy velvety delightful texture was sheer brilliance. The only reason I didn't finish mine was anticipation of Course 4: Bananas Foster Rum Cake. I swear you will never experience it's equal anywhere else. I'm still fantasizing about it a day later. 

This was truly the event of a lifetime. Every detail was thought of. They care the took to elevate my mother's birthday celebration into an elegant yet festive and intimate epic experience my family will remember forever deserves a loud round of applause. I wish I could nominate them for whatever the equivalent of an Oscar would be in their industry. 

The very last touch of the evening was discreetly  presenting me with a substantial card stock version of the personalized menu cards as my party was saying their goodbyes before dispersing home across the country. This extra touch perfectly personifies the care they poured into every detail, making what I'm sure was epic behind the scenes work seem effortless to us.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Friends and I had a blast for bottomless brunch on a Saturday early afternoon. As soon as we arrived, we were brought upstairs and seated close to the balcony. The lighting was gorgeous, as was the moody decor in the room. Our server Antonio greeted us promptly and was a delight!

We ask for menu recommendations, and learned that you truly could not go wrong with anything you ordered. We were told that bottomless brunch was available for $25 per person and that each person needed a meal in order to be served. That worked for us because it was exactly what we planned to do. We were brought small carafes of orange juice and cranberry juice and Antonio filled our glasses with champagne.

To eat, we shared the black truffle fries, bacon wrapped dates, crawfish beignets, and bianca flatbread. For our mains,  a friend and I shared the crab benedict and apple fritter french toast. The bacon wrapped dates were incredible, and we were able to add an additional piece to make it 4 instead of the 3 it usually comes with. Others tried the Ancient Grains Salad and the Shakshuka. Everything was a hit! 

We did not feel rushed to leave, and continued to pick at our plates while we chatted and drank our mimosas. Since our table was 6 people, there was an 18% auto-gratuity added to our check with the ability to tip on top.

What a great spot for a bottomless brunch!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Yaaas hunny, Girls' Night Out/Date Nights/Winos UNITE! We just got a serious upgrade hit the CBD and it is LEGIT! 

My party of 4 had a 6pm reservation for Saturday night. Taylor was our server and she was the bomb.com. She recognized my party had a lot of catching up to do and gave us plenty of time to decide on drinks and food without becoming impatient. 

We started with individual 8oz carafes and as the night went on, opted for the bottle of the nectar of the God's aka the Grenache Rose on the menu.  One guest in our party had a couple of Sazeracs followed by some Crying Eagle beers (he's an Eagles fan, so it fits, ha!)

We ordered shareable apps: the charcuterie board (is it a GNO if you didn't have a cheeseboard?), brussel sprouts, and duck fat fries. All yum! For dinner, my gals ordered the margherita flatbread, the burger, and I had the club sandwich. I'll embarrassingly admit that I can't recall how it was because I was *turnt* but, I'm sure it was delicious! 

Service was top notch! In addition to Taylor being our main server, we had other staff bring our food, clear plates, refill waters very promptly. 

Our bill was..well, reflective of a good time. Pro tip: try to convince yourself to start with the bottle instead of ordering individual glasses.. you'll get there eventually, and it'll probably end up saving you a few $$. 

This place is so very Instagram-worthy so get something set up soon! I can't wait to go back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Visited for the first time last week, and we will definitely be back. Outdoor patio is lovely and lump crab deviled eggs and Brussel sprouts were standouts! Service was efficient but not rushed.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: So much fun! We stopped in here for a bite to eat at Happy Hour yesterday and I'm so glad we did. I had the charcuterie board and the most beautiful and delicious drink I've ever seen. It had lavender in it but I don't remember the name. The staff was attentive and on their A game the entire time. I would definitely recommend.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Nice to see something with food taking the place of happys. Clearly good place to try for wine enthusiasts, but they also have good mixed drinks

At a recent visit, got a ruby soho that was amazing. Got a second for a friend, also amazing. Then we ordered a second round, but guess the bartender changed and got a completely different drink. They tried again, but wasn't the same as the first. Not sure what happened, but there is some variability based on bartender I suppose
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Cute place with some good options . Entrees but crack mode but the starters were decent, drinks looked pretty good but I am 13 so I couldn't get one.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This place is amazing!!! Beautiful inside and out! The service was exceptional! The food was so good and the drinks were great! Love the vibes of this place!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Relaxing atmosphere. Respectful of Covid precautions. Delicious lunch! Highly recommend!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Staff 10/10, food was FABULOUS! The Cochin fries were SO GOOD, do yourself a favor and try those!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
This place is great for a classy lunch/dinner! It's located near downtown New Orleans so parking may be tough, but there's a parking lot behind the restaurant with decent pricing during the day. They are requesting proof of vaccination for sitting inside.

We ordered the truffle fries and the oyster appetizer. For entree we got the wagyu burger and the berry salad. Everything was amazing, very well cooked, and extremely filling. Our server was great and checked on us frequently. 

For drinks I got the Amaze-Mint mocktail. It tasted so good! Highly recommend it. Overall this is a great restaurant to go check out. I'll definitely be back soon.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
BEST MEAL OF THE TRIP!!!!!  I have been to
New Orleans over a dozen times, eaten at many restaurants, and NO ONE compares to this place. The atmosphere was fantastic! Our choices were white sangria, truffle fries, Brussel sprouts, for and goat cheese flatbread, and crawfish grilled cheese. Everything was better than the next thing. I have suggested this place to every single person who has asked me for a restaurant recommendation. I could eat that grilled cheese every single day.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Booked based on location and will return based on the food! Nice selection of wine and cocktails. Our server was very engaging and knowledgeable about the menu. We started with a charcuterie board which I highly recommend. 2 of us chose the seared tuna salad, one had the quail and boudin and another had the ratatouille. We were all pleased with our selections. No one had room for dessert but there were several that sounded delicious!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We loved our experience at Copper Vine! Though we were a little bummed we weren't able to sit on their gorgeous patio. We offered to wait for it, but they told us it was booked, though we also had a reservation. We forgot to take picture, but my husband and I shared 5 appetizer which we all equally delicious. We got Deviled Eggs, Tuna Tartare, Bacon Wrapped Dates, Brussels Sprouts, and Black Truffle Fries. My favorite was the tartar, and my husband's was the bacon wrapped dates.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Went on a Saturday for brunch. The hostess greeted us and informed us that it would be a slight wait but we chose to sit at the bar instead. There is outdoor and indoor seating. The ambiance is beautiful and casual. It has the feeling as if you are eating in a garden minus the flies. 
For a drink I ordered a frozen Rose' it was good because I am a light weight but to others it may taste like a strawberry flavored icee. The drink was very beautiful when it arrived with a strawberry and cucumber for a garnish. 
Appetizers, we ordered pork belly, carrots, dates, stuffed beignets. The pork belly was delicious! The carrots could have used a little more time roasting as they were a bit crunchy. I didn't try the dates, they were wrapped in bacon. 
Entree I orders the lump crab Benny. None of the flavor actually stood up. The biscuit did not taste fresh and the egg didn't really have flavor. I also opted for the egg to be scrambled instead of poached. My friend order the fried chicken sandwich, the slaw really brought out the flavor in the sandwich.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
NO WAY is this a 4+ Star restaurant.  Five of us with a reservation on a Saturday night.  It was 6pm we were on the early side they weren't slammed yet.  Appetizers took forever. Crawfish beignet were fine a little stringy, considerable filler.  The carrots were fine too. Black truffle fries were crap.  Heavily doubt that the fires were made in house.  It would legitimately would have been better to doordash fries from McDonalds or Wendys to get a better quality fry with "truffle" oil on them.  

We got three salads that were fine, but WHY o WHY did they think it was OK to drop the entree's on the table about 90 seconds after the salads arrived.  That is a cardinal sin of table serving. Stacking freshly prepared food in front of a diner and forcing them to choose: 1) let something get stale or cold, 2) make a fuss and ask them to take it back (it's just going to sit under a heat lamp) if you make them cook it fresh, then wait 30 minutes while the rest of your party eats uncomfortably.  TWO of us had salads before our entree and be both had hot food crowding out or place setting with a full salad sitting in front of us. 

The Gulf Fish Almondine was truly weird and worse for it.  Fish almondine should be cooked in a pan with a butter sauce -- or broiled or baked -- with a garnish of almonds.  I understand artistic riffs on this that can still be excellent.  But if you promote yourself as a seafood town because you're next to the ocean, why would you create a fish almondine that has a HARD, THICK batter that totally overpowers a delicate protein like fish?  It made no sense and the crust really took away from a nice piece of fish.  It says "champagne cream sauce"  Delicate, right?  NOWHERE on the menu does it say that this dish with a classic name was not going to be prepared classically and have an unacceptably thick breading on it.  

honestly, if they hadn't rushed the entrees on top of the salad or at LEAST apologized, I would have gone another star.  But we did everything right -- made a rez, waited patiently when things were slow, didn't raise hell with awful service errors -- and they did too many things wrong.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Yes yes yes. They even make salad taste good! Immaculate atmosphere perfect for a date night!! Great drinks and awesome location so you can go walk around town afterwards!!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I absolutely love Copper Vine! It's definitely my new favorite spot. I love the ambience, vibe, decor, food, and the happy hour is pretty legit! Half off wine bottles and flatbreads!!! I love the concept of a wine pub, because we already have a ton of beer pubs in Nola, so a wine pub is refreshing. The wait staff is awesome! I have been two times so far and everything is consistent. I've tried the grilled vegetable and magherita flatbread. The Brussels sprouts and truffle fries are great! I tried the chefs special the first time I went, the dish was a grilled rum infused watermelon, topped with a flash fried soft shell crab with a side of fennel and arugula spring salad and a sweet chili sauce to add a little kick to the dish! I highly recommend you check out Coppervine of you're in the area.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We arrived at the end of happy hour and the hostess told us there was 6min left and then when we sat down at the bar the bartender told us happy hour was over. We told her the hostess just told us there was 6 min left. The bartender made a total face and looked over to the hostess and sighed Ok. We then got attitude from the bartender for the rest of our time there. To the point that we decided NOT to order dinner as the bartender ruined the atmospheres so we decided to leave and go somewhere else. No Bueno. I don't understand why a server would have an attitude with patrons when their tips rely on it. Maybe it's an attitude of they are due it because they work at a nice place. Pretty soon they won't have any repeat customers. We didn't get her name but she was good at making drinks but BAD at customer relations. Be careful. Places that the staff have attitude ruins the entire meal.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Amazing restaurant. I love sitting at the courtyard, the food is always on point too. The dessert is amazing make sure you get the bread pudding!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Service: 5/5
Food: 5/5
Atmosphere 5:5
Value: 5/5

Total: 20/20 

Man, I don't usually give a perfect score but I couldn't find a negative thing to say! Service was great, food was amazing and we sat outside in the cool NOLA breeze. The decor of this place is chic and hip but not overdone. The food is surprisingly inexpensive and they even took our picture. Next time I'm in NOLA this will be my first dinner stop. Oh and truffle fries are a must.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I loveeeee the outside seating at Copperfield, they have alot of plants and greenery along the walls thats gives it a nice warm welcoming aesthetic. That day I ordered a crawfish grilled cheese sandwich which was sooooo delicious. I ordered a whole sandwich which next time I will get a half because it was honestly ALOT for a sandwich. I love crawfish and grilled cheese so the combo was perfect. We also ordered a rise sangria now that drink was ok, it was very light in taste and almost tasted watered down. The drink is the only reason I would give this review 4 stars because it was watered down. The waiter was very speedy and checked on us alot. We made reservations there but didn't really need it because they weren't busy but I definitely suggest reservations just in case especially with everyone having covid restrictions and rules.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: So glad we decided to eat here.  The location was easy to get to.  The place had great ambiance and the music will surprise you.  However, the best part was the food and drinks.  I had the apple old fashioned and not only did it taste delicious, it packed a punch.  My hubs had the Port Orleans Beer and it was light and smooth.   We ate the Crab Deviled Eggs and the Oyster and Pork Belly Apps....YUM!  Best Oysters I've had in a while.  For main my hubs had the Cuban w/fries.  The fries don't even need ketchup that's how good they were.  His Cuban was better than many others we've tried.  I had the fig and goat cheese flat bread with duck confit.  I remembered after I started eating that I'm not a fan of goat cheese but it definitely didn't stop me from eating it, that's how good it was.  The only bad thing was we couldn't eat every bite, we were stuffed.  Go check it out, do yourself a favor and make a reservation.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Oh my, what a gem.  Our second night in the City and we were already learning how friendly NOLA is, but our waitress had to win some award!  We weren't in need of a huge meal, but wine, soup, salad and flatbread was just the thing.  It's a lovely place inside and so much larger than we expected.  We didn't make the Happy Hour when we wanted to try the wine flight, but really enjoyed our dinner there.  New Orleans is filled with restaurants with such great ambience and beautiful dining and this place would definitely be on a "come back to" or "recommend it" list!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Had a great brunch experience at Cooper Vine. This was my first time visiting and our waitress Lindsey was so sweet and helpful. I have to admit they have so many great appetizers choices it was hard to choose.

However, I ordered the CV signature margarita for my cocktail along with the LA Crawfish Beignets per Lindsey's recommendation, and they both were soooo delicious. I was a little skeptical about the beet mixed with the margarita but it was hands down one of the best margaritas I've ever had. So handcrafted. My cousin also ordered the Brussels Sprouts and Cajun Carrots and they were delicious and flavorful. I've never enjoyed having veggies as an app before. For my entree, I ordered the Jumbo Lump Crab Benny and they did not hold back on the jumbo lump crab meat there was more than enough for each bite. My cousin ordered the Gulf Fish Amandine and wow what an entree it was. I had the chance to taste a bite and let's just say I will be ordering it the next time. 

Overall, I loved the entire brunch experience. The atmosphere was perfect. We were able to sit outside amongst all the many plants in their beautiful courtyard and the bathroom was also picture worthy. Great experience, and I can't wait to go back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This was one of the best meals I've ever had. We had the burrata, cheese plate, steak and mushrooms, sprouts and gulf fish amandine. Everything was cooked perfectly. Great selection of wines. Our server Camille did a fantastic job!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
My TOP Brunch pick here @coppervinewinepub 

I am not a Brunchologist but I looooove the brunch hereThe vibe and space are perfect for after work cocktails and bites, date night out, weekend brunch or a @saints pre-party! Did I mention bottomless mimosas? I actually met the Chef at @libertyskitchen event at @aceneworleans hotel the other night and she was so nice. I love her cooking style-Caribbean, Southern and Cajun, using staple ingredients found locally. 
 
I can't take my eyes off the beautiful outdoor courtyard. 

They also have a beautiful indoor and rooftop area to sit and eat. 

I got a taste of everything. I really enjoyed the Crawfish Beignets, Jumbo Lump Crab Benny, Shrimp & Grits, Creole Shakshouka and the Chicken.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Amazing!! From start to finish my server Courtney made my visit absolutely perfect. From entree recommendations to pairing wines, her knowledge was limitless. Her passion and bright spirit made our experience at copper vine that much better! The food, the atmosphere, and the service was outstanding. Definitely try the smothered rabbit and mushroom fricassee and Brussels! I will definitely be recommending copper vine to all of my friends and family when they visit New Orleans!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I rarely leave reviews but felt the need to for copper. Collin in the front was so nice and patient with us, even calling to let them know we were coming late. Their wine and drinks menu is by far one of the best in the city! Camilla was such an angel and let me try two different white wines before ordering. Food, atmosphere, and service was all around great. Would definitely recommend this place for a date night or even to just come in and try different wines. It was reasonably priced as well! Thanks copper vine for a great date night. :)
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Love New Orleans. Just so many great places to eat and this place was bomb with fantastic service by Justin. Had some oyster dish that was just superb and want more. I don't even like blue cheese but it works in this dish. Had the crawfish beignets. Great. Bacon wrapped dates very nice. Ordered gnocci and loved it. Great flavor and mix. She had some pasta dish. It was all so good I forgot to take photos before eating things. The beignets are light fluffy and disappointing there aren't more :) great ambiance. Will be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: This is my first time coming here and aside from the lovely atmosphere outside and in what is there not to live about this place. Our server was excellent and made amazing recommendations for starters as well as entrees. The Filet Mignon Brochette was exquisite and highly recommendable as a starter. Highly recommend to first time NOLA visitors as well as anyone looking to try something new in the city. Great experience and definitely will be back for more
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: We ordered here from Uber Eats, and paid extra for the priority delivery. Our food was 130 bucks for two sandwiches, chicken picatta, a flatbread and a pickle plate. For what we got, it was a rip off! The food was decent, but not great or even good. It was food. This is a picture of the pickle plate at 8 bucks. I understand that with Uber, presentation isn't a thing but seriously? 8 bucks for this. I stopped caring and ate my dinner. The chicken was salty. The Parmesan cheese on the salad was cheap and so nasty I didn't eat it. The best thing was the pickles, all .25 cents worth. I will not be ordering from or ever dining in this place. Save your money and eat somewhere else.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Very accommodating (even with kids) though I'd recommend sitting outside if you have antsy ones. Decor is modern, bathroom is nicely decorated and clean. Outside area is funky and cool with lots of greenery. For the food, we had a charcuterie board with 3 cheeses, all delicious. The rose sangria was a hit at the table. For entrees we had brussels, pork, salads, and chicken pasta. All so yummy! Highly recommend! And the staff was very friendly and helpful!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
How lucky we were to be directed to this restaurant by the woman at the front desk of our hotel.

One night in New Orleans before catching the train back to California.  

Small plates so we could have a sampler of tastes.

Grilled octopus 
Roasted Brussels Sprouts
Ancient Grains salad
Beneighs for dessert!!!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Good wine. Terrible happy hour.

I went for HH a few days ago and was informed that their HH only included half off full bottles of wine and half of glasses of their house white wine and red wines... Nothing else. No cocktail or food specials. I've never seen anything like it.

With so few options, I did take advantage of half off a bottle of their white blend wine (which is usually $45 but $24 on HH). Crazy right? I've never seen a bottle of white blend wine that was $45. Even $24 for a white blend on HH felt like a rip off.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
So good. We went in for lunch, staff let us in 5before opening. We decided to sit outdoors since we went with a baby and didn't want to disturb people lunches inside. 
Drink wise I only had the mojito, Which was really good.
I wish the eggs had a bit more crab in them but they were good. 
Pasta omg! Delish! Egg cooker to perfection, al dente pasta, creamy sauce, seasoned very well. 
Bread pudding enough for 3-4 people. Comes a la mode-not pictured.
Definitely will be going back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: I was there the week before last and feel compelled to give a terrible review. I ordered the duck/boudin gumbo and it was a greasy salty mess. Just awful. My friend ordered the tuna appetizer and it was slimy. We were so disappointed. The atmosphere is charming and great though, and the wine flights are fantastic. I'm sorry I have to leave a bad review about the food though...
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: My significant other and I visited on 12/17/19, our last day in New Orleans.  The establishment was aesthetically pleasing, but the food was also great. We both had the baby herbs salad with shrimp.  There were quite a few shrimp in the salad, which made me happy. However, what truly excited me is that the shrimp is wild caught.  Our server was Steph (not short for Stephanie).  She was pleasant, engaging and very attentive.  We truly enjoyed ourselves and the food.  We'll definitely be back.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
I've been to coopervine many times but today was a great experience. I don't know the name of a girl as she never introduce her name at the bar who was a lady bartender today at around 3pm but she was very great, good convo, excellent service, my drinks were chilled had like mint 3 martinis, perfectly made, sent my truffle fries back as it was warm not hot at all but she fixed it.
Your french toast are always best.
I always like the vibes there but today was way better !!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Loved everything about this restaurant, the service the food and the delicious cocktails and selection of wine! It was really cool to be able to order half glasses of various wines to enjoy with your meal. No complaints at all and surely to come back!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
COPPERVINE! One of the new places you're probably hearing about from wine lovers. This place is still fairly new, and right now, it's being talked about by a lot! My friends and I wanted to try this spot during the Mardi Gras week and see what it's all about. 

The place looks great! Just right on Poydras, this place has a pretty fair selection of wines to try and food and snacks to munch on! The place inside was packed, and for some reason, their upstairs rooms were not open that day, so we had to sit outside during the night. It was fairly cold, and disappointingly, there were no lights outside and no heaters. However, the outside looked great and the soft chairs were pretty comfortable to sit on and relax. A lot of us ordered different wines and mixed drinks. We also ordered Herb Roasted mushroom pasta, Short rib, Wagyu Burger, Duck Fat Fries, 3 Pork Bellies, and a Smoked Salmon. 

First off, I could appreciate the selection of wines they had to offer, not bad at all. They also had a "Flight" option where you can try a small amount of 3 different wines. What shocked me was that these wines were sort of expensive. The server that brought out the "Flights" for my friends got a lot of the wines mixed up and was confused on who ordered what, sort of disappointing. As for the food, most of it was pretty lackluster, but not bad. The Duck Fat fries were $8 and it was nothing more but fries with a little cheese on top. EASY pass. We ordered 3 orders of the Pork Belly, but the dishes were inconsistent. My dish in particular was surrounded by a sauce while the other 2 didn't. I didn't know what the dish was supposed to look like. The Pasta was overcooked and lacked some flavour. The short ribs were nothing more that just shirt ribs to be honest. Lacking in flavour and just pretty underwhelming. If the burger did not have the Wagyu name in it, I would've just thought it was a regular burger, which it pretty much is, again, underwhelming. And finally.. that SALMON was $16!! The salmon was TINY and it came with about 5 pieces of small toast to share. Again, pretty standard, yet , EXPENSIVE.

Overall, this place isn't bad if you wanna come has some wines and snacks to eat and have some cheese plates, however, you're gonna spend a good bit. Nothing impressive for my first trip, I don't think this place would come across my mind again unless someone suggested.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great atmosphere, but extremely overpriced and overhyped for the quality of the food. $17 wagyu burger, taste like regular ole angus beef. $29 for the black drum fish, my hubby said it was good but it oddly didn't come with a side. I got a regular margarita which was great while he got the "Gentle Sage," which was also good. Service was great, just sad that the food wasn't to my expectation.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Great spot off of Poydras to hit up before or after a show/game/event at the Superdome or arena! Tremendous wine list by the glass with draft wine at the ideal temperature for red or white. The bartender was full of great suggestions and led me to a fantastic Cabernet blend by Italics and a surprisingly smooth and drinkable Petit Syrah. 

Definitely set up to promote conversation with large tall top tables and a comfortable bar area complete  lots of lush plants to make it feel more intimate. Appropriate lighting and volume level to ACTUALLY HAVE A CONVERSATION AND NOT BE ON YOUR PHONE ALL NIGHT. Imagine that ;)

The food was reasonably priced and pretty tasty and actually came out quickly (even though they warned us of long ticket times in advance due to a computer glitch). We got the goat cheese and fig flat bread and the deviled eggs along with the tomato soup. The tomato soup was by far my favorite - acidic with just a hint of creaminess to even it out and a ton of garlic. With a slab of bread, it would have been heaven on a slightly chilly night. The deviled eggs had great mustardy flavor, but not the best value on the menu for $8 for 3 - there was supposed to be some crab as well but it was pretty minimal. The flatbread was tasty as well - nice thin yeasty crust with a bunch of goat cheese and a fig drizzle but I would have liked a little bit more accoutrement on top (Maybe some veg, arugula, fig pieces?) even though I enjoyed every last bite.

Check Copper Vine out for lots of good wine and some delightful snacks!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Excellent food and customer service. Food is soo delicious. The fig and goat flatbread to die for so is the Brussels sprouts. I had the fried chicken sandwich and it was so good.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Copper Vine is a lovely restaurant and wine bar located in downtown NOLA. I went in the middle of the afternoon for happy hour. I had some wine, duck fat fries, and brussels sprouts. The fries were extremely decadent and everyone should be sure to order them. The brussels sprouts were quite good. They were nice and crisp with shaved cheese on top and a garlic aioli for dipping. I make a point to order brussels sprouts at most restaurants I go to. These two dishes paired nicely with my glass of red wine. Service was quick as I was one of the only people there since I went at an odd time. I would like to go back & sit at the lovely outdoor patio that looks like a garden oasis in the heart of downtown. They also have free popcorn!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Would 100% come back here. We had reservation outside, then it started to rain and we were accomidated quickly with a table inside. Our party of 6 found multiple things on the menu we wanted to order. Everything we had was great. Just enough food to fill you up. I had the lump crab Benny. Atmosphere was great. I loved the architecture, vintage vibes. We came here for brunch, I would love to come back here for dinner.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Great experience with wonderful ambiance and location. Chavez was so gracious and gave great suggestions on food and wine.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: A cute place to dress up and get dinner! Though the menu is pretty pricey, everything we ate was on point in terms of seasoning, texture, all of the above. I had the Wagyu burger and I highly recommend the truffle Parmesan fries. Their cocktails/mocktails are also good but still, v pricey. I'd give this more of a once-in-a-blue-moon special occasion kind of restaurant! Loved the atmosphere and the bathrooms were so well designed. You do have to pay for street parking unless it's after 7pm.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Loved this place! With great outdoor, indoor and bar seating, 30 wines on tap (yeah you read that right), super friendly staff and tasty bites - you won't be disappointed. We were there for lunch but once we got to looking at the small plates, we realized a sampling was gonna be the route we were going to take (and it was a good decision). 

Here's what we got:
Jumbo lump crab deviled eggs ***
Brussels sprouts ***
Black truffle fries ***
Filet mignon brochette **** (drooling now)
Tuna tartare **
Crawfish grilled cheese **** (ohhhh myyy)

You see all the stars. Need I say more?
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: The menu and atmosphere has been so carefully curated with nice size portions. The drinks were unique, complex, and not inundated with sweet drinks. Looking forward to my next visit!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
We love that vaccines or a negatory PCR test are required for inner seating. That said, my companion forgot the proof at the hotel so we opted for the beautifully green outdoor seating. It was great...even in the light drizzle!
Dusty was our knowledgeable and accommodating server. I highly recommend the excellent French shallot soup with gruyére. The broth was to die for!! We thoroughly enjoyed the chocolate amaretto brûlée with a lovely coffee as well. 
Wines are to be enjoyed, and you can bet we did! Varying pours and styles will be sure to tickle your palette positively. Enjoy!
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text: Food is always delicious. Best way to try different things is to order several apps with friends. Great happy hour timeframe (Monday-Friday 2-6pm). Heads up, the happy hour wine flight wines are ONLY available during happy hour.
name: Copper Vine
categories: Nightlife, Pubs, Event Planning & Services, Wine Bars, Bars, Gastropubs, Restaurants, Venues & Event Spaces

text:
Good variety of salads, smoothies, and sandwiches. Not the super-upscale, organic, kale & quinoa type of choices; however, chopped fruits and salad ingredients looked fresh and they had many options, including soymilk, whey protein, yogurt, orange sherbet (but not the wildberry listed), & peanut butter. When I asked if I could substitute honey (which was listed as an ingredient in my smoothie), I was told the smoothie would not have had honey, anyway, so I couldn't substitute anything for it. Smoothie was good, nice texture, not too sweet.

Place is clean, with tables to sit. The older couple that was working when I went were efficient. Refrigerator for bottled drinks. Takes visa/MC/Disc/cash (no sign for AmEx). Nice to see a place like this in town!

(Just an "update" to respond to the owner, I originally found this place on Yelp. There were no reviews, but I was in the city, looking for a smoothie, and intrigued enough to take the risk. Glad I did :)
name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food

text: Pretty good preparation on the salads BUT the lady that runs it can be very moody at times almost to the point of being rude. Her husband is a sweet heart. One time the women was extremely rude and had the nerve to charge for an extra butter. So when you go inside you pick the size of your salad and then either you can get bread or a banana but this time I ordered the bread and I must say they're bread rolls are really good but the little tub of butter they give you is not even enough to butter the whole bread so when she charged me I was a little taken back surprised to say the least. Love their salads that's why I rated them them a 3. But their customer service I would definitely give them 2. Size of place is nice.
name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food

text: I love this place! I tried to come here for lunch as much as possible when I attended Rutgers. I miss coming here and seeing the lovely couple that run the place. They're always so nice! The salads are great and affordable, I am a huge fan of the green goddess dressing. They give you a generous portion and I really miss coming here! Would highly recommend it if you're in the area.
name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food

text: Fresh fruits & salads has amazing salads and smoothies but make sure you order ahead of time. The owners are very old and move slowly so if you're running here on your lunch break like I was you won't have 40 minutes to wait. But, I did enjoy my food and smoothie ! The dream mix smoothie is amazing as well as creating your own salad with fresh toppings such as chick peas, eggs, tomatoes, peppers, ham, etc.
name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food

text: I eat here probably twice a week... I love that i can fax my order in and it be ready when I arrive because there is ALWAYS a rush! I don't stray from my usual so can't provide many options, but will say get you a soy surprise smoothie! Yummy!
name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food

text:
This is the most straightforward name for a business you will ever see. However, don't forget their delicious smoothies and protein shakes! I love this place for a healthy lunch. All of the salads are huge and under $10. I got a make your own salad with spinach, grilled chicken, feta, beets, sundried tomatoes, and carrots for only TEN DOLLARS! Plus, it was a large and kept me full! If you do not want a side of bread they give you a banana which is great for those watching their carbs! 
Salad toppings are extensive, and include all your standard veggies, cheeses, and lean proteins. There is also a pasta salad you can top your salad with. To make things even better there are about 20 different dressings, including multiple fat free dressings. There are tables to sit for lunch and meter parking is outside (I never have trouble finding a spot). 
The couple working here is so nice. If you come here for lunch you will have a great meal and experience! I love supporting this local business.
name: Fresh Fruits & Salads
categories: Juice Bars & Smoothies, Restaurants, Fruits & Veggies, Salad, Specialty Food, Food
